title: Love this app
body: I started with Noom but tracking my food was the only part of that program that seemed useful to me and I didn‚Äôt like it much even for that. With Noom there were a lot of clicks required and irritating pop up messages following every single food entry. So I decided to for search for a free app just to track food. Next I tried MyFitnessPal. That lasted less than a day. Then I tried MyPlate. I‚Äôve been using it for about a week and I‚Äôm loving it. It‚Äôs easy to use, clean interface, minimal junk, ads, or other annoyances. Plus it has features I didn‚Äôt even know I wanted like showing how close my intake tracks to my goal percentages for each macronutrient. The goals are also nicely customizable. I‚Äôve already lost a couple pounds. Now I‚Äôve signed up for one of their meal plans which is something I wasn‚Äôt even considering before trying the app. I‚Äôm super happy to have a grocery list of healthy foods all prepared for me (big time and effort saver there) and to try some new recipes this coming week. My only request would be if they could offer the option to double or quadruple recipe quantities since I‚Äôm cooking for a family. But obviously I can do that myself. At the price of free this thing is a heck of a deal. 5 stars. Update: The first day‚Äôs meal plan arrived. The meals didn‚Äôt appeal to me so I‚Äôm probably not going to do that after all. Still loving the app though.
response: Hi J! Thanks for your feedback! We‚Äôre glad you are enjoying MyPlate. We're constantly looking for new ways to improve our site and apps, and we love getting feedback as it helps guide our process moving forward.

title: Just Learning
body: I am one of ‚Äúthose people‚Äù that never had to worry about my weight...until I hit 60 and quit smoking. Because I used to be able to eat whatever I wanted, whenever I wanted, I never understood the correlation between food and gaining weight. Fast forward five years and I packed on the weight. I‚Äôve been living with it for three years and decided it was time to start losing some of this again. I knew any fad diet was not going to work for me, so I decided to start paying attention to what I‚Äôm eating and how much I‚Äôm eating. Not having any idea what foods are high in calories or carbs or proteins, I decided to download an app to help me. After reading the reviews on My Plate I decided to try it and I was absolutely amazed at how easy this was to do. Not only am I able to keep track of my portions (calories), but I am learning which foods are high in carbs, fat and protein. I am almost 4 weeks in and have lost 4 1/2 pounds. The only thing I don‚Äôt like about it is how the list of food I have entered is saved. If you originally enter it for lunch and another time do you want to have it for dinner you have to search for it in the list under lunch and then add it to dinner for that day. I also wish there were some sort of organization to it so you could sort them alphabetically and be able to delete ones that you know you‚Äôre not going to use anymore.  If there is a way to delete them, I can‚Äôt find it. Other than that, I think this app is well worth it.

title: More Accessibility
body: I have been using MyFitnessPal for a long time and was looking for a refreshing new experience. Came across your app and actually I think I prefer it more than MyFitnessPal, the concept and it‚Äôs compatibility with the iPhone‚Äôs software makes me (an iPhone user) want to rather use this app instead of MyFitnessPal. I want to make this my go to app except for one feature, the fact that the color choice of the app is in relation to your iPhone being in light mode or dark mode. As someone who prefers having my phone in dark mode, when I opened the app and saw the screen dark, it was a turn off for me. Some people may think otherwise and prefer the dark mode, but to me it gave a depressing vibe. As small as this feature is, if I‚Äôm going to use an app for every meal to count calories I for sure want it to look appealing to me. I think a simple fix for this would be to give the person the option to choose whether or not they want it to be light or dark in the app settings, and to not have it based off your iPhone settings. As nit picky as this critique is, this one feature would make me switch from MyFitnessPal to your app in an instant without hesitation, but until then I‚Äôll be staying on MyFitnessPal solely because of the ability to have my screen continue to be white, even when I‚Äôm in dark mode. This is a great app, but adding in a little personal accessibility would blow the competition out of the water.
response: Hi Tonioo U! We very much appreciate your feedback and I have passed along your comments to our product development team.  As we are always adding new content and features to the app, we love getting feedback as it helps guide our designs and tools moving forward.

title: Husband lost 70 lbs just tracking calories
body: I was using a different app that my PT was using. I told my husband to get an app like this. Once he got MyPlate and he was tracking his calories he realized more of what he was eating. He was better able to avoid foods that were full of empty calories and keeping track of his foods helped him see what was making him sick and what didn‚Äôt. It tracks carbs, sugars, fats, sodium, and proteins. (More than this but that‚Äôs all we use). Once he realized how much he was actually eating he started making better choices a little at a time. He wanted to see how much he could lose before he started working out and he quickly lost 60lbs. He found that he was eating more than 10,000 empty calories before. Now he keeps it to under 2,000net calories. (It subtracts calories burnt that are tracked with his iWatch- I have an iFITNESS. Which is much cheaper and it syncs to this app as well). He loves it. It‚Äôs like a game to him.  I tell everyone about this app because I‚Äôm so proud of him. Literally, all the motivation he needed was to be shown how much garbage he was eating. Now, because he‚Äôs eating less processed sugar, his sores heal faster, he‚Äôs off his gout medication,($200/month) and we‚Äôre hoping he‚Äôll be off his bp meds next visit. His teeth are in better condition without all the soda. He can‚Äôt even stand to eat all the junk because it makes him sick. LOVE THIS APP!
response: Wow!! Great review and great story! We're so happy for you and your husband. Thanks for sharing :)

title: Saving my future
body: Before I had gotten this app, I seriously didn't feel confident in what I was eating at all. This is is saving me and here's why. I'm 14. Before you start yapping about how I shouldn't be dieting and blah blah blah, I have very good reasons so try to hear me out. Both of my parents have very bad health and struggle with their weight a lot. Cancer runs in the family pretty strongly, and my father has hearth issues. My mom is always in pain in her joints and we are pretty sure she has a type of arthritis. I'm currently 158 pounds which is a lot- especially for my age. If I continue eating the way I do, living the way I do, or drinking as little as I do now...I could potentially not live a long healthy life. If I eat healthy and I workout everyday and try to drink 80 oz of water, I think I would actually be a healthy human. Will it stop me from cancer, arthritis, and blood pressure issues? Maybe not, but when you are healthy and living a healthy lifestyle, I believe you have a bigger chance in survival. I have been using this app everyday for about a week and it makes me really happy to say that I am losing weight as we speak! My skin looks really nice and I am finally feeling confident in my body. I am so happy to have this app, it's a life changer and a life beginner. I love that it doesn't have pop up ads either. Thank you creators ‚ú®üíõ‚ú®.
response: Hi there! Thank you for that awesome review. We're glad we can be a part of your commitment to a healthy lifestyle.

title: Great app! Even without purchasing the subscription
body: This app is great! I have been overweight for the last 20 years and I never thought that I would be able to lose the weight.  I downloaded this app with pretty low expectations. After using it for a few days and seeing everything that it helps you keep track of, I was addicted. Between accurately tracking my caloric intake with this app, and eating minimal processed foods, I have lost 40 lbs in about two and a half months and I am officially in a healthy weight range again! You can set a goal of how much weight you want to lose (or gain) and it will show you your daily calorie goal. It has a great graphing function that will help you keep track of progress for the last year. It tracks your daily calories, weight, BMI, carb intake, sugar intake, and so much more. Watching the line on the graph go down for the last few months has really kept me motivated. I couldn‚Äôt have lost the weight without using this app. If you are serious about keeping track of your diet and becoming healthier, I highly recommend the free download. I‚Äôm still using the free version, but I am so impressed with the results, I am going to purchase it tonight to see all of the other stats that I can track.
response: Hi Djvyanksfn! It's great to hear the results you've had using the app. We're constantly looking for new ways to improve our site and apps, and we love getting feedback as it helps guide our process moving forward.

title: Good
body: *Updated* 1/9/18
response: Hi Marcineus! Thank you for your review and feedback. We have identified a bug with the green pop up button that you're using to create a custom food. The team is working on a fix for this issue right now! In the meantime, please follow the steps below to create a custom food item:

title: Easy to Use, mostly
body: This app provides a lot of features and resources! You can keep track of calories, consumption of water, weight, calories burned, etc. They also have a Stronger Livestrong meal plan that includes work outs as well! I‚Äôve just started it, and I‚Äôve felt great so far! But now the server has seemed to entirely crashed. I can‚Äôt run anything on the app. I couldn‚Äôt log into anything or pull up my meal plan at all. They also email you your meals for the day and if you click on the image, it‚Äôll take you to the recipe. Now when I click these links, they are unable to load. I have fantastic connection at my location so I found this odd. My phone and the app are entirely up to date, so I tried turning my phone off and on and uninstalling and reinstalling the app. Now I can‚Äôt login, sign up, or use the ‚Äúforgot password‚Äù feature. Nothing will load, just keep getting a network error.
response: Hello! Thank you for your feedback. Due to an outage at our data center, MyPlate experienced some functionality issues. This has been resolved and the current app version should be 100% functional. Thank you for your patience during the time our team was working on fixing the problem. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. Your wellness means so much to us and our team is committed to your ongoing health and fitness success. If you have any further questions, please reach us at support@livestrong.com.

title: A decent tracking app
body: I like many of the features of this app. It offers good macro tracking and some vitamin/mineral tracking. It‚Äôs simple to enter your food and I do find most of the products I use are listed, with a few exceptions. The search feature is lacking a bit. A lot of times I can type exactly the name of a product into the search and it won‚Äôt find it, and sometimes just pulls up weird totally unrelated stuff. Often I have to scan the barcode to find things. Overall I think the use of this is generally fairly intuitive and more simple in layout than similar apps like MyFitnessPal. It took me a minute to figure out the excercise tracking, which I think could be set up a little better (for ease of use, the same setup as the food logging) but it‚Äôs not hard to use.
response: Hi there! Thank you for your in depth review and feedback and I have passed your comments to our Product Team.

title: Starting again - working better now
body: Update - so far so good. Apple Watch Activity tracking is good. I lost the meals I had created and haven‚Äôt tried it again. I had written to app support and they responded - a wonderful sign!

title: Ideas to make it better
body: I love this app I would track my calories by hand before and this just makes it better and easier. I would love if you had an option to pay yearly not just monthly for the gold plan because if you add that I will defiantly do the gold plan. I would be good if you did like a silver and bronze plan too that have other options. Also you should add a ** drink water remind** where we can have it remind us a few times a day. And it would be cool if we could have friends through the app and see each others calories and support each other because I do this with my mom but we have to go over calories when we‚Äôre together because I can‚Äôt just add her like a friend. Another idea in the meal prep you should have a weeks worth of recipes when you click that tab and you could change them every week. You could do it for the gold of course. Hope you read this post and get back to me. I really would love to see some of these updates it would make the app better and the pay by year would be perfect not everyone likes having another monthly bill.
response: Hi zmirandaz! Thank you for your review and feedback! Our most popular Gold membership option is our yearly plan! It's a once yearly payment. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions. As we are always adding new content and features to the site and app, we love getting feedback as it helps guide our designs and tools moving forward.

title: Almost perfect
body: The app is very useful when it comes to logging meals and being able to keep track of my calories. I love that it shows me my macro total percentage-ages for the day as well. Micronutrient info and daily goals are neat but not totally necessary esp with the sodium thresholds and such available to view online. However, it is a very common and free feature of other meal tracking apps to be able to create a meal (with however many servings of individual ingredients)  and then say how many servings that meal makes. Unfortunately, with My Plate when you click on a meal you‚Äôve made, it lists all of the ingredients individually. This makes it very tedious, if not impossible, to accurately input homemade recipes. This is very annoying since I do a lot of cooking at home and meal prepping. I would love to see this one feature changed. Other than that this app is great - especially including all of the online features it allows you to input about your starting point with your body measurements along with weight. The graphs are encouraging. I‚Äôd love to give 5 stars when I‚Äôm able to make my own ‚Äúserving‚Äù sizes for homemade meals!

title: Easy! Very encouraging!
body: This is a very comprehensive app listing nutrition, water, weight, exercise and daily comparisons!  Easy to use!  Love how it gently reminds you to log in meals. Has nearly every food listed!  Love how we can see calories /weight/ exercise/ water etc by day and totals compared. Do wish it had more brand name foods but it has enough to find something similar. The ONLY negative is many similar items are listed as anyone can enter anything. And we can‚Äôt really trust all those entries in calories since they rarely ever match each other. Suggest: Can you block an entry that is same as other database entries by name and size?  And can you require users enter a quantity / size for items they enter? Sooo many user entries show ‚Äú 1 portion ‚Äù as the size but don‚Äôt say How Big that portion is!??   Or they say ‚Äú1 slice‚Äù....they don‚Äôt say how big is the slice?  I see many listing a burger size as ‚Äú1 burger‚Äù?? How big is that?  Sizes can be from 3 oz to 16 oz!?  Those entries are useless. But do love how we can enter something unique that we don‚Äôt see listed...just need details so others can use those too. Thx for a comprehensive app!

title: Please improve
body: I really liked this app for a while because it has better connectivity and syncing with my other Apple activity tracking apps and devices than ‚ÄúMyFitnessPal‚Äù. And I like the simplicity of the user interface.  ALSO no ads!! However after using it for some weeks I have a few complaints: 1. it doesn‚Äôt have the best foods database. Many unverified foods that have no information about quantity other than ‚Äú1 serving‚Äù. 2. Search engine is weak. 3. Also the measurement increments are not small enough, and no ability to change to decimals. 4. It doesn‚Äôt remember quantity of a particular food from the previous day so that has to be selected every time.

title: Limited app; don‚Äôt bother with membership
body: This app is useful for tracking calories, though MyFitness Pal has way more products in their database than My Plate. I had a hard time finding many of the things I eat in their database and ended up guessing a lot; their portion size presets mostly didn‚Äôt make sense with the foods I was trying to enter either. But if you just want to loosely track activities and what you are eating, this app will do the trick.
response: Thanks for installing and trying MyPlate, and thank you for making time to write a review!

title: Solid tracking app
body: I have been using this app for a few days now after taking a break.   The meal plan seemed like something fun to try, but I just don‚Äôt like it.  The recipes are not cohesive, and there is a lot of waste with the ingredients (only using 1/2 cup blueberries for the whole week) if I were to actually use this for shopping.  I don‚Äôt like contributing to so much food waste.  Also, I did not get a list of the meals and recipes until the day I start.  This is not good for planning my lunches at work, and puts me in a rush on Monday morning.
response: Hi bs331467! We appreciate your honest feedback and have passed along your comments to our product development team. As we are always adding new content and features to the site and app, we love getting feedback as it helps guide our designs and tools moving forward. In the meantime, I encourage to search the catalogue of recipes at livestrong.com. You can search for recipes using the search field in the upper-right.

title: Love it.
body: The app is helping me lose weight by helping me count carbs.  At first I was using the free version just to count calories.  I was doing great in the calorie department, but my weight wasn‚Äôt changing much.  I dug a bit deeper, and thanks to the other features of the app I realized I was eating carbs mostly.  The app opened my eyes to the macros, and I did more research online.  I limited my carbs intake to under 50%, and mind you, I hadn‚Äôt been eating candy, cakes, cookies or snacks before, my weight started dropping off at about two pounds per week.  The app taught me that there are carbs in beans and vegetables, and that I need to pay attention to the macros in all the foods, including those that I had thought healthy options; my vegan home cooked meals were packed with carbs.  By balancing my diet better, I actually started feeling better almost immediately.  The fogginess is gone, I have energy, I don‚Äôt drag myself from task to task, and I‚Äôm at my lowest weight in years, and my BMI is normal.  I will reach my weight goal in a couple of weeks.  I am eating differently, and I don‚Äôt miss my old food habits. I don‚Äôt crave sugar.  I feel good.  Thank you, App!
response: Hi there! It's so great hearing your amazing story. We're glad we could be a part of it.

title: Great Concept
body: I like this app a lot, my biggest concern, is that you should be allowed to set your age, because teens and below need a certain amount of calories, and not being a leg to set this, can make it seem like it is okay to eat less than the necessary amount regularly. I also think that there are a lot of uneducated people in the chat feature. I understand that it is hard to educate everyone, but my suggestion, would be that when you sign up for the app, to have to go through a quick flip through, things like self confidence and doing it for you, and about children needing a specific amount of calories, balancing nutrition with exercise, drinking water, etc. I also think that this app should incorporate sleep, because sleep is very important to staying healthy, because we shouldn‚Äôt be doing these things to lose weight, or be pretty, we should be doing them to be healthy and have a better quality of life. I also think that maybe there should be a kids version that not only tracks basic health things, but also teaches kids about nutrition with fun games, and entertaining exercise, it could be a fun way to get they whole family involved.
response: Hi emesm2! Thanks for the review. We appreciate your feedback. When you create your account, you are asked your birthday. This is how the app determines your age. The minimum age to use the app is 13.

title: Good app, a few tweaks could make it a great one
body: Hello, I‚Äôve been using this app for a few weeks now to maintain my weight and keep track of macros and it has mostly been great.

title: Defaulting units to ‚Äúserving‚Äù in subsequent recordings is a major flaw
body: Overall this app works well, save for a single flaw that is bad enough to make me switch to a different calorie counting app. The list of foods is extensive (if a little difficult to search sometimes) but the problem occurs when you try to record something you've already recorded. When you first record a food you‚Äôre given a variety of options to declare how much you consumed (a serving, X cups, Y grams, etc.). But subsequent records only give you the option for the unit ‚Äúserving‚Äù, and the unit for serving is given. But it‚Äôs not always reasonable to measure things by the default unit. For instance, I added 1/2 cup of walnuts to a salad, and the next day ate about 10g of walnuts (i.e. about 5 walnut halves) as a snack. Because I had already recorded walnuts I had no option other than to record my calories as a fraction of a cup. Why? Clearly there are multiple measurement units available for most foods during the first recording, so why take those options away for subsequent recordings. I want to keep using this app, but this issue is just too frustrating, especially when there are so many alternative calorie counter apps out there.
response: Hello and thank you for this feedback! We're so sorry for the inconvenience. This is something that our team is aware of and is working to correct in a future update. Please watch the app store and our community for updates!

title: Good when starting out but food list needs updating and expansion
body: This app has been helpful in terms of forcing me to track everything that passes my lips and being aware of what I'm eating. I also find the chat helpful for the most part. My biggest problems with the app are the food list and the exercise list. The food list needs to be updated more often to add foods and needs to include mixed food made from scratch. For example, I made a bag of mixed dry beans with low fat reduced sodium chicken broth last night. I had to add each kind of bean one at a time, add the broth, add the onions, celery, etc. and then estimate how much I ate of each item. Ugh. The exercise app needs an overhaul and to include more types of everyday activities as exercise. I have lost 5 pounds so far. I am about a month in now and for the most part I still feel this is a fairly good app for tracking your foods and macros. I feel less positive about the chat portion and I've decided not to use that aspect of the app any longer. There is 1 person in particular who thinks he is Gods gift to the food and diet world and I've grown tired of his incredibly nasty approach to everyone. He's The school yard bully.
response: Hi RiverTideRed, thank you very much for your review and feedback! We have a team that moderates our Community. If you ever feel that a post violates our Community Guidelines, please be sure to email us at support@livestrong.com to have it removed. We will pass the rest of your feedback on to our developers! Thank you again for reaching out.

title: Food log problems
body: I would probably stop using MyFitnessPal and switch to this, but there are some huge issues with this app. That I believe can be easily fixed. As far as food logging, I have to constantly make "my own food" because the bar codes i can or items I search for are not being found, this gets really annoying and begins to be a huge waste of time. With the other app I am able to find and scan in all the items, that I can't with this app which makes it much easier and faster. Also when I precede to "add my food" because I'm now forced to because of the lack of food items within the app, it only asks for fat, protein and carbs, which I find to not be enough information as far as nutrition, on MyFitnessPal, it asks me for sodium, fiber, sugar, vitamins, etc. which I think makes more sense. I'm not sure if this is only with the basic version ü§î.
response: Hello and thank you for your feedback! We are working on expanding our database to include more of the foods you love to track! We're also working on adding more customization options when creating a custom food. Thanks again for your comments!

title: Has massive potential but not there yet
body: I love the look, feel and options of this app ... to a point. Where is it lacking? 1) When attempting to change my calories goal manually, it doesn‚Äôt respond right away and I have to keep fixing it; 2) When trying to set my carbs, protein, and fat percentages, it only gives me the choice of percentages in 5% increments, not grams and not smaller percent increments; 3) When the app calculates grams based on percentages while inside the goals section, the app rounds down (22.5 becomes 22). However, when the app calculates grams while inside the meal tracking section the app rounds up (22.5 becomes 23). I know I am a control freak and some people think these are minor things. But over one‚Äôs own body ... we all should be control freaks. If these things were fixed, it would be a most amazing app!

title: Great, but could be even better!
body: I‚Äôve really enjoyed using this app, and it‚Äôs really easy to use. The only issue I have found is the amount of inaccuracies in the stored food information. It would be really cool to have a user rating system to help verify the information of the foods listed. For example, users could upvote or downvote certain foods based on accuracy. Also, there should be a way to report/give feedback on foods that have incorrect information. I have found that even some of the ‚Äúverified‚Äù foods are wrong. For example, I compared the information from the package to the information on the app from the bacon that I had this morning. The app had the nutritional information for raw bacon listed instead of cooked. Who eats raw bacon? The same thing happens with boxed foods that have the unprepared and prepared calories listed.

title: A little buggy
body: NOTE: I am only marking this with one star  to make sure the developer sees this message. The app deserves five stars (*****) which I will gladly change it to once the two following bugs are fixed.
response: Hi Game Player 353! We are aware of the bug with adding exercise and apologize for the inconvenience! While we work on this, please follow the steps below to erase these incorrect entries:

title: Amazing
body: The best thing about this app is that it is simple and easy to use. I‚Äôve been lifting seriously for the past year and went through a bulking phase where I went from 178 to 205 in a little over 6 months, in large part due to this app. A lot of the things I had been eating before using this app I didn‚Äôt know the exact makeup of the food I was intaking and with this app it helped me so much. So many other apps I tried for my meal prepping wanted to give me different things to eat and to try this and that, when all I wanted was something that could track my calories, carbs, protein, and fat intake. It was a blessing to have this. The ‚Äúmy food‚Äù part of this makes it quick and easy when, like many competitive powerlifters, you‚Äôre on a strict diet and eat the same foods at the same time every day for weeks on end. Now that I‚Äôm in the cutting phase again, I set my calorie intake level that I want, and I can track it throughout the day. Overall, amazing for those who do dieting seriously like I do.

title: Great, but with a Bad Change
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for a long time, and generally, it‚Äôs awesome. The UI is really nice, and it makes it easy to track things quickly and keep tabs on nutrition. One key change, however, has disappointed me. In a recent update, they changed the weight progress chart from a scatter plot to bar graph. Not a big deal, right? Unfortunately, this UI change has made it look like my weight has hardly changed at all over time, while previously it showed weight changes as dramatic, which I found encouraging. This new change is frustrating and makes it harder to be excited about my progress. I‚Äôm not sure if this review will reach any devs, but I‚Äôd like to hear their thought process on this change.
response: Thanks for your review and feedback. We‚Äôve just released an update to the app addressing these concerns. Please update to version 5.31.0. If you still have questions or concerns, please send us an email at¬†support@livestrong.com.

title: By far one of the most useful apps I have on my phone!!!
body: So I‚Äôm starting a calorie deficit to try and lose some weight and this app is perfect for calculating calories. I‚Äôm also trying to stick to a 50:30:20 meal plan when it comes to carbs, proteins, and fats. It gives me a percentage of each for every meal I have and a total at the end of the day. I can enter my calorie goal and it will tell me how many calories I have left for each day. It also has other features I didn‚Äôt even know I needed but now rely on, like different articles addressing an assortment of nutritional topics or an entire meal plan where is gives you healthy recipes for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. By far my favorite health & nutrition app I‚Äôve ever used. I‚Äôve tried MyFitnessPal, Noom, Weight Watchers, and MyPlate is by far my favorite and most useful. It also has little to no ad interferences so I‚Äôm never interrupted by them! Overall, 100% recommend it to anyone who wants to keep track of their calories and nutrition!
response: Hi swaetiee! Thank you for that amazing review. We're glad we are able to provide you with the tools to help you meet your goals.

title: Great app for tracking!
body: I really enjoy using this tracker, even with just the free version. The aesthetic is very nice to me compared to MFP. I like that you are able to connect your fitness tracker (Apple Watch for me) and I also like that it has meal recommendations depending on your goals. I love that you are able to put in your own food if it‚Äôs not listed and build your own meals so you can add all of its contents at once, making tracking oatmeal and smoothies and my other favorite food concoctions much easier. Only downside is that you can‚Äôt track only a portion of the meals if you make more than one serving (for example I made muffins and input all the ingredients I used into a meal, until I saw I would only be able to track eating the whole batch rather than 1/6 of the meal). Besides that, I like that there‚Äôs a notification option and how you can schedule daily reminders to track.
response: Hi markkraube! Thank you for your review and feedback. We appreciate your support.

title: Great but approximations on macros
body: I really like the features, especially scanning in food barcodes! It is a little difficult entering the nutrition data of a portion of a complex meal, but I tend to keep things simple. It I has forced me to take a look at my actual intake and measure my portions. A simple kitchen scale is great with this app when eating whole food.
response: Hi there! Thank you for the review and feedback. We're glad you like the app. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us at support@livestrong.com.

title: User since 2008
body: UPDATE: MAJOR DATA LOSS. I just spent hours re-entering two months worth of workout information. I am absolutely done with this app and cannot recommend it to anyone.
response: Hello Sharp11Girl, please email us at support@livestrong.com for assistance with recovering your data.

title: This app helped me drop 60 pounds of fat
body: To give backstory, I was an offensive lineman in high school. I was D2 quality coming out of my junior year. My senior year was filled with injuries and eventually I needed shoulder surgery. This surgery and the subsequent recovery process lead me to peruse academics as my means of scholarship. After I had decided this, I was left with about 3 more months of physical therapy. After my physical therapy was done, I was left an atrophied mess. The muscles I once used to push and block were now faded and flabby. I was fat. During my years of football, I had always wanted to be a leaner, more athletic version of myself. I now had the ability to do so, no longer needing the weight for football purposes.

title: Beneficial to my weight loss and muscle gain.
body: In July of 2018 I was 204. That kind of weight on my 5‚Äô7‚Äù frame was not good or healthy. I began exercising and was struggling to notice any loss of weight. I heard about MyPlate and began tracking my calories. Being able to monitor my Proteins, Carbs, and Fats allowed me to know exactly what I was getting from one meal to the next. By being able to see if I was meeting my daily macro nutrient goals allowed me to adjust my nutrition accordingly and the weight began to almost fall off. One week I decided to measure everything on a scale to input exactly what my caloric intake was. Not that I would recommend this for everyone or for any consistent time, but in that week I lost at least a pound a day and still felt energized due to getting exactly what was needed for my body to lose weight and still maintain action. I do recommend this app to anyone looking to lose weight and/or gain mass.

title: Helps you track your effort and results
body: This app will NOT do the weight loss for you, but it will help you to realize you had the power to lose weight through moderation and dedication all along.
response: Hi there! Thank you for that incredible review. We're pleased that MyPlate was able to help you meet your goals.

title: I really like this app.... but had to delete it
body: I downloaded a bunch of calorie trackers to test them side by side, and I think My Plate is one of the best. I love that it has a verified badge next to items when you search, because I feel overwhelmed by the amount of choices/repeats in most other calorie trackers. The layout is easy to use and the ads are unintrusive in the free version. However, the chat/forum that I thought would be helpful to me is absolutely overrun with 14 & 15 year old girls who are trying to get from 112 to 109. Girls.... live your life and stop starving yourself. It was so depressing to read and amounted to about every other post as far as I could see. The community was great about telling them to cut it out but it didn‚Äôt seem to help. I had to delete the app off my phone because I couldn‚Äôt handle it. My advice to the developers is to ban teenagers off this app- most teens do not need to be dieting, and if they do for health reasons it should be with the help of a doctor, not an app.
response: Thank you for this feedback! We do our best to moderate our community and definitely support managing weight in a healthy way. Our moderators work hard to convey this message to our users. Please don't hesitate to reach out at support@livestrong.com with any further questions or concerns. Thanks again.

title: Inappropriate Notifications
body: I downloaded this app to be more aware of what I eat and how that applies to my fitness goals. My overall goal isn‚Äôt just to lose weight, but to gain muscle and get more fit in general. However, this app is very much tailored to weight loss.
response: Hello and thank you for this valuable feedback. We will certainly look through the notifications that we send and make the appropriate updates. We want this app to be encouraging and positive for all of our users. Please send us an email at support@livestrong.com if you'd like to share any further feedback. We appreciate it!

title: Really easy
body: This app is really easy to use and it‚Äôs also very visually appealing to the eye with your proteins and such being colorcoded so you know to pay attention! The only thing I would suggest to improve is the comment section and the sugar intake system. It would be nice if there was a reply button to other people‚Äôs comments in the community to make things easier to write and read. It‚Äôs kind of just a bunch of comments and to understand what people are talking about you‚Äôd have to read ALL of the comments instead of just the reply section or the original comment that was replied to. It would also be nice if the sugars could be separated from added sugars so it can be clear how much added sugar we should be eating and how much natural sugars we should be eating. As a fruit lover, I love eating my fruits with a low-calorie dip but it‚Äôs super hard to tell if I‚Äôm going over my added sugars or my natural sugars.
response: Hi solimarrrrrrrrr! Thanks for reaching out! We very much appreciate your feedback and I have passed along your comments to our product development team.  As we are always adding new content and features to the and app, we love getting feedback as it helps guide our designs and tools moving forward. Many thanks!

title: Solid app for weight loss, but could use a few tweaks
body: I am very pleased with My Plate.  I have lost 40 pounds so far, so there is no doubt that the app works well.  There are a few areas where it could be improved.  1.  Once you create a meal, there is no way to edit that meal later in the free version - I don‚Äôt know if the Gold version allows for editing.  This is an inconvenience that could be easily fixed.  2.  I have a recurring item that I am unable to get rid of.  It is not on repeat, and just shows up randomly every few days.  3. The calories database unfortunately contains some false calorie counts for several food items...even some that are ‚Äúverified‚Äù.  I expect this is due to the social nature of the app and people entering incorrect data.  So I always scan barcodes, and for other items when I doubt I do online research. Overall - I love the weight loss I‚Äôm experiencing with My Plate, it would just be nice to have a few of the items above addressed.
response: Hello! Congratulations on your success and thank you for this feedback. You can edit a custom meal by swiping left on the meal and selecting the "edit" button that appears. Please send us an email at support@livestrong.com so that we can address the repeating item issue immediately! Lastly, we do not currently offer keto meal plans or recipes so we'd love some more feedback on why you feel the app pushes this diet. If you care to share, please send us an email at the address listed above. Feedback such as yours helps us with our design and planning. Thanks again!

title: Very handy
body: I decided to download an app to track my meals because I was concerned about what I was eating. I‚Äôve been a vegetarian for a few years but recently became lactose intolerant and wanted to make sure I was getting carbs/proteins/fats in a good balance. It‚Äôs easy to use and gives a nice breakdown with handy graphics, and it also gives nice recipe recommendations.

title: Recent update is frustrating
body: Update: The update after my review help resolved most of my issue with the app. There are some things that could use work, like the delay when adding or removing foods, but it‚Äôs minor things. I do wish there was a way to add new foods through barcode.
response: Hi there! Glad to hear that the update resolved the issues you were experiencing. MyPlate has a barcode scanner that you can access in any of the meal periods by tapping the barcode icon in the upper left corner of the screen. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions.

title: Best food log, period.
body: I would had given this application a 4/5 if I did not have an Apple Watch. If you have another tracker, it's okay, the interface with the Apple Watch is superior, in my opinion. I used to use this app with a Fitbit, and this app had a hard time synchronizing and pushing/relieving information.

title: Poor customer service
body: I paid for the extra subscription to gain access to extra features, but realized after that the extra features were oversold by the app. There‚Äôs absolutely no reason at all to pay the extra subscription cost. Not only is there nothing original about the nutrition materials you get with the subscription, but the shopping lists are outrageous. Aside from that you really don‚Äôt get anything else from the app except access to extra data points, which don‚Äôt do anything at all except inform you about what you‚Äôve consumed. Their server went down for several days, and during that time no one was able to log meals unless it was something they had already eaten that was stored in local memory. I inquired about the issue and asked for a refund, and Kali let me know that the server was down but ignored my request for a refund. I replied again to thank her for letting me know about the server and asked for a refund again and that request was ignored. I guess I‚Äôll have to go to the consumer protection agency to get my money back.
response: Hi there! We're so sorry! Unfortunately, the data outage affected most of our users and we have a very small customer support team. Your request for a refund has not been intentionally ignored. We received hundreds of emails during this outage, so it's taking us a bit longer than normal to respond to everyone. We appreciate your patience! If you've upgraded through an in app purchase, please contact Apple directly for a refund. We apologize, but unfortunately, we are unable to process refunds for in app purchases via iTunes as these subscriptions are managed by Apple. This is part of Apple's in app subscription policy across the board. However you can contact Apple directly for refund requests for any of our apps:

title: Create a Meal is not helpful.
body: The overall interfacing of this app is good: better than MyFitnessPal, but a step behind Noom‚Äôs (which, by the way, has terrible, horrible, no good, very bad customer support, and nonexistent coaching as advertised, so is deleted).  Entering database foods is simple, and the home page snapshot layout of your daily data is clean and easy to read.
response: Hello poschpic! Thank you for your feedback and review! We are working on bringing a custom Recipe function to the app and hope to include this in a future update!

title: Easy and effective
body: This app works because of its simplicity and its persistence. It is easy because I don‚Äôt have to look up a bunch of recipes or nutritional values. Most everything I eat is already on a list I select. Even the junk food.  It is persistent through reminders that make it almost impossible to ignore. I started by tracking everything I ate without trying to change anything. This gave me a few weeks of data showing all my bad habits. Even after drinking cokes and eating way too much Chick Fil A, I found myself staying under my calorie goal. My calories burned are easy to enter by selecting items from a list such as my favorites ‚Äî walking the dog and gardening. After establishing a routine of using the app, I started focusing more on the nutrition values. I have only used the basic free version of the app.

title: App changed my life
body: My doctor gave me the bad news that my blood pressure was high, my cholesterol was high, was prediabetic, And surprise-surprise... I was overweight. Time to make a change. I started using this app to track my food and get a clear understanding of how I was eating and exercising. Committing to inputting the information was not easy for the first few days but it became a habit. I am down 20% of my original weight and all of the negative information my doctor gave me has been addressed and there‚Äôs no longer a problem. My Apple Watch syncs my activity to the app seamlessly and helps me really understand what I‚Äôve been up to and give me motivation to do a little bit better every day. The real change comes with you, the person using the app, but this app unlocked clarity of understanding and discipline that I‚Äôve never had before.

title: Best free calorie tracking app by far
body: I haven‚Äôt tried any of the paid features, but even the free options allow me to track both meals & water, which is more than most other free apps I downloaded. The design is simple and makes sense. I also participate in a meal kit service which supplies nutritional facts for each meal; this app makes it easy to enter those facts and track and chart those calories & macros. No better free app for this - I checked all the apps recommended by Apple HealthKit. Apps that looked slightly better usually had a cost for the app itself, and/ or anywhere from $10-$40 monthly fee. At $10 for a single month, $5/mo for 6 months, or $3.75/mo for a year, the Gold membership may well be worth it. Having so many free resources in an app is really heartening; I might upgrade to gold just to support this app & it‚Äôs developers. Thank you.
response: Thank you for the awesome review! We love hearing that MyPlate is working well for you. If you have any questions about our Gold membership, please reach out at support@livestrong.com.

title: Skinnyyy
body: I‚Äôm 5‚Äô6 female and I was 178 lbs (I‚Äôm 16)

title: I highly recommend this but have some pet peeves
body: I have used this app on and off for years. I love being able to go back and see my history. My foods and meals are saved. I am not sure if recipes I added years ago are there. My frustration with the new version: I see photos of foods under recipes. But I cannot click on them. I went to the recipe page and typed spicy cauliflower wings in the search. Nothing happened. What a teaser! My other frustration: I eat almost no processed foods. When I type in a food, the corporate foods come up first. So I must always be typing in the word homemade, like homemade pasta. Yes we make our own pasta. And I would pay for the gold version if it calculated calcium. As a Medicare adult, I need 1200 units of calcium a day. My bone density is on the borderline. I need to count and don‚Äôt want all of it to come from supplements. I bet a lot of women would appreciate this addition for their health.

title: App is pretty great, but can only measure 100 grams of food?
body: So the app pretty much has everything I want. I like the food selection, make your own food feature, weight tracking, progress view etc, it‚Äôs all great. There is 1 problem that is major though (for non US people). The grams parameter in the food serving size is limited to 100. People who use metric (everyone in the world except US) have to convert grams to ounces if a serving you eat is over 100 grams. This is actually a pretty lame limitation, since 100 grams is only 3.5 ounces. The reason I‚Äôm using this app in the first place is so I don‚Äôt have to calculate and convert calories myself, so having to convert to ounces is inconvenient. The app is otherwise better than all the other apps I‚Äôve tried, so I‚Äôm gonna keep using it. But it would literally be perfect without this limitation.

title: Great Tracker but Needs Work
body: I recently switched to My Plate from Noom because I have a medical condition that requires me to more closely track certain nutrients. Sodium is a big one for me. I like that My Plate sets a sodium limit for the day and shows my progress so I always know how close I am to my daily limit. However, if I customize my sodium limit, the line graph showing progress doesn‚Äôt work. Also, the last two days, looking at my daily totals by individual day, it looks like I stayed well under my limits. However, I just looked at the progress for the last week and selected sodium. That view shows that I exceeded the sodium limit the last two days. The mg counts are much higher than they show for each day. I have no idea which is right. I don‚Äôt see an option to ask anyone about it. I was so excited when I found that My Plate tracking was so detailed, now I‚Äôm worried that it‚Äôs not reliable.  I hope this gets fixed.
response: Hi Mrs. Greedy B.! Thank you for contacting us at support@livestrong.com. Once we receive additional information, we hope to provide a speedy answer to the issue you are seeing. Many thanks!

title: Love it but there‚Äôs a big issue
body: I love this app for the layout, especially over MyFitnessPal, but there is a big issue that will probably force me to delete the app and track my calories a different way. One day I could search for foods to add to my meal and use the scanner to scan whatever item of food it was I used for that meal. The next day when I tried to type in a food to search, it pops up ‚ÄúNo Results‚Äù. So then I go to use the scanner. That‚Äôs not working either. So THEN I try to manually log in my food. I press ‚ÄúDone‚Äù and it pops up with another message saying it can‚Äôt add that food because it‚Äôs not connected to the server. But then if I exit out of that after pressing ‚ÄúDone‚Äù, go back to add a food and go to the ‚ÄúMy Food‚Äù tab, it pops up with the info I typed in, even though it said it couldn‚Äôt add it. What??? I‚Äôm so confused with it and unfortunately I‚Äôm going to delete the app. The layout and idea of it is nice though.
response: Hello! Thank you for your feedback. Due to an outage at our data center, MyPlate experienced some functionality issues. This has been resolved and the current app version should be 100% functional. Thank you for your patience during the time our team was working on fixing the problem. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. Your wellness means so much to us and our team is committed to your ongoing health and fitness success. If you have any further questions, please reach us at support@livestrong.com.

title: Love the app...but it has stopped working!!
body: I love the app and have been having some success over the last month. However, I can no longer scan barcodes; it gives me an error message and says to check my connection. I cannot enter food manually; it is saying unable to do this now. I cannot enter exercise that I haven‚Äôt done before; it is telling me I‚Äôm not logged in. I cannot enter food that I haven‚Äôt logged before; it says no options are found. I tried logging in to the website online and am unable to do that either. A friend is having the same problems so I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs just me. Is the website/app down? Is there an update pending. As far as I know I didn‚Äôt change any settings so I‚Äôm not sure why everything has stopped working! Very frustrating!
response: Hello lml818! We are so sorry you faced this issue. We have been experiencing some technical difficulties on our servers. The team has been working hard to get it back up. Thanks so much for your patience. If you have any further questions, please reach us at support@livestrong.com.

title: Amazing! Search engine can be frustrating.
body: This is the first tracker app my girlfriend and I had fun using. The water tracker is the best part. We do love EVERYTHING! The most frustrating part is the search engine. Sometimes it shows nothing related to the search or takes awhile to scroll to find the item.

title: Full five stars
body: My dad lost 80 lbs using this and for the first time kept them off. Just got diagnosed with fatty liver so I need to loose the weight to avoid complications. I figured if it worked for him I could try it myself. I am a week into using this for portion control along with exercise and I am down 4 lbs this week!!! The ability to eat whatever you want is the key. No morale busting horrible tasting newspaper trimming food. Just control portions of the good stuff. Combine this with iHealth counting steps, and an exercise bike the gives a calorie count, and I have a baseline that lets me eat and if I go over the -2 lb/week calorie count, I know just how long I need to pedal to get back on track. The barcode scan is also a plus for home food prep. Off to get a decent food scale now to aid in portioning. Can‚Äôt recommend this app enough.

title: Thank you so much.
body: Without this app I don‚Äôt think I would‚Äôve lost what I did. I weighed 201lbs at 5‚Äù7 about a couple months after quarantine had begun. I tried multiple times to lose weight but I always went back and gained it all. I decided that I needed to do something about it. I researched and most websites said that a good tracker helped a lot of people. I said ‚Äú What the heck‚Äù and went to the AppStore and searched up food tracker. I downloaded many but basically all except this one made me pay for a bunch of the basic services. When I found this app I told myself I‚Äôd try it because it didn‚Äôt make me pay to open it lol. Now I weigh 175.7 lbs still at 5‚Äù7. Thank you very much! I am going to continue losing until I reach 160lbs. Then I will continue using it to maintain my weight. Thanks a ton!
response: Hi crusher50! Thank you for that awesome review. Congratulations on your amazing success. We're glad we could be a part of your fitness journey.

title: The Best Weight Loss App, Period!
body: Try it, stick to it, and you WILL lose weight.
response: Thank you for the awesome review! We love hearing about the success you've had with MyPlate. Keep it up! :)

title: Good program, needs further refinement
body: Good program and like how it integrates with my mySugr diabetes monitoring program. Just started using this and it seems good. My only comment is that I would like the option to use weight measurements, ounces or grams, instead of just suggested serving sizes in the food tracking portion. Right now in order to make sure I track exactly the amount I‚Äôve eaten, I have to keep guessing at that by continually trying amounts until I find the closest one. Examples are fruits like apples, oranges, etc. they give you a choice o medium  medium to one person is small or large to another. I weigh my portions so I know what I‚Äôm really eating.
response: Hi mikedd0! Thanks for the review and feedback. Our team is aware of an issue with grams and other measurement units not being displayed as a serving size option. The team is working on a fix for this issue. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.

title: It works - with dedication
body: I‚Äôve lost 50 lbs using this app. It took dedication and a commitment to the long haul, but I‚Äôve never been so fit in my life and I can tell that I‚Äôve made lasting lifestyle changes because of this app.
response: Hi there! Congratulations on your amazing success. We're pleased that we could be a part of your fitness journey.

title: Just got it- already like it!
body: I used to really enjoy the MyFitnessPal app, BUT I logged in recently after not logging in for some time and noticed their changes and updates are not of interest for me and we‚Äôre way out of my price range. The charged service also didn‚Äôt seem worth it, especially since the same service used to be free. I can get a Netflix subscription for cheaper than that, which is exactly why I need a diet app in the first place.
response: Hi there! Thanks for the review. We're happy to hear you are enjoying the MyPlate app.

title: Amazing app! But..
body: I really enjoy how easy it is to track calories and macros with this app. It‚Äôs helped me become so aware of what foods are healthy for me and which aren‚Äôt so healthy. I suggest unlinking any device that you have connected (I had my Apple Watch connected) because it gives you unrealistic calorie burn stats that increase your daily caloric intake... for me I just prefer manually inputting any exercise I did. Something else I would add would be the possibility of changing the calories/macros some products have. You can only change the serving size but there are times when it‚Äôs inaccurate. You should be able to edit how much calories a food has like on MyFitnessPal. Overall though, I like this layout so much more. It‚Äôs helped me lose over 10 lbs in a little over a month!

title: The best out there!!!
body: Honestly, I thought that if I just ate nothing but healthy food, I would be okay with my weight. I didn‚Äôt track macros but ate as much healthy food as I wanted. I started to gain weight and realized that I needed to start tracking my food intake. I tried using a few other apps but when I found this, it beat everything hands down! It‚Äôs simple to use, and even though I don‚Äôt have the full version (yet), it‚Äôs not limited AT ALL like the other apps! I absolutely love it and by tracking my food, I‚Äôm more aware of what I put into my body, making me happyüòÅ

title: Format is comforting
body: This is a strange statement, but after using many apps with the "green to red zone" bars, I found myself eating less and over exercising because I hated seeing the bar slowly inch towards the "red zone". This app is so so easy to use and is set up in a way that makes it so that I want to eat what I need to and so that I want to exercise and drink water to swipe on the cup.
response: Hi Nicole! Thank you so much for this feedback! Our team has worked hard to create a tool that allows our users to manage their health in the best way possible. We appreciate your review!

title: Frustrating
body: This app is highly refined, very clear in design and presentation, but, I find it functionally useless. In stead of recipes that I can build then log servings, I have to disaggregate every meal and parse out ingredient amounts by servings. If I need to edit a meal, that is next to impossible as the ‚Äúedit‚Äù link in the meal is so small, I can‚Äôt activate it to make changes. When setting up my physical characteristics, it pulled in Health Kit information, but on the main tracking page it displayed an incorrect weight.
response: Hi daseinx, thank you for your honest feedback. We've passed your comments on to our team for review.

title: Good user-friendly UI and easy calorie counting, BUT scanner needs improvement
body: I've been using this app for months now (also am good/VIP member) and I can honestly say it's the best out of the calorie counting apps I've tried. The interface is super easy to understand and it makes tracking macros easy as heck!

title: So far, not too impressed
body: This is only my second day of using this app, and maybe I haven‚Äôt figured out how to do everything. However, today I had to actually log in again, and when I did, I found that 500 calories or so worth of food was missing since I entered those items yesterday. I can see what my fat and calorie intake is, and it‚Äôs easy to see, but it doesn‚Äôt show what my recommended intake should be, so I can‚Äôt tell if I‚Äôm going over or not. Additionally, yesterday I told it to sync with my fitness app on my phone, and today the option to sync showed up again, and when I clicked it thinking that info was also erased, I ended up with double everything on my phone app.  I would like something that isn‚Äôt too hard to use to enter food and track calories, but it‚Äôs pointless if I‚Äôm going to have to re-enter Items every day and try to remember what else I ate the day before.
response: Hi there, we're so sorry for this inconvenience. Please email us at support@livestrong.com so we can assist you.

title: Needs more options
body: So I am trying to be better about what I eat by logging. I really like the format of this app but I‚Äôm always finding a battle after a few good working days. I used it for 3 days it logged me out and I tried every password no luck so I tried to reset and it told me I didn‚Äôt exist...I tried to email customer support and got no help. So I tried to start all over tells me my email exists already. I ended up using a new email and making a new account all is great (for 2weeks) now there‚Äôs no food to be found. I type chicken and get 4 options. I added every combination type to chicken with no luck. I just want to add slow cooked chicken and I can‚Äôt. And it couldn‚Äôt find rice... chicken and rice is as common as it gets and it can‚Äôt find it. 2 weeks ago I found lots of options now I can‚Äôt find any. Why? I‚Äôm very disappointed because I love the layout and format and I can‚Äôt use it. I also made sure it was up to date and it is.
response: Hello ASchultzy! We are so sorry you faced this issue. We have been experiencing some technical difficulties on our servers. The team has been working hard to get it back up. Thanks so much for your patience. If you have any further questions, please reach us at support@livestrong.com.

title: Dan
body: I am a 68 yowm who used app about 18 moths ago  I weighed 272 lbs. I needed surgery for a hernia and was high risk.

title: Download it, you won‚Äôt regret it
body: I haven‚Äôt upgraded yet, so I‚Äôm using the app as is, just the free features. It‚Äôs a great app, it makes tracking your food easy af, you can import yesterday‚Äôs meal if you repeated it, it breaks down your optimal macros, calculates your caloric needs, etc.

title: Great for macro counters
body: Counting macros is a challenge. Just trying to figure out what percentage you should have based on your body and life is like trying to remember my college calculus classes. This app does it all for you and it is amazing! We moved abroad to Europe, and finding a routine and healthy eating given all of the new products was really hard. I gained 8-10 pounds and no matter what I did I could not get rid of it. I had a sense that macro proportions were the key, and sure enough...weight is coming off. I use the scanner and the auto populate is magnificent. I exercise heavily and the app adds those calories back, but I‚Äôm sticking to the low end of 1200 calories to lose quickly. Definitely worth the premium membership to get at some wonderful recipes full of flavor. Thanks for the best app ever!

title: Accidentally started a diet
body: Since I became a vegetarian a year ago I realized I need to start tracking my protein so I got this app mainly to track my protein intake and make sure I‚Äôm consuming around 40g a day
response: We're glad to hear that MyPlate is helping you! Be sure to check in and let us know how you're doing :)

title: Love it! Love it! Love it!
body: I downloaded this app the summer of my freshman year of college (after the freshman 15 was gained). I became really interested in eating healthy and working out but soon realized I got way to skinny way too fast. I started using this app to make sure that I was staying healthy on my fitness journey and I have not stopped using it since (about 3.5 years). I never needed to purchase the upgrade because the free app had everything I needed. I love the scanner and that it has to option to look up restaurant food as well. Overall amazing app for tracking food but it's much harder to track workouts on the free version. This is fine for me because I'm just using it to make sure that I meet my daily calorie and macronutrient requirements!

title: My review!
body: Would love it if it listened to me. No point putting your meal times and preferences in. So if your intermittent fasting or eat later than 10 am don't bother with this app. It won‚Äôt listen to you. It suggests mega low calorie meal plan in my emails thats 1500 less than I actually need, and it reminds me to have breakfast FIVE hours earlier than I put in that I do. The ONLY thing this app is decent for is counting your calories and tracking what you eat. But don‚Äôt expect your times, and all info to be correct for you. Im rating a one bc I am so dang frustrated everyone making things that do not work. Apps that do not work right. People who do not do their jobs proficient etc. Tired of wasting money! That is also why it was important to me bc I am trying to save money eating like this, and Im eating like this to save my life I have been sick a few years. Anyway that‚Äôs all! Don‚Äôt bother with it if you are tracking thoroughly

title: Great app!
body: I love this app; it has great features and even a meal plan you can have delivered to your email weekly. Great idea.

title: Great app if your serous
body: I‚Äôm not new to fitness and diet. I have been training and counting macros for over 10years.  I‚Äôve also set up meal plans and gotten great results but now I‚Äôm trying the Keto diet. I wasn‚Äôt use to eating so much fat I I needed an app to count my macros for me and check percentages so I can make sure I‚Äôm eating enough fat and not going over on my protein. I two weeks I‚Äôve lost 4lb which weight loss was not my intention when starting this diet but I can say that all the weight I‚Äôve lost have been water and fat. I‚Äôve seen an incredible amount of definition around my lower stomach and lower back. This app has made it very easy for me to follow my diet and I‚Äôll make it easy for anyone else trying to follow a diet regardless of what kind of diet they want to follow.

title: Meals need portion option
body: I really love the interface of this app and that it includes a water tracker (would love reminders to drink water throughout the day). However, finding this almost unusable because I can‚Äôt add a recipe and then choose my portion size. How am I supposed to know what portion I‚Äôm eating of every ingredient that I put into a recipe without doing a bunch of time consuming calculations outside of the app? It‚Äôs another app that feels more appropriate for packaged foods, which I don‚Äôt eat because generally they‚Äôre not healthy (kinda defeats the purpose right?) I also don‚Äôt love when I add a meal that it puts each individual ingredient in my list for the day rather than just saying the meal that I ate. I‚Äôm not really sure what the point of the meal tab is if it doesn‚Äôt allow you to calculate portion size or place the name of that meal in your list of eaten foods. With this addition this app would be 5 stars, without it I probably won‚Äôt be using it.
response: Thanks for the review and feedback, and thank you for trying MyPlate! We are working on bringing improved recipe functions to the app and hope to include this in a future update! In the meantime, please note that you can create custom Recipes on our desktop site at LIVESTRONG.COM.

title: Easy And Successful!
body: Joining MyPlate is one of the smartest things I've ever done! By using their easy to use App I have successfully lost 55 pounds. Now, this didn't happen magically and it didn't happen without my being faithful to using MyPlate but it was indeed a pleasurable way to drop a good amount of unwanted, ugly pounds! I have been dedicated to MyPlate for about 8 months and it truly is a joy to use! I actually look forward to entering what goes into my mouth and it encourages me to choose my foods wisely. Prior to using MyPlate my carb intake was atrocious and I ate hardly any protein! Now, I'm better! MyPlate makes it easy for me to track my intake of protein, carbs, sodium and my favorite...WATER!!!

title: WOW!
body: I love this app! It‚Äôs so easy to use, very organized, and keeps me on track. I love that it breaks all the food down into each part like the fats, carbs and proteins. It has a bar scan reader which is very helpful when eating packaged food. It also lets you build your own meals and you can name them and save them for later use. I also love that it gives you workout exercises and connects to other workout apps (I use Apple Health and Workout for Women) to keep track of calories burned. I have only used this app for a few days but it is one of my favorites. I don‚Äôt have the Gold (yet) but even the free version is amazing. It even keeps track of how much water you are drinking. It‚Äôs kind of fun and like a game which makes it easier to use :) great app
response: Hi Imuller17! Thank you for that awesome review. We're so glad you are enjoying the app.

title: That‚Äôs Better
body: Update, one day later:
response: Hello and thank you for your updated review! We're thrilled that things seem to be looking up. Please don't hesitate to check in with us with any other questions or concerns as you continue familiarizing yourself with MyPlate. Best wishes!

title: Love the app! (With some feedback)
body: I love this app! It is clean and streamlined (even the free version!) and it is perfect for tracking my meals. My ONE suggestion is that there should be a way to enter in a full recipe into the meal section (i.e. a full recipe for 4 servings), and then indicate that you either had one serving of it or 1/4 of the meal for one of your meals (I know Noom has this feature, and it‚Äôs SO helpful!). This would make entering meals much easier so we don‚Äôt have to do the division on our own.
response: Hi there! Thank you for your review and feedback. A recipe feature is something we would like to bring to the app in a future update. If you have additional suggestions, feel free to reach out to us at support@livestrong.com.

title: Great!
body: This app is great- I‚Äôve used it for more than a year. I like how simple it is to use, especially with barcode scanning, searching, and creating your own foods. Seeing progress and change over time is ideal, too.
response: Hi NMJ003! Thank you for leaving a review! We appreciate your feedback and I have passed along your comments to our product development team.

title: Helpful App
body: *Update- Developer has gotten back to me, but sadly still no resolution (no, creating my own food with barely any options is not helpful, but thanks) This issue has been going on for months!
response: Hi ShaGGyk! Thank you so much for your feedback! Our team is aware of this issue with the green pop up button. We're working on a fix! In the meantime, you can create a custom food item by tapping the meal period you'd like to add to, My Food, and then Create New Food. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions!

title: Stopped working
body: App no longer lets you add new food. It appears to be a server problem. This only highlights the fact that is shameful to have an app like this force you to connect to the internet. Let us use the app in airplane mode and it will solve these issues!
response: Hello! Thank you for your feedback. Due to an outage on our data center, MyPlate experienced some functionality issues. This has been resolved and the current app version should be 100% functional. Thank you for your patience during the time our team was working on fixing the problem. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. Your wellness means so much to us and our team is committed to your ongoing health and fitness success. If you have any further questions, please reach us at support@livestrong.com.

title: Pretty Good
body: I really love the interface of this app. It‚Äôs super easy to use and very minimal/streamlined. I also like the option to pay to just remove ads if you want, you don‚Äôt have to upgrade the whole thing. I really wish there was an option to remove the community page, even just a switch to hide it if you choose. I understand how it‚Äôs beneficial for some, but it‚Äôs very triggering for others. Some of us are recovering and using calorie counting for things besides weight loss or others that aren‚Äôt dieting strictly, or if you‚Äôre recovering from over exercising and under eating etc, all of these things are easily triggered by the ‚Äúcommunity‚Äù. If that was an option, this would be a winning app for me but for my own mental sanity, I had to go with another one!

title: Excellent place to start
body: Easy to use. good choice of foods for data entry. great options for adding homemade foods where you know calorie carbs proteins and fat with portion sizes also allows for customized meal example salad romaine 1/2 head 1 tomato 1 tablespoon onion vinegar 1/4 cup avocado oil 2 tablespoon 2 oz pepperoni 2 oz sharp cheddar cheese etc. immediate feedback with useful information helping stay on track with your food history and a water entry. You enter your weight etc and gives options maintain lose gain. What ever your goal then you have feedback to much to little etc. and if you have an activity monitor it adds to the tracking. And if not say you mowed lawn push mower 1/2 hr let‚Äôs you manually enter individual activities and gives a calorie value.

title: Pretty Good Ap
body: I‚Äôm only using the free version but I like it. It‚Äôs very easy to learn and lets you set your own goals or simply enter your weight loss desires and it will set goals for you. I did find that the scanner cannot find many products, but to be fair I live in Central Europe so perhaps it does better with American packages. But to be completely upfront, I do have a different app that can scan many of the packages here so it is a downfall with this app. Another downfall is the ‚Äúmy recipes‚Äù portion of the app. Most people cook for families so I entered the entire recipe as I cooked it but then I wasn‚Äôt able to split that into servings. I couldn‚Äôt even say that I ate a quarter of the recipe, it was either the entire recipe or nothing. I wish that feature were added. But overall, great app, I will continue to use it.

title: Easy to use but guidelines are questionable
body: This app is easy to use. I love the functionality of it and the possibilities
response: Hi Pjs437! Thanks for the review and feedback. To adjust you macronutrient goals, tap on the person icon located in the upper left corner of the app's home screen Then, tap your profile picture. There will be tabs that allow you to change your Calorie and Macronutrient Goals towards the bottom of the page. If you have additional questions, please reach out to us at support@livestrong.com.

title: Lifesaving!
body: During Cancer and after a serious operation, the. Dietician at the Cancer Hospital asked me to be part of a Clinical Trial using the MyPlate App.
response: Hello! Thank you for your amazing review. It feels great to hear that we've been able to help.

title: Pretty Great!
body: This app has been great for helping me track what I‚Äôm eating so I can lose weight at a healthy level each week. I really like the barcode scan, it makes it so quick.
response: Hello and thank you for your review! We apologize for the double counting. Our team is aware of this and is working on a solution. In the meantime, we recommend turning off activity tracking in the MyPlate app. This will allow the app to sync only with your Apple Watch. To do this, please do the following:

title: Few features away from amazing
body: Love the interface and how appealing it is. Truly makes you want to use the app. Couple suggestions:
response: Hi there! Thank you for your review and feedback. We‚Äôre glad you are enjoying MyPlate.

title: Good for tracking calories but not much else
body: I use the free version and have considered upgrading to get the ‚Äòadvanced stats‚Äô, but I realized that much of the ‚Äòbasic‚Äô info the app provides you is incorrect. For instance, yesterday I ate 1 pound of 75/25 beef, which according to this app contained 0.38mg of cholesterol, though in reality that number is 340mg. Similarly, when I log my breakfast of 2 carrots, 2 eggs, and 2 cups broccoli, I am told that I have had 0.3mg of sodium, when the real amount is 260mg. These issues only come up when I have to manually enter those foods whose barcodes aren‚Äôt recognized, but unfortunately that is most of what I eat. The calorie counts are always more or less accurate, so if that‚Äôs what your looking for in an app, this will meet your needs. However, if you want more detailed nutritional information, I would suggest looking elsewhere.
response: Hello! This is definitely something that we'd like to investigate for you. Would you mind sending us an email at support@livestrong.com? Thank you!

title: Not perfect but still pretty good
body: It covers everything I need for track my food and water and weight. Automatic updates for iPhone steps and calories burned often drop out and disappear but I‚Äôm not really too worried about that anyway. I can always manually enter calories burned when necessary. Library of food is great but not as diverse as some other providers, that may just be because this one is not as widely used. Oh, and when entering a new food, I learned the hard way, but when it says to enter carbs/protein/etc in grams, you actually have to enter it in MILLIgrams (i.e. 3 grams carbs must be entered as 3000) or else it doesn‚Äôt input correctly.  But I‚Äôve been using it for 3 months and have lost 53 lbs. I recommend it to everyone who talks to be about losing weight.
response: Hi Remy! We are thrilled to hear of your success with the MyPlate app. Please note that the issue with entering custom foods is a bug that our team is aware of and is working to resolve! If you can please tap My Food and then Create New Food, instead of using the green pop up button, you shouldn't experience this discrepancy. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions!

title: Great app, but has issues
body: I have used this app for years and I really love it. It‚Äôs rather accurate when you search the database for food items and it‚Äôs nice you can add your own custom foods as well. Plus you can log water intake, workouts/burned calories, and weight and it tracks all of it.
response: Hello aaa25067! We are so sorry you are facing this issue. We have been experiencing some technical difficulties on our servers. The team is working hard to get it back up. Thanks so much for your patience. If you have any further questions, please reach us at support@livestrong.com.

title: Great to keep track
body: Like the meal suggestions, which I just added. The ADS however are a big disappointment and distraction. 1/2/19
response: Hi Jetta375, thank you for your feedback! We‚Äôre glad you are enjoying the MyPlate App! We're constantly looking for new ways to improve our site and apps, and we love getting feedback as it helps guide our process moving forward. We're using ads on the free version of the app so we can support our development process and offer features like meal plans or food suggestions free or charge. We are also hoping that the new native ads are less of a distraction than the previous sticky ads. Thanks again!!

title: Easy to use. Effective. Food choices need work.
body: I really like this app. I‚Äôve used a few others to help track my food intake but this one is by far the most user friendly. I will say that the only negative aspect is that the automated choices are limited and inconsistent, calorie wise. For instance, there may be three of the same food item that grossly differ in calories. And I don‚Äôt want to manually add the nutritional info. Hence the reason for an app. To do it for me. Health is so haaaaard. I wish the magic app unicorn would make that better. Like. How hard is it to add baked chicken breast? But apparently, my options are limited to Stouffer's. And honestly.
