response: Thanks for tracking with MyPlate, and thanks for the review! We understand the demand for a nursing option with the calorie tracker. Currently there is not a standardized formula for calculating calories burned for a nursing mother as there are many factors that go into the calculation: mother‚Äôs weight, age, activity level and the age of the baby. We recommend consulting with your doctor about how many calories you are burning through breast feeding and then tracking them as Manual Calories burned.

response: Hi Allybarbo! Thank you for your review. We are working on bringing a custom Recipe function to the app and hope to include this in a future update! In the meantime, please note that you can create custom Recipes on our desktop site at https://www.livestrong.com/myplate/dashboard/. Log into your account using the same username and password that you use on the MyPlate app. Scroll down past the meal periods and click on "My Recipes" and then "Create A Recipe". Enter the specifics and don't forget to save everything! Once you've created a recipe, you can click on it and press Track to add to your tracker. When you're finished, please close and reopen your mobile MyPlate app to sync everything and add the item to your tracker!

Unfortunately, we're not able to add or remove items from this database as it is managed by Nutritionix. If the item you'd like to track is not in our database, we recommend creating a custom food entry in the app.

title: Hacked
body: I didn‚Äôt get a chance to use this app until someone hacked my Facebook through it presumably. It was the last app I used to connect and in all of my 14 years of being on Facebook, this is the first time. Please try to log in independently if using this app.
response: Hello!  We're sorry to hear that this happened! We DO NOT obtain our user's Facebook credentials when they log in into MyPlate using Facebook. We are only obtaining a secure identification token for our users from the social network. When performing this type of connection, Facebook informs our users about the exact rights they are giving MyPlate, and they are free to not grant them, or even to revoke them at any time from your Facebook account. As a reminder, the rights MyPlate receives only include giving us the ability to READ your PUBLIC PROFILE and EMAIL ADDRESS. Even if these are not our user's credentials, we take all their information privacy seriously. These identification tokens are treated by us like any other piece of information in the app: transferred via secure connections and stored securely in our databases. We are confident to say that, regarding MyPlate, your account remains safe and cannot be the origin of a hack of your Facebook account.

title: Improper charges

response: Hi there! We are so sorry for any difficulties you have had in cancelling your subscription.  When you registered for your subscription, the payment and transaction were completely managed by Apple. Apple does not allow us to view, manage, cancel or refund in-app subscription purchases.This is Apple's policy across the board and is not specific to MyPlate. However, you can reach out to Apple directly to request a refund.

title: Great way to get organized and educated about your diet
body: First off, I‚Äôve been using the MyPlate app for a little over 5 months now and it‚Äôs really helped me make some big positive changes in my life! I‚Äôve always been athletic and in decent shape and I always thought I made pretty smart food choices, but in addition to exercise, MyPlate has helped me lose almost 20 pounds and learn so much more about the food that goes into my body. I love the daily macro breakdown and the ability to customize the app based on your nutritional goals. The forums where you can find user-submitted recipes are also really fun to sift through for some inspiration to shake things up. I‚Äôm in the best mental and physical shape of my life right now and this app has had a huge part in that. I love it!
response: Hi LaxWags33! Thank you for contacting us! We very much appreciate your feedback and I have passed along your comments to our product development team.  As we are always adding new content and features to the site and app, we love getting feedback as it helps guide our designs and tools moving forward.

Please email us at support@livestrong.com if you're having trouble gaining access to your meal plan.

title: Eh, ok
body: The daily Calorie goal has a glitch. I can enter my custom calorie goal (1000), but I can‚Äôt save it or get out of the field. The screen stays stuck on the keypad entry.
response: Hi there! For safety reasons, 1200 calories per day is the minimum caloric goal allowed by the MyPlate calculator. This is commonly considered the lowest a number of calories a person can eat in a day without doctor supervision. Since most of our users do not check with a doctor before taking on such a goal, or are unable to do, we implemented this as a safety feature. Please send us an email at support@livestrong.com with any questions.

response: Hi hiker101! You can search our exercise database by tapping the Exercise widget on the home screen of the app. If you do not see the exercise you wish to track in our database, you can create a custom exercise by doing the following: Tap "Exercise" from the Track tab. Select ‚ÄúCustom Exercises‚Äù, and tap the ‚Äú+‚Äù symbol. Then, give your exercise a name and enter hourly calorie burn rate. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions!

title: Inaccurate

response: Hello! We're so sorry for the frustration. These inaccuracies are due to new nutritional label guidelines set by the FDA. MyPlate uses a third party food database called Nutritionix. Nutritionix is working hard to make changes to the food items in their database to meet the new FDA guidelines. Please send us an email at support@livestrong.com with any questions.

title: Great
body: Great app to help you stay on track of everything you eat.  Helps you see carbs protein sugars.

title: No way to enter how much you actually ate
body: As far as I can tell, the app is basically useless because there is no way to enter, by weight or otherwise, how much of any food you actually ate as opposed to the pre-entered serving size. Deleting this app.
response: Hi there. Many of the entries in our database have the option to track food by weight. Simply tap the servings widget within the food. Please email us at support@livestrong.com if you have any questions.

title: Great App

title: Awesome app except...

response: Hi COYG_avid_football_fan! Please be sure that activity tracking is turned on in the MyPlate app. Tap the white silhouette icon in the upper left corner. Then, tap "App Preferences". Be sure that the button next to "Track My Activity" is toggled to the green on position. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions.

If you have any further questions, please reach us at support@livestrong.com.

title: Hard to use

response: Thanks for giving MyPlate a go, and sorry to hear about not being able to change the calorie goal. To change this, tap the person icon in the upper left corner of the app's home screen. Tap your profile picture. From this screen, you can change your Weight Goal and Activity Level as needed, and your Calorie Goal will change automatically. Or create your own goal by tapping "Calorie & Macronutrient Goals", and then "Calorie Goal". Toggle the button next to Automatic to the off position, then enter the goal you want. Hopefully this is what you're looking for, but feel free to send us a message at support@livestrong.com with any other questions or concerns. Thanks again for the review!

title: Must pay for most useful features

To clarify, our paid membership unlocks the additional features of tracking Sodium, Dietary Fiber, Saturated Fats, Sugars, and Cholesterol, as well as access to the community tab via mobile. Besides these features, you should still be able to freely create and track food, meals, and exercise, as well as create custom recipes in the website version of the app. We apologize if any of these features seem hidden when navigating. Thanks again for giving MyPlate a try!

title: Poor start

response: Hi Sleepy&Buligerent, thank you for your feedback. Our next update will include the option to maintain your weight during the on-boarding process. In the meantime, you can set the app to maintain after your profile is created. Please tap the white silhouette icon located in the upper left corner. Then, tap your profile picture. On the following page, you can set your Weekly Target to maintain. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions.

response: Hello! Custom foods are super easy to create and will save you time tracking.Select the meal you'd like to track the custom food to (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, or Snack), tap "My Food", and select "Create New Food" to create a custom food item. Enter the specifics of the food, and tap "Done" in the upper right corner. The custom food item you created will be saved and will appear on the "My Food" screen for future use. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions.

title: Amazing

title: Almost there
body: I‚Äôve been tracking myself with this app for just about a month and have paid for the membership. Overall, I‚Äôm happy with it. It is an easy way to keep an accurate picture of what‚Äôs going on - once you‚Äôve gone through an initial break-in period. If you are like me, even if you eat a variety of foods, there is still a core menu of things you consume on a regular basis. I was on vacation from work for the first week or so of tracking so I had plenty of time to find an input items in my regular diet. The app allows you to input foods that aren‚Äôt in its database under the ‚ÄúMy Foods‚Äù category and to create custom meals or groupings of food as well. Adding custom foods is fairly easy if you have a product label on hand. I wish that function had a separate ‚Äúbrand‚Äù field so you didn‚Äôt have to try and include it in the item name. I‚Äôd also like there to be a field to track added sugar in nutrition values. Although, not all labels separate that out, so I get it. I found the ‚ÄúMy Meals‚Äù option more cumbersome. In order to create a meal, you have to start from scratch with your food entry. It would be nice to have a repopulated list of items we‚Äôve logged before to start with. And, once in a meal, can you edit case by case? If I eat my normal salad, but switch to a dressing with a different nutrient profile, I can‚Äôt just make a one-time change. Also, I found branded foods listed as ‚Äúverified‚Äù under multiple slightly different names and nutrient profiles. All of these suggestions are small in the grand scheme. It has helped me get a very realistic view of my portions, amounts, and macronutrient balances. A month in, I‚Äôm still leaning. I just realized, for example, that I can adjust my own macronutrient goals under my profile information.

title: Not a nutrition analysis
body: I was hoping to see the micronutrients I was consuming, but this app only counts calories, salt, and cholesterol.  Also they make it intentionally hard to cancel the subscription.
response: Thanks for trying out MyPlate! Sorry to hear about your frustration with the cancellation process. Unfortunately, we're unable to issue refunds or disable the auto-renew feature for purchases made via iTunes, as these subscriptions are managed by Apple as part of their in-app subscription policy. The team is working on improving the way micronutrients are tracked, but in the meantime, if you do not have access to tracking Dietary Fiber and Sugars even with gold membership, please let us know at support@livestrong.com and we'll work towards resolving this issue immediately. Thanks again for giving the app a try!

title: Requires registration
body: I'm disappointed the app requires email/username/password (and optional email list) for use. Should not need any of that! I don't see a way to bypass
response: Thanks for trying the app, and sorry to hear about the frustration regarding registration. We actually require an account to be created in order to sync your account with any other devices you log into, or when you visit the website version of the app. With a username and email address attached to your tracking data, we are also better able to locate and support should any issues arise with the account. Sorry for the inconvenience, and thanks again for trying out MyPlate!

If you experience any issues or have any questions, we encourage you to bring them to our attention. Feel free to reach out to us directly at support@livestrong.com.

title: Recipes
body: Great app, love it but I wish there was a way to save recipes.
response: Hi there! Thank you for your review. We are working on bringing a custom Recipe function to the app and hope to include this in a future update! In the meantime, please note that you can create custom Recipes on our desktop site at https://www.livestrong.com/myplate/dashboard/. Log into your account using the same username and password that you use on the MyPlate app. Scroll down past the meal periods and click on "My Recipes" and then "Create A Recipe". Enter the specifics and don't forget to save everything! Once you've created a recipe, you can click on it and press Track to add to your tracker. When you're finished, please close and reopen your mobile MyPlate app to sync everything and add the item to your tracker!

title: Free version is useless
body: I can‚Äôt even figure out how to change the intake goal or add my own items. One star and deleted.
response: Hi there, we're sorry that you've had such trouble. You can adjust your calorie goals easily. Tap the silhouette icon in the upper left corner of the app's home screen. Tap your profile picture. From this screen, you can change your Weight Goal and Activity Level as needed, and your Calorie Goal will change automatically. Or create your own goal by tapping "Calorie & Macronutrient Goals", and then "Calorie Goal". Toggle the button next to Automatic to the off position, then enter the goal you want.

title: Needs work
body: I have used MyPlate in the past, so there are a number of things that I like about MyPlate. I love the layout of it and how things sync together, but I do have a number of gripes with it, too, one of which has caused me to request that my account be deleted. 1. Many of the calorie counts are not accurate on it, and they have been wrong for more than a year now. There is not an option to change any of them either. 2. The BIG ONE, which caused me to request that my account be deleted. The recipe builder is messed up when you go to their website and try to use it, and has been for over a year. It will allow you to go all the way through it, adding all of your ingredients, the instructions on how to fix it, and let‚Äôs you get to part where you click on ‚ÄúCreat Recipe.‚Äù Once you do this, nothing happens, and your recipe is not saved. I have reached out to MyPlate about it last year when it first happened, and last night when it happened again, and they still haven‚Äôt fixed this issue IN OVER A YEAR! Their suggestion is to add all of the ingredients and portion it out as a meal, which is very frustrating to say the least because you can‚Äôt just enter the stuff and tell it that you ate this many servings of it like you would the recipe builder. If you enter it there and you eat more or less the next time, you would have to go back in there each time and change the ingredients and the servings of each ingredient to get the calorie count correct. The main thing that is so frustrating is, I understand that things can happen with technology and it may take some time to get the bugs worked out of it, but it has been over a year, and they still haven‚Äôt fixed something as important as the recipe builder.
response: Hi there! Thanks for the review and feedback. Please note, the MyPlate phone app does not contain a recipe builder feature. This is something we hope to include in a future update.

title: Latest release broken
body: This has been a wonderful app prior the latest release. With this release you enter items you ate and then they disappear and are not displayed as eaten although their calorie counts are in the totals. You thus cannot see or edit all the items you actually ate and the total calorie counts don‚Äôt agree with what is displayed as eaten. The basic functionality of this app is to actually track what you ate and total the calories, carbs, proteins, etc. It is broken and can no longer do this. Thus it went from wonderful to totally worthless. What kind of test and quality control organization could have possibly let this release go to production with such an obvious flaw that made the program hopelessly unusable?
response: Hello! Our team is aware of and is working on the issue with the "done" button on our iPad app. We're also working hard to resolve the speed issue. We apologize for the frustration. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions.

Our app and registration process are programmed to never set a calorie goal lower than 1,200 (eating less than 1,200 calories per day can jeopardize muscle mass and general health.) If you can provide any related screenshots displaying the calorie goal or registration information to support@livestrong.com, we'll gladly work towards resolving this bug.

title: Account required
body: Why?
response: Hi there! Thanks for the review and feedback. In the past, before we required the creation of an account, users would complain that they lost their data. If an app does not have you create an account this means the data is only stored on your phone. In that case if you switch phones or delete the app all of your data will be lost. This was especially upsetting for long-term users. The creation of an account allows your data to be retrieved and allows your app data to be synced across devices. If you have any questions, we're happy to help. Please reach out to us at support@livestrong.com.

title: So wonderful & easy to use!!
body: I've been using My Plate Tracker for 2 weeks now & I absolutely love this app! I've downloaded others in the past & never really used them much but with the ease of My Plate, you honestly can't go wrong since there is a HUGE database of foods already in there! I lost 2.5 lbs & 2 inches my first week using this app! There is place to set up reminders in case u haven't tracked yet (but I've noticed it only works if you've not tracked @ all that day) but feel it would be helpful to add a second reminder in there in case u have missing meals...ie....forgot to track dinner, etc. I also noticed that, as far as I can tell, u can only track for that particular day ONLY on that specific day, which is a bit annoying if by chance I've forgotten or have gotten too busy to track my dinner meal. Poof, then, that dinner meal may as well have never been eaten according to the tracker. The only other thing is I don't particularly care for the bonus stuff but maybe others prefer it & it is helpful to them to help achieve their goals? Who knows, but it is of no consequence to me. But be aware u don't have to participate if u don't care to, which I love that!!! All in all, this app is wonderful & I highly recommend it to anyone wanting to lose weight & make a healthy lifestyle change!!!

title: Awesome awesome app
body: I always cringed at my dr saying chart food & exercise as I am 5' 1" & 207 # & diabetic, my goal is 150#! Much healthier for me & make it easier to do everyday things, including mounting my horses, amazing how hard it is to pull this extra weight up that far, especially since I got a new one that's taller than my head at her back! This all has led to my inspiration to track & lose weight to be healthier!  This app is wonderful & inspiring as I walk around seeing my calories melt as my iPhone tracks me, then I put in my bathroom I just cleaned and wow, I'm negative calories right now!  Almost lunch time so I'll scan or punch what I eat in and drink (water is such nice with its own button!) My dr is gonna love me next month! Maybe I'll break down & go buy a scale to track my weight now! This really let's you see the breakdown and makes it simple to see your protein to carbs ratio too! It's been rainy here the last few days since I loaded this & off work for weekend/holiday can't wait to see what I do on normal days at work & weekends on the farm! I imported this data to my iPhone health app as well to show with my daily mileage and pedometer count! So freaking awesome! So far for a week every day average is 2 miles a day just going about work & chores no exercise getting ready to implement that in!  Everyone Good Luck on your journey!

title: Loved it, but didn't work for me :/
body: Honestly, I want to give this baby 4-5 stars! I love how not only can you track food, exercise, and weight; but also water. The water section is great because it allows you to select your container size before logging giving you a better idea of how much water you consumed. I loved that you could review your macros and you could read the newest research in health. I loved the design and the usability. There was one flaw that was a deal breaker for me. I cook for my family and as such I'm typically making meals that serve 4-6. Therefore, I found it very difficult logging my food, because as far as I can tell, there is no recipe function. It has a custom food input so if you know the info for your recipes individual serving you can create it, but for me that isn't easy. I would have to log in the full recipe into meals, divide the nutritional facts that it shows down to 1 in my calculator. Then I'd delete the meal and save it in my custom foods. So much work. No thanks!! I have seen other apps where you can log the full recipe, say how much it serves and it will divide it down per serving for you. If you cook for a single person or  have no problem doing the  work then I would suggest this app because otherwise it's fantastic. If you are like me and need to be able to log full recipes,  I wouldn't recommend this.

title: Many issues with this app
body: I've used this app on and off the last few years but recent dieting and exercise prompted me to start using it again. Initially it is a good app for tracking and logging your calories and carbs. But it doesn't let you select any less than 100% of your daily nutritional goals. When you're dieting, that's kind of what you're going for. Aside from that, the "community" page is a COMPLETE JOKE. You literally can not post anything without people trolling your posts and harassing you. When I spoke up about those internet trolls who literally did nothing but criticize you and insults your intelligence and say awful things, THEY reported my comments and had all my posts removed. Yet I still haven't figured out how to delete a comment or report one? I'm 20 it's not like in some old person who doesn't understand technology. They just have those options hidden very well I guess. Not only that, but when you go to log an exercise for the day, they have VERY limited information on most workouts and their calories burned. Aside from this their latest update made the app harder to figure out and more work than its worth with a lot of unnecessary clicking.

title: Great app but some annoying things
body: I really like this app more than other trackers because it feels more inclusive than most but there are a few things that are really irritating. First, when trying to add a food I frequently get a message saying "sorry we are unable to add a food at this time. Please try again later." I don't know what that's about or why it happens - it's completely random, sporadic and annoying. Second, when doing a quick add, you can't add essential items like sodium or fiber but it's often the only option I have when I keep getting the above message and can't add it the other way. Third, it automatically deducts your activity calories burned from the amount you ate. I wish there were an option so that I could track my activity without having it subtract that amount from what I ate - I still ate that much. Just because I did a lot of activity shouldn't give me license to eat a whole bunch more. That's not how weight loss works. Lastly, I wish I could set my own carbohydrate limit instead of theirs which just seems arbitrary and excessive. Would love this app and give it 5 stars if these things got fixed.

title: It depends on YOU! Do the WORK!
body: I lost 70 lbs with the online version of this app years ago. Now I'm more on the go and not to add gained all my weight back and some. The LiveStrong app is really convenient. This application allows for users to track their calorie intake, (especially important for those seeking to loose weight), water, weight, bmi, etc. If I had to give constructive criticism on this app I would say that the daily water intake doesn't allow for mistakes to be corrected. I accidentally put in that I drank 824 oz of water and  there was no way of changing it.  The reminders that you can set for this app also comes in handy. Not to mention the food library is amazing. You can even scan items.  Most other apps like this one you have to manually enter a lot of foods you eat. LiveStrong has almost everything in its food tracker, everything down to 5 star restaurants to the local burger joint, and fresh fruits and vegetables. I recommend this app to make a long story short. It could improve in certain areas but what doesn't need improvements these day. üòä

title: Superb w/a couple fixes
body: This app is great. It's the only app I've found that suits my specific needs. One issue that I have is that the calories section for exercise has a glitch that recently appeared. I have noticed that it often does not change calorie amount between a 10+ minute record of exercise and sometimes it's completely off. This use to work just fine. I only use the manual food option to record my food consumption. I would really like to see an option to delete previous amounts recorded (such as manual food 24 or 194). This list of past recordings is too long and then I can't locate the ones I use more frequently. That being said, this app is awesome. I have lost over a hundred lbs in the past two years through exercise and watching my calories. This has app has contributed to my success by giving me a place to record exercise and providing me with a guideline to follow for calories. Also, it keeps track of my weight. I continue to use this app for maintenance. This app appeals to people with many types of needs which makes it all the better.

title: Looks nice
body: I recently purchased an Apple Watch after using a Fitbit flex for over a year. I wanted to track more of my fitness and I thought the Apple Watch would be the smartest upgrade to make. I have been searching high and low for an all-in-one app like Fitbit has. I thought MyPlate was finally the one. It looks nice and is easy to figure out, everything syncs as it should, but I'm not happy with the food library. Today I wanted to log a tomato. I could not find a regular tomato! There were canned tomatoes and stewed tomatoes and green tomatoes. But not a regular, raw, sliced tomato! There is only one listed as a user submission and it says one serving (what is the serving?!) and zero calories. Ok. And why don't they list what a serving is and why can't I change the type of serving- say tablespoon or teaspoon as opposed to ounces? And when you choose the amount you have, it should update the serving size. For example: when logging chicken a serving is 3oz. When I choose a serving (1, 1 1/2, etc) it should update the size of the serving.  When I see this change, I will definitely upgrade to the subscription app. Please make this more user friendly and add a friggin tomato!

title: Pretty Good
body: This app is pretty good overall - easy to use, has a pretty big database, and it's easy to add items that aren't already in there. I like that it's easy to track my water intake, too.

title: Like It, however....
body: I discovered I gained 20 Lb. since I starting using Fitness Pal 2 years ago.  There are many reasons for this. I decided to try something else. For it to be effective for me, the app has to be fun to use, have a nice interface, and be easy to track foods eaten & exercise done. I love the interface on this app. It's very simple and clean & I like the plate idea.  I would like to see fiber listed as well as protein, carbs, calories & fat. I'm finding it won't scan some of the foods I have eaten. It doesn't seem to be able to scan if it's not a well known brand. However it did have Chipotle barbacoa bowl in there.   So I like it, but if it's consistently too difficult to enter my foods, I probably won't keep using it.

title: Pregnant and love the app, but...
body: After using this app religiously for two weeks, I have to say I love almost everything about it. I'm pregnant so needed an app that would allow me to set a goal of gaining a 1/2 pound a week. Perfect! Interface is super easy, creating new food is easy, and I've found it very helpful in being mindful of what I'm eating. I'd love to sign up for the year plan, and that's where the rub comes in. I'm all about paying for premium content, and am absolutely willing to shell out $45 to get access to it for a year. But please don't "auto renew" me unless I cancel one day before! That feels like such a trick. "Oops you forgot to cancel - that will be another $45 for a year". If the content is valuable and worth it, we will agree to another year/$45. And if not, we won't. But don't try to "hook" us. Final thought - not sure why but the exercises you can select from are super strange! Like they don't have CrossFit (perhaps the most popular fitness routine today) but they bartending.  ?! Next time I bartend I will know how many calories I burned. But no Barre class, crossfit, etc. flying is in there though so if you do a lot of flying you are in luck!

title: Such potential wasted.
body: First the good. This app looks good, user interface is crisp and clean and intuitive to use. The list of foods is complete and specific, all that myfitday app isn't. It's specific with brand names of foods and brings up very relevant products when searching, all that myfitday can never seem to get right. The user experience is way better than MFP so that's also a big positive. That said, This app had every opportunity to be what my fitness pal could not/would not, but missed it's chance. Mainly, these free apps aren't useable in the sense that they provide just enough info to make it work but barely. They get you hooked so the idea/frustration of starting over with another app gets you to give in and pay. This app won't even show you your exact total daily macros, you have to upgrade to a monthly payment level to see that. Really?  The whole point of these apps is to know your daily macro totals and you shouldn't have to pay for that basic bit of info.  I've grown tired of all these fitness apps claiming to be free but to actually use them correctly/effectively you really need to upgrade to the super duper gold level package for 10-20 bucks a month. Can't someone just make a simple flippin app that lets you enter your food, set your macro %'S and see what they are at the end of the day without it looking like a nerd or a 12 year old girl made?  Geesh.
response: Hi Thefirelion- thanks for your feedback! We just wanted to make sure you know that the free version of the app does allow you to view your total daily macros! You can view this information by pressing the mini pie chart icon located in the right corner of the Food Diary. Please don't hesitate to email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions!

title: Easy to Use, Pleasing to the Eye, 3/4 of What I Need
body: I just started using a calorie tracking app this week as I begin a ketogenic diet. Downloaded numerous apps and started several only to find them unintuitive, very limited in what they offer ($$ for what is actually helpful), and not as tailored to a low-carb diet. So far the scan feature has been great and relatively accurate to packaging. As easy or more so than most to build food and meal data. The UI is motivating and the linkage to the iOS health app is convenient. Now for the demotion to three stars: I need to track net carbs in my macronutrients rather than total carbs. This is not an option as far as I've found in MyPlate (apparently not even in the upgrade) so those nice, slick graphs look good but are completely inaccurate. To be fair no free app for iOS seems to offer this but that is where MyPlate has an opportunity to set itself apart. MyFitnessPal appears to offer a free option for accessing this information but not on the mobile app (a script edit on the desktop app). Entering info on the iOS app should allow me to sync to the desktop and convert the data. I'll most likely try that option but would prefer the MyPlate UI. Please make my life simpler and more accurately informed by adding a "net carbs" option to the macro data.

title: Okay
body: I initially tried using MyFitnessPal, but it wouldn't accept my "macros" and seemed generally uncooperative (though it was great when I used it before, a few years ago). So I tried this instead. I've been using it for about a month, and I find it tedious and annoying. Which is especially disappointing considering its one job is to remove the tedium and difficulty from tracking your nutrition.
response: Hi StellarAlchemy777. Thank you for your feedback and review! We are working on these issues and appreciate your patience. Please don't hesitate to email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions or concerns!

title: Personal chef/nutrition consultant
body: I love this app! I lost over 100 pounds several years ago with careful portioning and living a heart-healthy lifestyle. I have kept the weight off for over 6 years, but this past winter I put on about 5 pounds. I knew I needed to track my food carefully to see where I was adding extra calories and this app has helped so much! I was eating a few too many servings of healthy fats such as nuts and seeds I realized after tracking carefully. Now I am using the app to help me visually plan my daily meal plan instead of in my journal as I had previously. I am creating a calorie deficiency to cause a weight loss by carefully watching my portions and limiting my healthy fats more than I was. This has already caused me to drop the excess pounds over just 2 weeks! This is a wonderful tool. I wish I had it years ago when I started journaling on my journey to losing over 100 pounds, it would have saved me so much time vs. writing everything down and then looking up calories! Thanks so much!

title: New to iPhone
body: I'm not new to technology but new to the handiness of iPhone apps. This app is great! It is really easy and streamlined to use, which is my main requirement for any app. Food choices are perfect for foods a person would find in the States, though I wish I could find more approximations for exotic and foreign dishes that we cook at home. I never used to count calories regularly because of the dedication it took- logging on, researching, recording, adding, subtracting from limits, etc. iPhone + this app= no reason to go over calorie limits. Hard to be that lazy! Note- I wish there was a way to add onto yesterday's info without having to do the dance of going to diary, yesterday, +, meals/exercise. If there was a way to just flip back to that on the main page where i add on to today's cals, and have the same easy page setup as that, that would be great, especially since I often don't log dinner until after midnight.

title: Love having this in my pocket
body: New update with scanner - COOL! But it only worked one time. Now all I get is "oops! We couldn't find that item."  üëé

title: Useful but not accurate
body: - I use this app every day because I like most of the design, but with discretion because I know it is not accurate unless you're careful. It lists different calories burned for the exact same activities, and only one of them is correct. E.g., for my height&weight, bicycling 12-14mph is listed as both 743cal/hour AND 562cal/hour. The 2nd one is accurate. Similarly, running 6mph is listed 930cal/hour AND 703. Again, only 2nd comes close. If I was basing my intake off of the first one, that wouldn't work out too well.

title: Great app, but missing some minor features
body: I really have been loving this app. It looks really nice, isn‚Äôt littered with annoying ads, doesn‚Äôt look sloppy and works smoothly. The caloric intake for my height and weight loss goal is spot on. I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm limiting myself or starving myself in order to meet the goal. I like how it tracks my steps and deducts calories burned. The database of food is huge and I can always find the food that I am looking for. I like how it tracks what I ate in recent days so that if I have a salad again, I don‚Äôt have to search for individual ingredients again. I have two problems though. The first is that I wish there was a notes section. I‚Äôm trying to track what I eat to see what bothers my stomach, and it‚Äôs hard to see how I felt that day when I can‚Äôt write it down. I also wish the workout section has more options. I am doing workouts that don‚Äôt tell me how many calories I burn, so it‚Äôs hard to track that movement. I wish I can say that I went running for an hour and it can calculate how much I burned.

title: MUST HAVE
body: I recently started a diet/workout program which I've often quit before but this app has kept me on top of things longer than I was able to on my own. Documenting your meals, and being able to keep track of calories, makes everything feel that much more official. It REALLY discourages quitting. Uber user-friendly; if you're not sure which item to choose for your food, simply scan the barcode and voil√†! Everything about this app is extremely useful. I even recommend the water app that is linked to it (MyWater) to keep track of daily water intake as well. MyPlate even has a neat little chart to visually represent your activity throughout days, weeks, and months. Last but not least, it links to the pre-installed Health app on iPhone and uses that information to determine how many calories you have burned, not to mention that you can manually add exercises you have done to add to the calorie burning. For anyone wishing to live a healthier lifestyle, this app is IT!!!

title: New Year, New Me
body: Being aware and mindful of what you put into your body is very helpful when trying to eat healthier. I had intended on keeping a food diary, only to find that it was not always readily available to me. I always have my phone with me. So I know I can easily keep track.

title: Go Back to the Old App!
body: May 8 Update: The March update is better. Getting closer. The pie chart is what I really use for monitoring. Glad that's back. But doesn't do much good with the % off to the side. Need to see them in relevance to pie chart. Also move the health tool button to the bottom or something. Relevant info should be at the top. Hate scrolling past this to get to pie chart...Really thought this app was five star until they started tinkering with it.
response: Hi Somethn_Sweet! We're all ears! Our team has been compiling all of the feedback from this latest update and is working on making changes based on user comments. We know there are features from the previous version that our users really love. Please watch the app store for news on our next release.

title: MyPlate
body: This app is the worst I have used of all fitness apps. To log your exercises, you practically have to create all of them yourself. The are almost no stored exercises inputed by the app creators. For example a burp -- everyone in fitness kows what a burpee is! Only, if you search for a burp in the app there are no matches. This is true with SO many basic fitness exercises. In another example, lets say you have done 50 squats -- the only option in recording this exercise is squats per hour. No one does squats straight for one hour -- which by the way the app says is just 133 calories burned -- completely impossible that if someone did squats for one hour straight he/she would only burn 133 calories! In a more likely scenario someone may do a number value of squats like 50 for example yet with this app you'd have to just guess on calories burned or look it up on the web which adds a whole other step to recording your exercise. The user will run into all of these same issues with food and calorie content. Oftentimes I would have to look something up online and then put it into the app. I would pretty much have to create my food record and calorie intake and then put it into the app. Complete hassle!
response: Hi Elaine, thank you for your feedback. We're so sorry that you have had this experience in the app. Please email us at support@livestrong.com so we can assist you further.

title: Needs Work
body: This is a handy, convenient app with an attractive, easy-to-use interface.
response: Hi straycat!! Thank you for your review and feedback! We are working on a fix for the fluctuating calories burned issue. We apologize for this inconvenience! As for the issue you've come across when creating a new food - please be sure that you are adding a custom food by clicking "My Food" and then "Create New Food". We are aware of a bug with the green "Create New Food" pop up button. Thank you again for your review and for sticking with us!

title: Used for 3 weeks
body: I have been using this app daily for three weeks. At first I loved it, but by week three I was tiring on having to retype in food items in order to find them despite the recently eaten or frequently eaten tab. I found that recently eaten tab only brings up foods in the category you are recording, for instance if I recorded a fruit in breakfast it won't show up under the recently eaten tab when I am recording lunch. In addition several times I have had the system list no matches when searching for food items while connected to phone carrier network as opposed to using the wiifi on my iPad.  Finally like that I can see daily breakdown of my caloric intake but wish I could use this feature when I scroll back to look at other days in order to trend my calorie types. It would be nice to see if I have improved my percentage protein intake over the days recorded. Am going to try some other calorie tracking apps this next month to see if I find anything better to use.

title: Life Saver
body: My husband has been using this app for over a month now and lost enough weight that he can fit into clothing that he hasn't worn in years. He urged me to try it.

title: Why I like Livestrong's calorie tracker
body: Super easy to use! Reminds me to enter my weight every morning. Adding what I eat is quick, one thumb nav. What I love is seeing how many carbs, protein and fat grams for meals before I eat them as well as throughout day if my carbs are high I can choose to eat more protein and know to skip the bread in order to balance out the whole day. One thing the free app earns you ten reward points every time you use a daily feature like adding a food item. At first the notices annoyed me but then I realized all those points add up to cash gift cards. So now it fun to count my calories, earn reward points and can you imagine my new me Xmas pics to all my friends next year when I have lost all this weight and using my reward points to go on vacation? I support Livestrong and Lance Armstrong because we all fall down but getting up makes us a champion!

title: Love it!
body: Years ago I got my degree in dietetics. However, five kids later I found that the pounds had snuck up over the years. I was exercising and eating nutritious foods for the most part, but still wasn't losing weight. That's when I got back to the basics and started using this app to determine calories in and calories out.  I was able to set a weight goal and am working towards it. I have had great results, and I feel like this is something I can do.  I plan to use it daily for a month until I use a few pounds and then adjust the calories for the next month to maintain.  I do not plan on using it daily long term.  I think it is helpful to bring attention to how many calories one is eating comparatively.  I like that it breaks it breaks down the intake of macronutrients, but I wish that it also showed micronutrients consumed.  Overall, it is a great tool to use.

title: A VERY REWARDING HEALTH APP!!!
body: I've used this app a couple of times now over several month periods with great success.  As far as the technical issues that I've been reading about in other reviews, I haven't experienced any of these. I use an iPhone 6 and keep my apps and OS updated and synchronized regularly.

title: Has potential
body: I really like this app, it does what it needs to and the user interface is super friendly. I actually like it more than myfitness pal (but I'm biased to prettier apps), but there's a couple things that this app needs to work on. The scanner for some reason has a hard time focusing in on the barcode whenever I need to use my camera. It takes 3 times longer compared to other apps. Also, as of lately I've been having a REALLY hard time staying logged on and it's been driving me crazy. Whenever I close out of the app and then open the app to log in something, I will have to sign back in--but then nothing I tracked stays logged so I have to re-imput everything back in. I don't know why it keeps logging me out and keeps reading me as a new member (it keeps showing me the demo of how to do things), and I think it all happened after I downloaded the new update. Currently waiting for the new update.. I hope this gets fixed SOON so I can give this app the rating it deserves.

title: Kudos to a useful app
body: First downloaded this to help me track progress with losing weight.  It was a very helpful tool to let me know my progress.  I do wish that frequently eaten meals could be pre-set but that is my only crticism.

title: Perfect app
body: I have used this app for years and love it. I recently tried a different app and was nowhere near as pleased. I decided to get curious, however, and look into upgrading to a Gold account. This was the first time I was ever displeased with this app and my issue was because of ethics rather than functionality. They tell you how much a Gold Account is per month and when you press "buy" they try to hit your account for the whole year's fees when it is clearly implied that you will be paying a small amount monthly. Not a huge deal. It was still a good price. I just cannot stand trickery and dishonesty. Why not just say that a Gold account costs so much per year? Or, if you're going to quote it by the month, charge that quoted fee monthly? Anyway, I'm still happy with the app and may upgrade to Gold soon despite my being put off by the company's unethical procedure in that regard.

title: Could be better. PLEASE READ!!!
body: The app is wonderful!It's is very useful on a day to day basic, but there are still some improvement that could be made. For example, the nutrients it tracks. It only follows the protein, fat, and carbs although there are other nutrients that are just as important and should be included in the pie chart. It would be very beneficial if it also tracked the total number of cholesterol, sodium, dietary fiber and/or sugars as well. And maybe let the user individualize what they want to track in the daily pie chart. That would be amazing! Considering people may have to monitor certain nutrients in order to maintain their health (Like a heart attack survivor would have to monitor their cholesterol and sodium).

title: Great community, free, customizable
body: This app has a great community, everyone is incredibly supportive, helpful, and welcoming. There is a free version of the app, and a "gold" version that you pay for. I have the free version, and it includes all the features and functions I need/want. This is a vast improvement from a different app I tied, which marketed itself as free, yet didn't let you even enter meals without paying for the "pro" version. MyPlate is very easy to use, and you can customize your daily calorie, macronutrient (carbs, protein, fat), sodium, cholesterol, sugar, and dietary fiber goals. You can also set these to automatic, and it calculates daily goals based on height, weight, activity level, long-term goal (gain, lose, or maintain weight), and other factors. Overall, I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a free, comprehensive nutrition tracker with a great community you can go to for help and support.

title: Great app!
body: I really like how easy it is to track food, nutritions, weight, and progress of your eating habits with this app! If you need something to help you keep an eye on all of these things, this is your app! The only "con" is that although the data available for common foods is great, you might not find exactly what you are and have to enter the information manually. A great way to do this is to just split up your meal and enter the items individually (e.g. Cooked vegetables, cooked shrimp, rice, and sauce - as opposed to looking for "steamed vegetables with shrimp"). My favorite thing about this app is that you can go back and look at the previous days, add things, in case you forgot something, or simply see what you did that day to evaluate your progress along the way. I also love that you can track your exercise at the same time!

title: Exercise
body: Good and helpful. It is hard to realize what your calorie intake should be,but changing keeps you on track. I really like it doesn't cost and basically it does the same as weight watchers. It is hard work dieting but I like the fact I can still eat the things I like without going overboard. I am tired of the roller coaster ride of dieting at my age and once I get to my target weight all I will do is maintain it so I don't go crazy again. I like the rewards you can get from all the sponsor and that gives me an extra incentive to work at it harder. I have also learn to make time to walk even if I am tired at the end of the day. Not to thrilled about drinking water all the time but I do add tea once in awhile and it does take off on my calorie intake. All exercises are not listed but that can be dealt with by finding close to what you do.

title: This just might save my life!
body: This app not only makes counting calories easy but really fun too! I have never understood counting calories but with this simple, user friendly app I can do it in a snap! I am morbidly obese and need to make a drastic change immediately so we went looking for something like this, I described exactly what I needed to my friend and he found this app first on the list. I cannot believe how easy it is! You can look up brand names and even restaurants and find accurate caloric, serving, and carb info, and it tracks your exercise and activities too.  But most importantly, it tracks your water consumption. That is huge for me!  Using this app is going to change my life and quite possibly save it in the process. I am so pleased and excited for finding this wonderfully helpful app! Thank you Livestrong!

title: How is this rated so highly!?
body: I gave this app two stars because it wasn't COMPLETELY useless.  It calculates a calorie intake goal for you based on your personal goal of losing, gaining or maintaining weight.  When you start tracking the scanner used to scan products into the app is convenient, but not necessary since I can read.  And most food products with a barcode have a nutrition label.  Everything else is a waste of time.  For foods that don't have barcodes (I make almost all of my own foods: hummus, almond milk, ketchup, etc.) you have to somehow magically know the calorie content.  Weight watchers has a search function on their app and if I were to type in hummus, for example, it would bring up a bunch of hummus types and brands and I could choose one to add to my point tracker. Even if it isn't exact, id have some options.  Also: there is a search feature on their activity tracker too.  On THIS app?  Good luck- unless you also magically know how many calories your workout session burned.

title: Be brutally honest with your tracking and this will work
body: It's simple to use, it provides a ton of value for the free version. The database is deep, it's been extremely reliable, but only when you don't cheat! If you can be diligent and brutally honest with your entries, this app will keep you on track and on goal. Over time, thanks to repetition, you'll be able to estimate calories without referencing the app, but KEEP entering everything into the app! It keeps you accountable and that's half the battle, to stay brutally honest and accountable for your calories intake. If you're new to this type of app, expect some upfront time logging food into your favorites/recurring meals, but once they're available, the app makes it super simple to select from those food items and emails again. Updating becomes a breeze.

title: Healthy Lifestyle
body: I am a 35 year old mother of a 14 year old and a 5 month old. I have been using this app for about 4+ years. I love it! It makes you more aware of what your actually eating. It helps you to loose weight, maintain and change your eating habits for your health. I lost 25lbs in only a few months 4 years ago using this app. I have always been an athlete but I wasn't the best eater till using this app. I even used it while I was pregnant to make sure I ate enough. I only gained 25lbs and lost it all only a few days later. I only have a few suggestions for the Livestrong App. 1) there should be an option for pregnant and breastfeeding in profile so it changes your calorie intake 2) you should be able to share your plate to someone else's phone (like your husband) 3) there are still some workouts not in the system (ex. The shake weight). Over all I highly recommend the Livestrong App

title: What I needed!
body: I've been using this app for 5 days, while using several other calorie counting apps at the same time.  This one was the clear winner for me!  I went ahead and payed for the one year Gold membership since it is working to help me see what I'm consuming, as well as the distribution of protein, fat, and carbs.  This makes it much easier to see where I need to make changes.  I LOVE the scanner for automatic entry of foods!  It doesn't always have them, but it's easy to add a new one and their nutrient value in that case.  I also LOVE that you can make your own meal entries for things consumed often.  I haven't used all of the available resources on the app like community or exercise, but just might once I'm fully used to the app.

title: Loved the old app, hate the new app
body: I LOVED this app for a long time. The interface was wonderfully intuitive and it was fantastic for recording and planning meals, exercise, and especially balancing macros.

title: Better than myFitnessPal
body: Overall, I like it. Pretty easy to track diet and exercise. It's even easier if you take some time to setup meals and exercises that are part of your routine.

title: Simple and Easy to Use with an exception!
body: MyPlate is the easiest food and fitness app I've used yet. It takes a little more time for some of my customizations because I cook my own meals, and I have my own fitness program, but that's expected. Otherwise, click, select, and I'm tracking away!
response: Hi zipperbug, we are so sorry for this inconvenience! This is a bug that we are aware of and are working to fix. We've found that the problem is less prevalent when adding a custom food by clicking "My Food" and then "Create New Food". Please use this instead of using the green pop up button. Email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions or concerns!

title: Mixed bag--pluses and minuses
body: One of the few diet, nutrition apps that don't require setting up an account on line and transmitting personal food, health, etc. information to a 3rd party!

title: I lost weight
body: This app is incredible and it supports you in losing weight or gaining weight(muscle). Theres a great community of people on the app that help you out with any questions you have and they support you. I've finally stuck to a diet thanks to this app and I've lost almost 20 pounds. I feel satisfied when I enter my exercise and watch the calories cancel out. The water app you can get to sync with this app is also amazing and helps keep me hydrated. Definitely worth downloading and its a great app for people who want to keep their New Years resolutions! They do all the math for you and you just enter what you eat and stay within your limit! The graph is awesome and I can see my weight dropping over the course of months and it motivates me to keep going. 10/10.

title: Full service app, works great
body: I've been using this app for about five weeks now, and it's one of the best weight management apps I've ever tried. The food library is extensive - while not wholly accurate, it's definitely good enough to keep you on track. The layout is easy and intuitive. It captures all the important pieces in one screen view, the constant tally of carbs/protein/fat ratio and calorie balance has been super helpful for guiding me towards more balanced eating and thoughtful choices.

title: Improvements necessary. Works well enough to settle for.
body: I am someone looking to lose a few pounds starting from a healthy BMI, and losing a pound per week is too high of a deficit for me to manage without getting headaches, especially while being very active. The app lets you "set your own" goal, but I wish it had an option like "lose .5 pounds per week" for others like me.

title: My favorite food/activity tracking App
body: I have been using this app for 5 months and there are a lot of things I really like about it. I like that I can set my own daily calorie goal, and set my own macro percentage goals within that. I love that it syncs with my Apple Watch to track my activity. The voice search on the Watch app can be frustrating, but it's good for logging water and frequently eaten foods. I like being able to create custom meals, and add foods that aren't in their database (though you should be able to edit foods that you have added - sometime things I have added don't have the correct nutrition information after I have submitted them even though I added it correctly.) Overall, this is a great app and I use it every day.

title: Registration/ log in error???
body: Ok so I have used this app for years and I've LOVED it.  A couple days ago it signed me out so I tried to reconnect with Facebook but it said there was no account linked to it.  I knew this was wrong though because that's how I've logged in every time.  So I decided to log in manually and it kept saying my password was wrong, which it wasn't because I had it written down. But just to be sure, I clicked the "forgot password?" button and entered my email.  I have waited for hours and have tried it several different times but NO EMAIL CAME. So after that I just said screw it and decided to make a new account. Well, I did and when I was done, it said "registration error" and sent me back to the beginning. I did this FOUR TIMES.  There are no updates waiting to be downloaded and my internet has been working fine.  Please fix whatever this is because this was my FAVORITE calorie counter.  As soon as I am able to log in I will give it 5 stars.  Thanks

title: Like it so far
body: Less than a week in, and this is my first foray into food tracking, but so far so good! Cooked at home quite a bit and was easily able to track. First/only restaurant meal so far was easy to at least approximately upload. Never having tracked my diet before, I find it fascinating and educational.

title: Needs better engineering
body: I've only been using it for 24h, but am already frustrated by:

title: Used to be great...
body: I follow a ketogenic diet for health reasons (epilepsy), so I used to love this app. It was great for keeping track of my fat and protein intake, and to make sure I stayed below a certain amount of carbs each day. Then the app was updated, and the whole thing was changed. Instead of being able to visually see, with both a pie chart and the amounts shown in grams, how much fat/protein/carbs I was taking in each day, the update now shows how many grams of fat/protein/carbs I have "left" for the day. Then when you "run out" of your allotted fat/protein/carbs, it doesn't even tell you how many grams of each you've taken in through the day; it just says you have 0.0 grams left. It's not until the day after that you can see how many grams of each you ended the day with. With the diet I have to follow, this does me no good. I'm already looking into a new diet tracker, but hoping in the meantime that a new upgrade will bring this app to what it had been before.

title: Email glitch causing endless emails
body: UPDATE: developer contacted me and stopped the emails. If the next update allows me to delete posts I'll change it to 5 stars.
response: Hi Phoebus! We're so sorry for this inconvenience! We've stopped the emails from being sent to the email address associated with your account. Please be sure to email us at support@livestrong.com if you continue to receive unwanted communication from us.

title: Great for me!
body: This app is so helpful for tracking calorie intake and, specifically, what I eat. I really like to know about the protien content of my food, and it shows me how much is in eat serving. I just wish I could track my fiber intake as easily. But for a free version of the app, it's great! I'm not sure how much more useful the paid version would be, but right now I can't afford the $2.99 just to find out if it's any better. Plus, I learned how much I actually eat, I never realized I consumed so many calories, or how much fewer I should eat to stabilize my weight in my lifestyle. I am impressed with how you goal caloric intake is adjusted depended on your actual activity level, as well as what you want to lose or gain or even maintain. Great free app!!

title: Very helpful
body: Promptly fixed after ver. 4 wouldn't load on iPad 1. Single most useful thing in managing weight is logging calories, and this app makes it fairly easy to do that. My gripes are relatively minor. Individual food entry should be more flexible-just let me enter the exact number of grams or ounces of a food instead of having a set serving size and requiring me to figure out what fraction of that serving I had. Some servings are completely useless--a "slice"? That is not a unit of measure. Measuring chunky stuff like fruit by the cup is terribly inaccurate -- just let me weigh it. They did fix one issue in making foods entered for a given meal available to other meals under "recently eaten." But, why can't I create meals within the app? All-in-all, these are fairly minor complaints--app works very well all told.

title: Update is awesome
body: The update added most of the features I wanted but didnt have before. 1) tracking total grams protein, carbs, fat per day. Before it only showed daily percent. 2) able to add to daily food tracker after day is over.

title: Enjoy this app
body: This apps gets the job done. Simple to understand and easy to customize. If you are trying to track some food you ate and it's not in the database, you can create it yourself. It then keeps the created item in your recently consumed list which is excellent in my book. Perfect for those who may tweak there food and know the macros may need adjustment. On the flip side, the app has a few bugs (nothing that is a game breaker though). Sometimes after you track your meal, if will shoot you a reminder to track your meal...this could be just a input timing issue. I also noted one day it did lose my progress from the day before. Anyways, the app is great imo. Fits my needs of being able to compile everything I ate for the day and track my progress.

title: Lost weight online, losing weight mobile
body: I used the online version back in 2009 and lost 30 lbs. Since then, I gained some of them weight back so I am thankful to have My Plate available on my phone for free to lose the weight I gained back.

title: Just one thing
body: I love this app! It's great for tracking what you eat.  Tracking what you do is easy, it pulls from your phone or you can directly input! Plus, it has easy videos to follow for workouts.

title: Mostly great!!
body: I downloaded this app in hopes to maintain my weight and it has worked very well so far! The only suggestion I have is that dessert is also an option. I often find myself piling dessert in the dinner or snack category, making it seem like I ate about 400 extra calories. Also, I think that drinks should have their own category, because I always forget to add my drink to my meal. The last thing is that I think this app should have a wider variety of options of food to add. They should have all popular chain restaurant food items. I hope this review was helpful and do not let this stop you from trying the app. These are just suggestions to improve it. This app has truly improved my health and motivation and I will be using this for a very long time!

title: Fantastic!
body: I almost never write reviews, but this app has been extremely helpful in my journey to lose weight and regain my fitness level. I had always eaten very healthy, i.e. very low fat and low sugar diet. And yet I was gaining weight. With this app I discovered that I was just eating too much! So keeping track of what and how much I eat helped me learn much more about healthy nutrition, but I also lost 39 pounds in 4 months (bear in mind, I exercise hard 5-6 times a week). I also love the high-intensity interval training routines the Exercise section has. They were hard to complete for the first couple of months! Great way to really push yourself in 10 minutes. Long story short, one of the best apps I've ever had on my phone.

title: So glad I tried this app!!
body: I've attempted to use similar apps in the past to track food intake and exercise progress while tracking weight loss, but they weren't very easy to navigate and offered no motivation - so I never had much success with them.   To my great DM surprise, the LiveStrong app is exactly what I was looking for!  It's customizable without too many steps to go through, and - best of all - it works!!  I've been using the app faithfully for about 6 weeks and I've lost 11 lbs and already feel much healthier!   Since I've had so much success using the free version I'm ready now to take advantage of the very reasonably-priced full version to reach my overall goals.  I highly recommend this app!

title: I love the app, hate the ads
body: I've tried 4 different tracking apps and this is the best so far. Very easy to use and a very large database of foods. I'm not sure where they get the values for some of them as there are obvious errors in many. One Example: Extra virgin olive oil (Colivita). Total calories 120. Calories from fat 126. Where did the extra six calories come from??? A minor complaint, but who knows how many other values are off.

title: Cannot believe it's a lite edition app?! Free?! What?!
body: I have made a pledge to lose 50 lbs in 50 days and so far I have lost 16 lbs in 16 days with diet & exercise, and of course this great app!!  There is a remarkable amount of foods pre-programmed into the app, I have only had to manually add 2 individual foods, which is so nice because it's very quick & efficient to use the search & everything pops right up. It's not just a calorie counter either, the food list shows fat, protein & carbs nutrition facts per serving as well!  It also allows you to track the water you drink (super important!) and log your weight (which it displays as a chart) so cool!!!  If you want to join me in losing weight this is a great app to help along the way. #50lbsin50days

title: Great program
body: This weight loss program is working for me.  So far I have lost eight pounds.  I used another app and did not lose much weight and did not stick with it.  I think this one is working because it give me a more realistic calorie count for my age and activity level.  By the way, I am a senior citizen and can now wear a size 8-10.  Give it a try.  The key to success is to enter every bite you take and plan ahead if you are going to eat out.  Look up the calorie count BEFORE you eat it--not after like I have done a few times.  I never again will scarf down a 7-11 brownie then look up the calories when I get home.  Those suckers have 600 calories in them!  Good luck you can do it!

title: Highly satisfied
body: First and foremost this app is free so I am still amazed at the quality of this app. For awhile I even thought maybe it was a trial version and after certain amount of time I would be prompted to buy full version. I just knew it had to be a catch. Not only is it still free but at this point if they charged me I would buy it because I'm hooked. I only been using it for one week and lost 5.7 lbs in one week. I recommend it to any and everyone. It's so perfect that its right on your phone so easy to track and keeps you conscious of everything you eat an portion sizes. And any food and exercise you can think of was in database. I'm telling everyone about this!!!!

title: Great app, but serious bugs must be gone
body: I've been using this app now for a while. And it seems that the app is having major issues since the iOS update. For one, scanning items has become nearly impossible. Every item either doesn't exist or I get an error message. Two, the app crashes constantly. I can't add my exercise on for the day and it drives me crazy to have to turn off my phone and try again. Third, searching food items needs some work. I searched steamed corn a few days ago. After shutting off wifi 3 times, I finally got a few choices. The app doesn't use wifi and doesn't recognize the demand to use wifi. So it does need some SERIOUS TLC. But over all the app looks and feels good to use. It has a sensible calorie goal and in a week I've lost 5 pounds. It feels great to be out of a size 18.

title: Great app until update
body: I've been using this app for a while now and love how it tracks my foods, how I can make "meals" that I use often and track exercise. I love scanning in foods, which for the most part the app recognizes. I've built up a decent database up until this last update. After the update, a lot of my foods' nutritional content were changed (i.e. My peanut butter is now 14 calories per 2 tbsp). And as much as I wish it were true, it's not and it's thrown off my calorie counts. The pictures of the foods were also switched, but that was just convenience. I still love the app, but now I need to revise most of my food already entered which is a pain. Hopefully this will not happen again with the next update. I would've given 5 stars before the update.

title: Excellent app, but...
body: The nutrition info is off on a LOT of foods (as compared to the actual label on the product), even "verified" ones. In most cases, it usually seems to underestimate the calories in an item; although I've run into it being over a couple of times. I've also noticed that some specific items have several different options with varying nutrition facts, even if the portion is the same. It would be nice if the food database had fewer repeat items with different info, and had consistently accurate information. It's a bit ridiculous that I can scan a barcode and come up with incorrect nutrition facts.

title: Awesome!
body: I honestly love this app, it's easy to use, I'm not sure if it helps you really lose weight with the goals because I'm already active but I was eating anything and everything and not seeing much improvement. If you enter everything you eat honestly it makes you accountable for the choices you make which, hopefully, leads to better ones! It also lets you keep track of exercise which is also motivation to get to enter your workouts in! All in all I love it and it does just what it says, helps you track your calories :) just remember that calories are not all equal so 150 cal of salad and 150 cal or chips are not the same so go healthy when you can!

title: Overall very useful
body: It is effective if you honestly use it and pay attention to servings sizes.

title: Great, when it works
body: Overall i really like this app. It really is helping me to get in better shape, and is more user friendly than the my fitness pal app. My biggest complaint though is that sometimes the food search just completely stops returning results, even when i have a strong internet connection. It just shows a blank screen with a bunch of horizontal lines, with no "no results found" message, or the ability to add more foods or whatever. Not sure if their servers are having issues or what, but it's pretty annoying when you're trying to track calories and no foods are loading, makes it pretty much unusable. I wouldn't recommend getting the paid version until they figure out those loading issues.

title: Good app
body: Have been using this app for around a year. The database definitely needs some work, but that is not a real issue for me because I input my own food anyways. I love the option they give for meals. I have a few suggestions that would absolutely make my life:

title: Ms.
body: Losing weight after 60 isn't easy, but this ap's tracking and graphing help me stay focused on getting rid of some excess baggage and feeling better. I've taken more walks in this last two weeks than in the previous six months. At the moment, I'm down 4.6 pounds, though I don't expect that rate to continue -- and I'd soon look like the saggy, baggy elephant if it did!

title: Near perfect food journal and weight loss app
body: I've recommended MyPlate to any friend or family member who will listen, as this app is almost solely responsible for my losing 20-25 lbs in roughly 4 to 5 months. I found the caloric suggestion to be spot on, more or less, and the large database of food immensely helpful in accurately tracking my nutritional intake for daily meals.

title: Please fix
body: I don't always eat exactly one serving, a lot of the time I'll only eat a half... When I plug in half a serving, it's tracking the calories for a full serving- it even says full serving...!8 try to update to half, and save, and the full serving is still showing in my counter. The first few days using the app I didn't notice this, so was under my calorie goal for the day as the app was including calories I hadn't consumed, and telling me if already reached my goal for the day. This is getting very annoying as I'm having to either delete the half serving and tell myself not to up to the max for the day, or make up a food manually to use as a place holder. This app has such a huge list of foods, and I'm having to create a food just to have the calories, in a CALORIE COUNTING APP, correctly be counted... That's ridiculous. Please- this seems to be an easy fix...

title: Review from a personal trainer
body: The concept of this app is great - manually log your food & beverage intake (organized in categories of breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, water & exercises) and gives you a caloric goal based on you and your personal goals.

title: Best tracker I've used, so far
body: I really prefer this tracker, so far. Easy to use, nice interface, and has great features. One is a scanner - though the app contains a large database of foods, it also accurately added the data for a generic brand item, from its barcode. Easy to see all your daily meal, exercise and water data in one screen, plus additional screen for overall progress chart. Also has quick (5 to 10 min) workout routines, ability to add custom workouts that you do. Simple profile setup and really thoughtful community sections/topics. It's quick to track everything almost instantly, and get back to what you were doing.

title: Sync Override-After updating
body: I had heard glowing review about this app so I decided to give it a try. I experience a few minor issues originally but with this last update it is out of hand. All of my data got overridden by some one else. The only that I could spot that was similar between our two's data was that we both had Apple Watches(figured I would throw this out there to possibly help the devs) When I tried to sync with the server to get my data back it was to no avail. I tried logging in and back out and still someone else's data was there! When I gave up hope and decided to go create a new account, it wouldn't let me, it kept on giving me server errors. Overall I like this GUI more than My Fitness Pal but My Fitness Pal has never had an issue like this. If this doesn't get fixed immediately I will go back to using My Fitness Pal which has never screwed up this bad!

title: Nutritional awareness through easy tracking
body: This app makes it easy to track food and water consumption on-the-go with a website and apps for iOS devices, including iPad, iPhone and the Apple Watch. Programmable reminders and synchronization with wearable fitness devices make it a timely and accurate nutrition monitor.

title: Better than Weight Watchers
body: This app has been such a God send! I have done Weights Watchers (WW) twice in the last five years with fantastic results but the reality is, it's expensive and not conducive to reality. Counting calories is so much easier than counting "points" and you feel free to eat what you want, when you want. This app links to you Apple Health which is even better because it also informs you how many calories you burned. I just think it's so great. I can't believe you get as much access as you do for free. There is of course a gold level which costs money but the free offer of this app provides me with all I need and more. Definitely worth the download.

title: Quick and easy to use
body: I am sure I don't use the app for all that it can do but I do use it for logging my food/calorie intake and water intake. It is quick and easy. Most of the foods are already loaded in and a couple keystrokes will bring it up or something really close. I also love the barcode scanner. One zap and my food choice is logged and calculated. I just wish I could have everything in one app and maybe I do and just don't know it but I use my Apple Watch for fitness tracking, run for weight loss app for a virtual fitness coach, and this for food and hydration. It works but would work better if it was one stop shop!  LUV THIS APP NO LESS!

title: Great app!
body: I am trying to get my weight in check before it gets too bad. This app really helps me manage my food intake and I know thats one of the most important areas of weight loss to focus on.

title: Wow!
body: This is  an amazing app in every sense of the word. From a technical standpoint the interface and underlying database technology far exceeded my expectations balancing ease of use with an amazing level of sophistication. As an active woman struggling with my weight it provides me with a guilt free honest snapshot of my successes and failures; this app even has info for my vitamins, supplements, and snacks! Not only does it keep me on track at home but I traveled recently to Maine for a job interview. I was able to find 100% of all the items I ate in the airport, room service, and other meals!
