While I exceeded my daily caloric goals, the app helped me to make healthy choices and not stray too far off the mark!

title: My Plate is helping me reach my goal
body: User friendly easy to use app makes me visualize exactly what is on my plate. Keeps my goal in front of me at all times. I am motivated by the extra portions I can have when I enter my exercises. Love that i determine if I want to workout and get a food reward, get even closer to my goal, or be lazy and forego my extra snack. All without getting off track of my goal. I like tracking my water too which shows me how i get hungrier when my water intake is low. Great app has everything I need to track my fitness and nutrition-- calorie intake, exercise calories burned, bmi/weight, searchable nutrition information, water intake, and tracking my goals.

title: Keeps me honest
body: As the designers state, this app is meant to keep you honest. Tracking everything, every day really opens your eyes and makes you aware of what you're putting into your body. So if you don't like looking into the mirror of truth, this app is not for you! It's great for setting and visualizing goals which is the first crucial step to realizing those goals. There's an added bonus of mPoints you can accumulate which makes it even more interesting to log in and track each day. This app has great coverage of many different foods it would get the last star if it were more accurate but I understand other people are adding foods and those may ot be accurate. I recommend this app!

title: Superb app
body: This app was very helpful preferably with being able to recognize and keep track what I was consuming as well as my daily intake of calories, fats, carbs, and protein. Additionally, this app provided a weight tracker and was able to graph it on a chart which was quite intriguing to see my weight loss drop from a graphical perspective as days/weeks went by. Unfortunately I have no further use of this app for I'm now able to use my daily routine of meals with slight variety of foods. However this app got me started on my weight loss plan and helped me succeed as well as provide me what I needed at the time. A food tracker.

title: Needs a mathematician...
body: ...to program it. Some foods are in ounces, some in grams, some in "servings". There is no way to change the units and have it auto-calculate the conversion. This leads to significant errors in the totals.

title: Best app ever.
body: I LOVE this app. Because you calculate exactly what you eat. It's perfect for weight loss, weight maintenance, etc.  What I'd like it to have is a bit of recommendations on what to eat during the day, and add exercises so I can actually know how many calories I burned, because the step tracker is great but if I do any other exercise I'd like to know how much I burned.  Also, it would be better if it had an area where you could type if you feel bloated, or post pictures of yourself to keep track (with privacy options of course), and maybe tips on how to avoid bloat, or find fiber-rich foods, etc. But it's still a great app. I couldn't live without it!

title: Loving the workouts!
body: The short workouts are great -- hard, but really good cause they are fast and easy to do just about anywhere. And the new Gold workouts are great for targeting a specific part of the body. I love how it automatically tracks the calories burned. Also love that I can set up my same breakfast to automatically track every morning. As well as the lunch I eat most weekdays. This app continues to makes it easy for me to manage my weight. It makes me honest with myself about what I'm eating. Super cool to see all my progress over the year with the charts. And the others using the app help keep me motivated and answer my questions.

title: Best Weight Management App!!
body: After paying for WW I decided to look for an app that did similar things like track what I eat and my weight and boy does this app do this and more! It's so user friendly and much easier to use!! Thank you for making this for people like me who are trying to make lifestyle changes a little at a time by making wiser choices instead of going on roller coaster diets!

title: Very useful tool to keep track of ones food intake
body: I started using this app a month ago. I logged all the food I ate , snacked and drank . When I Frist started logging my foods ,the design it had to show you the carbs fats and protein you intake enabled me to realize i was eating way too much carbs and fats and not enough protein . I since then am on a reduced low carb diet , consisting of eating 60 grams of carbs a meal 3 times a day .i I thought it would be easy, but I has I went on I figured that out that a lot of the food I eat and I'm general  has a lot of carbs in them. But since I've done this I was able to lose 6 pounds. Recommend this app to anybody

title: The good, bad and desperately needed improvements
body: Good: the app has an accurate scanner which makes adding my food in much easier. It also allows me to add yesterday's breakfast which is great because I eat the same thing everyday
response: Hi Corith98- Thank you for your review regarding our latest update! Our team is working on making changes based on user comments, so we appreciate your feedback. We will pass your concerns and suggestions on to our development team.

title: Quality meal tracker
body: This app is great -- you give it your info, your weight goal, and it gives you a target calorie goal. Tracking your meals throughout the day is very simple as the search function includes ALL sorts of foods. It gives you a snapshot of your macronutrient ratios for the day, which I've found very useful -- it's not thorough enough for an in depth evaluation however. The best part about this app is that it makes you aware of everything you put in to your body. I've actually found it hard some days to get up to my calorie goal, especially when eating good foods! Only things it's missing are long term nutrient, water, and exercise trackers. Great app overall, especially for free!

title: 59candyapple
body: One of my biggest health challenges is remembering to eat and that can be as much if not more of a diet disaster than someone than over eats because it causes all kinds of unfortunate side effects! I'm just starting to use this new app and with it being a new free app that's easy to use and handy with my phone with a built in immediate reward system I'm already feeling good about making more positive choices and being able to easily track everything in one convenient app on my phone that I'm using all the time for multiple purposes! I can see how this is going to be a really positive tool in assisting me in reaching healthier goals! Thank you so much Live strong for REAL LIFE TOOLS THAT WORK WITH US!!! ; )

title: Let the transformation begin!!
body: Today I woke up feeling worst than ever before... I'm 100 lbs overweight, I don't sleep well, I don't exercise and worst of all I eat all everything that I crave.  Most of which are very unhealthy, processed, sugary and high in fat!  I've gained a lot of weight with this lifestyle and It all ends today!! Thanks to this wonderful app, I got half the work cut out for me. All I got to do now is MAKE BETTER DECISIONS, eat more plant based food, some protein and lots and LOTS OF WATER AND EXERCISE! I'm not ready for any of this but today is the  the day. i will take my first step and I will continue this journey until I reach my goal! Thanks for this app I really appreciate it :)

title: A great way to stay on track
body: I'm a long time user of the app, so I've used a few different versions of it. This latest version is just as good. It's a great way to stay motivated and keep on track - and also review progress and slumps!  I've had no problems with it suddenly quitting or freezing - it runs really smoothly. The only thing I don't like is in the exercise section, if you want to log in a custom workout, it makes you calculate the hourly calorie burn and then divide it by the number of minutes you worked out. It used to have a function that just allowed you write in the calories you burned for the minutes you worked out.

title: Sync to desktop; print reports
body: This app is great for tracking calories on the go. The food library is huge. I have used off and on for over a year and find it very helpful to remind me where I'm at. However, the desktop version and mobile version are not syncing. This is problematic because I like to print reports to bring to appointments with me. Just showing someone on the app is too narrow to give a full picture of my calorie intake over weeks to months. If there was a way to email or print reports directly from the mobile app, this would eliminate the need for desktop syncing. Therefore 3 stars -- great for tracking on the go but needs some work to be more useful to users who are using it for real health needs and reports.

title: Great app! No txfr issues
body: I've used the website/app for many years and love it.  I have an iPhone 6 and ipad2 and had no issues switching to the new version.  All data (at least 5 yrs worth) transferred.  To those saying the food is all in different measurements... Yes, because it's user entered.  Enter your own if there isn't an entry in a measurement you need... Or use the barcode scanner.  This app only works as well as the person faithfully documenting what you eat/drink and excercise.  If you track appropriately it makes the lifestyle change easier because you hold yourself accountable.  You see what snacking looks like in numbers.

title: Great, flexible app!
body: This app is a great tool for tracking your calorie intake, and burned calories.  You'd be surprised how easily things can add up, and taking the time to properly log your food helps make you more aware, and better decisions.

title: Just started and it's  already helping!!
body: So I had just downloaded the app and put in everything I ate during the day (which turned out to be way over the recommendation  limit). Anyways, this app has precise and accurate calorie calculation! I also plugged in my runs and walk home during the day, it calculates it into what I ate to show my calorie consumption during the day! It has everything I have been looking for in a healthy lifestyle app. I love it! It is defiantly worth a shot! (Did I mention the community is great too, there will always be a person to answer a question about weight loss or fitness, even the pros!)

title: Easy to use
body: I really like My Plate. It is easy to use and pretty fast. It doesn't have quite as many foods as other apps, but it feels less obtrusive to me. I tried other apps and felt like I was being hounded constantly through notifications and email. I get a very helpful email from this app that was my choice to get and I actually read it. I also appreciate that it communicates with my iHealth app on excercise and steps. The one thing I find missing, and it's a biggy, is that I can't put a recipe in and have it count and divide servings. I have to go to an external website to do it. I hope they are working on that for the future.

title: Needs better database
body: When I decided it was time to start eating more mindfully and begin keeping track of calories I downloaded this and another free diet tracker. This one won out because of the interface and the fact that it allowed me 200 more cal/day to reach my goal (I lost 2.5 lb in the first week so it must be right). The only problem is the database of food is more limited than the other app so I ended up keeping that one just as a reference when I can't find a food (especially a brand name or restaurant item) on this one. It also has weird glitches occasionally with not recording everything you enter for a new food. Overall it does the job though.

title: Telling the truth
body: I decided if he was going to tell the truth then I should too, about everything I put in my mouth, down 4lbs in first week.  It is fun, my phone is in my hand all the time anyway, might has well use your app and my phone FOR me, not just as a way for others to engage or need me.  Don't get the points part yet, but seems like I am winning and that's fun.  Kudos to you for having a great food list too, you have so much of what I eat and so that is great because it is not punishing or work to log it and keeps me out of doing this 'food math' in my head.  Great job, keep telling the truth, you have my word I will too!  Shazam! C

title: Close to perfect...
body: Overall I love this app. It makes it easy to add in foods and exercises with some customizable options without being overwhelming. I also feel the calorie estimations for my daily intake are more accurate than others I've tried. A few things I'd love to see improve: 1. Searching for foods can be difficult, it seems to be somewhat limited to the order in which you enter the words in the item. (So "brand x soup" might not find "soup brand x".) 2. I'd love to see the ideal nutrient breakdown along with my actual one. 3. I'd love to have the option when I go to the recent foods or foods I eat often sections to see items from all meals, rather than just the one I'm in.

title: Seriously A Must Have
body: If you are looking to lose weight and become more healthy then this app is a serious must have!  Not only does it track what I've consumed, but I can look foods up before I eat them to see the carb and calorie counts.  Sometimes you have to get creative when listing foods and servings, but the pros far outweigh the cons.  This app has helped keep me accountable.  I love the ability to track my weight, calories, and other specifics and see a graph to identify trends.  No, not every food is on here but it does have a rather large database and you do have the option to add things.  All in all, a great app!

title: Best calorie tracker available!
body: Has everything any other calorie tracker has, but implements it in a clean, simple, and non-cluttered fashion. It has most of the things I look up already on the database. If it's not on there, it is super easy to add manually.

title: What a Great App!!!
body: This app is what I have been looking for for along time. It is so easy to use!! I have lost 120 pounds and always wonder how many calories I was eating. I tried to count them but I didn't right them down and I would forget how many I had. Now I have found this app, I don't have to write them down or remember how much I was eating, it tells me brands I am eating and get the right calories. It tells me how many calories I am burning off and how much water I am drinking. I will get to my goal weight faster because I will know how many calories I am consuming. It has so much more to the app! This is a must app to have!!!

title: Update completely changed interface, no longer aesthetically pleasing for my use
body: This calorie counting app did what all the other ones out there do, and for me it looked very clean and summarized calorie count by meal with visually-pleasing circles that showed total calorie count per meal and that you could click into to add your foods.

title: Beats USDA site, but could improve
body: I used the Livestrong web site years ago for tracking food, and found it excellent - including nutrition info including fiber that are important to me, and focusing on calories and nutrition rather than food groups as the USDA tracking site does.

title: It has potential
body: I really like the simple interface design and workouts but I had to delete this and get "Lose It" instead since it has some functionality dealbreakers for me that's not offered. 1) I don't like how when adding a food entry, it doesn't allow me to add all the details such as sodium and vitamins. It seems this app is primarily concerned with carbohydrates, fats, and sugars only... which I understand however that's not for me because I like to take into account the whole nutritional profile. So when something I'd like to track has high sodium, but displays 0 sodium since there was no option to edit that when I was adding the entry... that information becomes false (misleading) and ultimately confusing and thus useless to me. 2) I'm a visual person and I did not see the option to add pictures of my food and/or body...

title: Love it and addicted
body: Even at a young age I'm still growing. But I wanted to start healthy! So with this app I have lost a lot of unwanted fat and I have noticed what I have been eating. How many calories that thing has or even the carbs worried me the most! But with this app you can lose weight and stay healthy! I also love this app because it tracks my exercise! I have a Fitbit, but I like to keep track on here just for the heck of it! But it tells how many calories I can still consume after I have already ate something! It tells me how many calories I also burnt so that definitely helps a lot of people! -/CocoaBeanCOrps\~*

title: Break it down!
body: I still love this app.  So easy to enter what I've eaten and see what is remaining.  The food database is great.  I like the short increments allowed for exercise. I have to break up a day tied to a desk and phone with exercise breaks. I can track what I did and how much water I drank. It's all here! The new activity tracker is fantastic on days I am moving a lot, but not on a treadmill.

title: A convenient app for food/calorie tracking
body: I have a daughter with autism who eats pretty healthy but doesn't always understand portion control. This really helps me keep track how much she has eaten over the course of the day and how much exercise she has gotten. I like that I can build a "meal" and then just click on that when she eats a common meal instead of having to add each ingredient each time. What I'd fix: you can't edit exercise once added and the green color on the graph makes it look good when you eat too little of something (like fiber) that you are trying to exceed. Make it red if you have too little of something like water and fiber, not green.

title: Makes it really easy
body: I hate tracking this kind of stuff because it really shows off any bad habits you might have. I was a perpetual snacker before I started using this, and consequently wasn't losing the weight I wanted to. This really helps me maintain a healthy balance.

title: great app for tracking calories and losing weight
body: this is by far my favorite calorie counting apps! I love that it can track how many calories you lose by moving around and doing daily things... you can also add the amount of calories you burned at the gym or working out. I became truly motivated as soon as I saw my weight dropping just a little bit each day! If you had an eating forded or you are under weight you can pick that you want to gain weight and it tells you how many calories to eat everyday and how much to workout to gain muscles. Overall this is a great app to keep you healthy and fit!

title: üòèüòéüëÄüòéüëÄüòÑüëåüèªüëåüèªüëåüèªüëåüèªluv it thanks awesome helpful amaz
body: I'm a teenager and a little self conscious on my weight.... I run distance, but I find my self eating...  A LOT..... I was kinda worried, since I was the youngest and was prone to getting picked on... I am a healthy weight.... But I knew that during the summer I don't run and with me eating all the time I gain weight... So I decided to get a diet app.... I looked it up and my plate popped up, so I got it.... Best App Ever!!!üòèüòéüëÄ thank you so much Myplate it makes it easier to lose weight and stay fit and keep it up... I had tried a few other apps like this and I slowly stopped using them... But no Myplate thanks!!!üòèüòéüëÄüòÑüëåüèªüëåüèªüëåüèª

title: Good but costs to add features
body: Have the basic app and works quite easily to track calories and exercise.  However, it will cost me money if I want to see how my exercise performance over time.  Older version did this free.  Scan of bar good is a great and easy feature.  Also older version better for tracking exercise by time, not just by calories consumed.  Also would be nice if it could track distances so you could like back and see how far you've gone.  Alas not to be so at some point will find another app that will track both time and distances separately.  So in retrospect probably more 3 rated than 4 but can't change the rating now.

title: Used to love
body: I've used this app since November and I have loved it and recommended it. Though over the past month it has seemed to fall apart. When I use the force sync it changes my weights (or adds ones I didn't enter) to 140. I emailed customer support and was told to just change them and if I needed help they would help. Umm yeah I know how to change it I just shouldn't have to. Now it has changed old dates intakes making the calories the serving size. So a day in June it said I ate 22,000 calories. For breakfast it changed a 1/3 serving of pancakes which was 64 calories to a serving of 64. I shouldn't have to go back though and consistently double check to make sure the program works. Yes I have the free version but I'm glad because if I were paying for this I would be even more infuriated.

title: Very helpful but could be perfected
body: Very good tracking tool. Their database is huge and it is very easy to find an item through scanning. However the search results with key words does not always make sense. Then item unit of measure are always in "cup" rather than weight Oz ( like vegetables, etc) I agree that for some food it should be the default setting but the app should always give you oz as a second option (and not fl oz!). The "create your own food" menu should allow you to drag in already recorded ingredients so you don't have to add all proteins etc yourself. Beside these little room for improvement suggestions, I am very happy with this App.

title: Perfect for cooking your own meals
body: This is the best free food tracker I have ever used and I have tried probably at least 70% of them. The fat/carb/protein chart really helped me realize how little protein I've been eating and allowed me to adjust. Now my appetite has gone from binge eating 24/7 to actually having to remind myself to eat every few hours because I don't have the cravings I used to. Also, the "create new food" under the my food menu is perfect for those who cook solely from recipes. It was really easy to plug in all the nutrition data from the recipe instead of having to add individual foods and guess. Love it.

title: All around great app for tracking fitness
body: All around functionality is very good.  App is pretty intuitive to use.  Stability is good with very few hangs or crashes. Data syncs to the website for easy input or review while using my PC.

title: Love/Hate relationship
body: I love the way the app looks great however the recent update is not to my taste- I preferred the last interface.
response: Hi Nica- we're sorry that you've had this experience but glad to hear that you've had success with MyPlate. We've heard the desire to track vitamins and minerals from other users and it something we hope to implement in the future. Please dont' hesitate to email us at support@livestrong.com if you ever feel that someone on the community board is violating our Community Guidelines. Lastly, our team is aware of the bug with the step tracking and is working hard to resolve this. Again, please don't hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns!

title: 3.5 stars
body: It's a great tool for beginners by being able to track calories. I have noticed though that a few food items have incorrect nutritional values for them. For example there are two different choices for a single date where one is correct & the other has something like 500ish g of carbs & 600ish g of fat in ONE pitted date. Also when you manually enter your exercises it won't recalculate calories burned if you adjust the times if you went longer or shorter distances. Also not enough exercises to chose from, just the basics. As I said it is a great tool for beginner dieters & those who need refreshed on how many calories they consume but I wouldn't recommend to those who know the general basics of nutritional facts

title: Good App
body: This is a great way to track calories, but I wish they would make 4 improvements:

title: Change it back!
body: This used to be a five star app. I've used this app for months, and have loved how easy it made it to keep track of my calories and water - and stay on track for my goal. BUT then they "updated" it and now I fight with it every day. It used to have a wheel to spin so that you could easily change your serving size from 1/4 of a serving up to multiple servings, and water from 2 oz up. Now in order to change the serving, you have to hit a tiny little window, that is to close to the "I ate that" button and very unresponsive. Often while trying to open it I end up hitting the button above, and then I have to go into the "my diary" section to try to edit it. I REALLY wish they would just CHANGE IT BACK! It worked great before...

title: Great app
body: I've using this app for two weeks now and so far it's been a huge success!  The two downsides and hence the reason for only four stars are that for as robust as the foods options are when you enter your calories I find a lot of products are not available for scan.  The list of sku's and restaurant foods needs to continue to evolve.  But again I am still giving 4out of 5 stars for the total ease of use and functionality.  The only other downside (and honestly it is a separate app) is the Drink Water app.  I can't remember what is was called but whatever it was I just plain and simply could not figure out how to use it properly.

title: Not perfect, but very good
body: While this app still has a little ways to go, it's a great tool to have while losing weight, gaining weight, or just trying to stay healthy. It's very easy to track food and exercise and has a really useful forum as well where you can discuss with others about practically anything. The only thing I wish I could do would be to read ingredients and instructions for recipes so I can cook from my phone (this can be done on the mobile site so it's not a huge deal, but would be nice to have access to it on the app). Overall, it's a really great, simple app!

title: Great app
body: I've had this app for almost 3 weeks now. Some of the calorie amounts are incorrect but they are only off by 10-20 either way. I'm using mine more for a weight tracker than a calorie tracker but I fin it fun and easy to input my calorie intake. I wish that the progress chart showed my weight first and foremost but I'm okay with switching it because I know this is a calorie tracker and not a weight tracker app. It's very user friendly and very easy to navigate. I think it just needs a little work on some of the verified foods because those are the ones that seem to be off the most. I usually just adjust my intake to reflect the correct amount.

title: Useful but problematic
body: Just realized that my weight is required, as is a weight-related goal. This is foolish and rooted in a diet-stupid culture. Nutrition is an end in itself! Worse, though I don't enter weight data daily, this app tells Apple Health that a new measurement has been taken, using the weight in my profile. This is incorrect and careless, and it's polluting my medical record with phony data points. Stop!!! Only record a new weight when I add one! And stop requiring weight in the first place.

title: üëçüèªGoodbye my fitness palüòª
body: Update:üåπ Watch the pounds meltaway‚Ä¶still five stars‚Ä¶ still love this app!!üå∫üíêüëºüèºThank God for MyPlate!üòá Greed and under armor ruined my fitness pal. üê∏A great thing,üòò considering it helped me find MyPlate!üòõ Everything is right there on the home screen and somehow not cluttered or tiny.üíú I like using this app more than I ever liked any other. I üíó the layout of daily input. üåπThe design makes it extremely easy and quick to read.üòé I've been using MFP for a couple of years‚Ä¶üíöso just a matter of retraining my brain to MyPlate!! üíôThank you üêôThank you üêµThank you üêíThank you üêºThank you üíófor a great app!üéÄüö¥üèºüèäüèºüëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª

title: Does NOT sync, inconsistent
body: This is a very useful app. I could really like it, except that it doesn't sync well between my iPhone and iPad. It gives me two different calorie goals on each machine, and it won't give me access on the iPad to yesterday's food data, put into the iPhone. With my 55 yr old eyes, the iPad is so much easier for data entry, and I needed to make an adjustment to yesterday's food intake but wasn't able to. Although I can really like this app, not being able to sync between the iPhone and iPad is irritating enough to look elsewhere. Worse yet, with everything else being equal, it gives me an automatic goal of 300 calories more on the iPad than on the iPhone. Go figure.

title: Not bad for free!
body: Found this app very to use but there's a bug where your calories burned fluctuate randomly so you don't know what your true burn count is (still happening as of the latest update on June 21). Also, for particular food choices without bar codes, it's difficult to know what to choose as there's no indication of size or what the item contains. For instance looking for pesto pasta pulls up 30 generic options to choose from - all with different calorie counts. Also, some options have the term 'recipe' next to it but it's not clear if you need the gold membership to view these or what. Saying this, the user interface is great and there's lots of great features which come with the free version.

title: Very helpful. Keeps me accountable!
body: This app has really made a difference in my eating and exercise habits. I pay attention to the quality, and quantity of food I eat when I have to see it written down each day! I have seen significant positive changes in my body in just three weeks of using this app. I have been consistent with my exercise regimen and with not eating more calories than I will burn in a day since I began using the "my plate" tracker. I love that it tells me how many calories I have left for the day each time I enter a meal or snack. I have learned exactly WHERE I was overeating. It has been majorly helpful to me.

title: Pretty good, could use some features
body: So far, I've had a great time using this app. It's easy and effective to track caloric intake, exercise, and water intake. However, it could use a feature or two.

title: Best nutrition app I've tried‚Äî but please change icon
body: Highly recommend over myfitnesspal and similar apps. Firstly, it's much easier on the eyes. The protein/carb/fat pie chart is super useful. When searching for food you will actually get real results for homemade meals instead of the endless lists of Stoffer's, Marie Calendar's and other icky foods no one eats (hopefully‚Äî otherwise why would you have a calorie counting app). My biggest complaint is that the name of the app and its icon kind of gross me out. I use it so much I want to put it on my homescreen but it's just too ugly. Can you at least change the icon to a nice fruit shape with a gradient background or something?

title: Great for starters
body: This app is great! It'll help you get on track and see what your daily intake is and what it should be. The only thing I would improve it the exercise portion doesn't have much to choose from. Such as if I did 100 sit ups it wants you to say how long instead of how many or if you did 100 squats there is no choice for squats (it's annoying) other then that it's great! Another amazing thing is you can just scan the barcode of something you ate. It's great. I only started a week ago and weighed 146 and am down to 144 and feel like I have a ton of energy. It crazy!

title: I like it‚Ä¶ For the most part.
body: This app is easy to use and does have a large database of foods. I do wish more of them were verified, and I also wish that there was a focus on fiber intake. I wish that it was highlighted in that little nutrition circle that shows you the percentages of what you've eaten for the day. Fiber is such an important part of a balanced diet, and a easy single look percentage would be super helpful.  But mostly, I really like this app. I do feel like the food journal is somewhat general, since I am not weighing every single meal. So I don't rely on it for 100% accuracy. I think as long as you keep that in mind, you're in good shape

title: What I've been missing
body: I've tried the manual calorie-counting thing in the past and it's just been too much for me to maintain regularly. At someone's suggestion, I decided to try this out in order to track my eating habits. This has been everything I've been missing, and has made the process much easier. It minimizes the guessing needed to estimate calories, and it has shown me how much I've actually been under-eating in pursuit of my goals. There's a lot more than just calorie/nutrition tracking in this app, as it also has cool workout ideas. I highly recommend.

title: Helpful, thorough app
body: In combination with a personal health plan, this app helps me to hold myself accountable EASILY through tracking my exercise and food intake.  It's helpful to immediately see that what I just consumed contained more carbs than protein, or vice versa though a color coordinated graph. It's helping me rethink my meals to get more balance throughout the day instead of packing on the carbs in the evening. I chart my meals and water throughout the day and I find myself being more productive because I am exercising, focused on a goal and have a plan which I am following with the support of the app. Very happy with this find

title: Really Like it, but some problems/possible bug
body: I really like the way this app feels. With it's large library of foods and especially the barcode scanner, it's easy to keep track of what I'm eating. A lot of other reviews have talked about the exercise tracking. Personally, I have not used that feature, so I can't speak to how well it works or not. One problem I have been having recently is that when I log in using Facebook, I have to log in again after I close the app. This is really annoying since it explains how to use the app every time I log in. And takes more time to log my meals. Maybe this is a possible bug. Regardless, I do really like how this app feels and works.

title: Two thumbs down for the newest update
body: I've been logging with MyPlate for about two years; the newest update, however, is atrocious at best. Glad that the update has been fixed to where I can now see my macros consumed instead of just macros left. The new update feels "watered down". Glad also to have the info button back again to see my micro totals (sugar, fiber, etc.). I'm now having to use My Fitness Pal but I hate the ads. MyPlate used to knock the socks off of MFP; please make the newest version of the app go away. Also, I really hate that I can no longer scroll down and see my meals logged. I have to click on the meal to see details. Even MFP lets you scroll down to see your totals! Please fix these annoying aspects of your update.

title: Needs work
body: Entering most food items is moderately easy, though I would like to see the option to enter items by weight rather than just by number of servings.  I weigh all my non packaged foods, and having to convert that to a number of servings with limited fraction options is not very precise.
response: Hi Gilgamesh - thank you so much for your review and feedback! We will definitely pass this on to our developers. We apologize for the exercise bug that you are experiencing. We are aware of this and are working on a fix. In the meantime, please follow the steps below to remove these incorrect entries from your Activity Diary:

title: Great Motivator
body: This app is an excellent motivational tool to really get you to examine the foods you eat. Very easy to find food items to record meals throughout the day and the exercise function is a great add on.

title: Great app but I feel is missing a few things
body: This app is great and has a lot of food in their database (though not everything and you can't read the full name title sometimes or know the ingredients.) I watch my carb intake per meal/snack not only for weight but for diabetic/medical reasons. It doesn't really track that. Some of the exercises are limited; I have to manually enter my long runs from Nike+. The only thing I know that comes with the upgrade is adding recipes and such which I'm still deciding if its worth it. Despite my own personal areas I would like, the app is fabulous for tracking weight, calories, water intake, exercise, etc.

title: Pretty good, missing TJ's
body: This app works pretty well but I'm disappointed how few Trader Joe's foods are available and therefore have to be added manually, so you don't get the detailed nutrition info.  This is true even for items that TJ's has carried for a long time.

title: Awesome weight loss app!!!
body: I love this app. It has all the functionality of the ww app & then some. You can track & scan food and get a breakdown of your protein, fats, carbs etc for the day in a graph. You can also graph your weight loss and scan food. This app is awesome & it's free. I highly recommend it. The only thing I don't like is that you get extra calories based on your exercise for the day. I just ignore the bonus calories but some days I am tempted :) if you're looking for a way to track & lose weight this is it & the reminders really keep you focused. Download it today.

title: Great App, Slightly Unstable
body: I have been using this app for a few months now and really like all of the features that it offers. On my iPhone 5s, however, it does occasionally freeze up and/or crash. I have had to actually uninstall and reinstall it a few times, but it has been a few weeks since that has happened, so hopefully it has been corrected. Obviously, I like the app enough that I went through the "hassle" of deleting it, reinstalling it and redoing all of the settings, so it has been worth it, and I have become much more aware of what I eat and have lost a few pounds as an added bonus!

title: Data is gone!
body: I've been using this app for about 3 months. I liked the amount of foods that were already in the database as well as the ability to make your own manual entries fairly easily. The graphing feature is nice and it synchs to the Health app in my phone. Yadda Yadda...It has worked totally fine up until today and all of a sudden all of my days have a bunch of entries I didn't make and completely ridiculous counts for stuff (uh like my weight is off by +100 lbs and it has me eating about 6000 calories more than I do daily, lol). So I'm not sure whether I'll ever get my data back? I don't think there's any sort of backup. Maybe that's a feature they should add now, given that the system is obviously susceptible to serious bugs. :-(

title: Nice app
body: I have only been using this app for a few days but it seems to be pretty good in helping me track my food. I have been trying to get more healthy and exercise so this helps me stay focused on what I need to do to cut back on unnecessary calories. I will say, however, I'm not sure I like not having the ability to alter the portions of food that I take in. Specifically, when you choose a food, while there are many choices, many times I will have half of the portion that is listed. Example, I had half of an ear of corn but my only option was to choose a full year of corn. Otherwise, it's a pretty good app.

title: Useful for weight loss. No tech support
body: A useful app and helps you track calories to lose weight. Synchronize with Apple Watch and burnt calories are automatically subtracted-that was the secret to help me lose over 20 pounds in four months...problem: Sometimes it dies nit sync properly between different devices (you have to manually "Force sync"). The other problem is there is no tech-support anymore. I've left three messages in the past couple of months and you only get automated replies saying someone will get back to you, but no one does. The same thing happened to my wife, no feedback.
response: Hi there! The last support ticket that we have from you is from December of 2016 in which our team responded several times. We apologize if you've sent additional tickets in since then that we have not received. Please be sure that you are sending your requests to support@livestrong.com We are always happy to help!

title: Great Macro Tracker!
body: Really well put together app. Has all the essentials for tracking calories. Being mindful or the macronutrients/calories one eats in a day is very helpful for losing weight and reaching fitness goals. In fact, you'll likely find out you should be eating MORE food than you already do, but of course, that doesn't mean upgrading to the large meal combo, it means eating more meals more frequently throughout the day. My Plate helps you track your progress, and count your calories. Great overall app.

title: Easy to use, add your own workouts
body: I've only been using this app for a few days, but so far it's great. I love that it has a ton of foods already in the system, including from Aldi!  You just scan the barcode and go!  I also love the water tracker. My only complaint is the small amount of workouts available, even if you pay (which I didn't, and I won't). Adding workouts should be easier. The provided workouts are in 5-10 minute options, but the custom option seems to be calories burned hourly. I would love to be able to make a custom workout in the same manner as the provided workouts.

title: Fab app for flab
body: I am a Mom of 2 and have lost 13 pounds with this app. I love it's ease of use. It is the only thing I have found that really works for me and my hectic schedule. Good food selection. Great for a lite app. Only wish is that I could build a meal from scratch and wish it could give me a projected weight loss estimate over time. Also wish it would show the full details of other's recipes. Perhaps that's in the full version? Would highly recommend though! Only a few more pounds to go until I reach my goal. I am confident this app will help me get there!! Thanks!

title: Used to be a great app...
body: 2 years ago, this app was my all-time favorite app for tracking food. Since then, I have sort of fallen off the diet train. A couple weeks ago I downloaded this alongside a couple other food tracking apps, and I found myself using this one less and less because of the annoying adds. Yeah, the other apps have all the "gold" stuff, but they do it in a way that is much less obtrusive. Livestrong, if you want to win me back, don't have large banner adds on the home-screen.. it really takes away from the experience. Other than that, this is a great app!

title: Great app!!
body: I have been using this app for about a year and a half and I love it! It keeps me accountable for everything I eat. I have lost 30lbs since I started using the app!  The only criticism I have is the exercise portion. I went on an (approximately) 2.5 mile walk/run on Sunday carrying my phone and the app only logged 6 calories burned and the day before that I went on a four mile walk/run and it logged over 2800 calories burned!  Neither one sound right! Need some work on that part of the app. The food catalog is great though, better than my Fitbit app's food catalog. Thanks!

title: Great Health App
body: I used this app a couple different times in my life. Neither for weight loss. So this is a multifunctional app in my opinion.

title: Really nice, easy to use, crisp graphics, sends data to Apple iHealth
body: Recently had frustrating experience with several other non-intuitive or inadequate food tracker programs (inc. "One Drop"), so I was very excited to find this app does all the things I need. It tracks all 3 macronutrients --carbs, protein and fat -- and not JUST carbs. It allows me to put in data from previous dates, modify the amount if less than standard "serving" -- all features that are very important and necessary for a robust program.

title: This app helped me lose 15 pounds!
body: Using this app for 3 months helped me to lose 15 pounds and I'm now at my goal weight! It's so easy to use because it remembers your favorite foods. I just tracked all the food I ate today in about 3 minutes. It was helpful to do, and I realized I have 100 calories left today after eating dinner, which means I can have a small piece of chocolate. (yum!) I love how it automatically tracks my steps too. I'm surprised how easy it is to use. This is a great app if you want to lose weight. There are also 5 and 10-minute workouts inside the app.

title: Great app
body: [update] I am still using this app to track. I tried going without it and gained weight and now I'm going back to it. It's the only thing that keeps me honest

title: Easy to use
body: The only thing is sometimes the user submitted calorie stats aren't accurate, so you have to do a little research to make sure it's the right one. For example, at subway the billboard says a 6 inch ham sub is 290 calories. A user stated it's 380.. which it doesn't state what condiments or toppings are added to make it that total. Would be neat if that could be mentioned somehow.

title: Awful upgrade: Less user friendly graphics
body: New version: May 3, 2017

title: Solid App....Easy To Use = Results
body: I used this app a few years ago to keep me on track and lost 65lbs.  Sadly I got lazy and put a bit of weight back on.  But I knew this app would help me be accountable again.  Have already lost 23lbs and have about 8 more to go.

title: This app is GREAT!
body: It helps keep me honest about what I'm eating and it gives me a better look at how much I should eat calorie-wise and it keeps me focused. Overall since I've started I've lost 3 lbs and I feel great, I have not energy since I've been going to the gym daily it gives me more energy and keeps me in a better mood, I love this app and I would recommend if you are trying to get in shape and or eat healthier to lose or maintain weight, this is a great app for that. I plan on continuing with using this app as an aid to assist me in my quest to losing weight and achieving my goal!!! GREAT APP!!

title: Crashes Frequently
body: The biggest annoyances and reason for the three star rating are: 1- this app crashes on me at least twice a day. It can not handle a search for "saut√©ed kale" and immediately dies on me. 2- some basic foods take a long time to find and anything homemade is pretty much out of the question. This app is great for people who eat the prepackaged, processed, grocery store foods but if you want to know how many calories there are in apple crisp, good luck. 3- the choices for exercise are limited. Bikram yoga is pretty popular but that app can't find it. The term "walking" is also an issue, you can't use the present participle version of a verb, you have to use the present tense verb.

title: Handy tool to track what I eat
body: I like the simple design and how easy it is to input something I ate as well as how easy it is to see the calories I've eaten and how many more I should consume. I would like to see some changes, however. It would be nice to  be able to input info from scans that the app does not recognize. I also wished there were more information on tracking nutrition rather than simply calories, fat and protein. I'm using this app to keep track of what I eat to ensure that I am getting the nutrients I need. It'd be great if there were an app that helped me keep track of the important vitamins I consume.

title: Great ap
body: This is a great ap for anyone looking to track their calories and achieve their fitness goals and offers users several healthy options in regards to gaining, maintaining or losing weight. The database of food to choose from is extensive and there are a ton of exercises and activities listed as well. One improvement that could be made would be to display the number of grams consumed on the overall nutrients chart (protein, carbs, fat etc. which is especially important for people who want to keep track of protein consumption and build muscle)

title: Awesome App
body: This app is a great way to track calories.  It is really easy to use and has tons of foods with accurate calorie counts on it.  It would be great of they had more foods for the barcode scan and search but that isn't a huge drawback except for some international products.  I would also like to have some calorie estimations for exercises like running a mile or squatting "X" amount of weight "X" times.  This would help with more accurate net calorie intake but I understand it is hard.  I know it's a little nitpicking but those are the improvements I would add.

title: Excellent tool for weight loss!
body: I have been using this app for over 3 months.  It is a great solution for losing weight.  I was able to achieve my goal and maintain it.  The scan barcode option makes it so easy to enter the food I have eaten and their database has almost every grocery store item in it. It may not always have the same brand but you can always find the same food. Whether you want to track calories, carbs, fat, sugar, sodium and more it is all stored in your profile.  (Besides tracking your weight of course).

title: It needs fixed!
body: So the app works great for tracking meals and everything else, except for the exercise. For some reason, it adds random exercises to my account when I don't perform them. For example, yesterday it said I walked for 30 minutes at 3.5 mph yesterday as a selected exercise when I didn't. It's adding extra exercises I don't perform and it screws with my calorie intake and it's very upsetting then to make sure I don't eat too many calories and actually keep track. So please fix asap! Every time I try to delete an exercise, it adds it to the list of things I have done so it ups my calories burned and it's extremely frustrating so please fix.

title: Horrible
body: I had to use this app for a college class & hate it . It never let me add my foods, I would spend five minutes and train all the nutrition information then it would tell me a cannot add at the time. I get a lot of different brands and organic and none of them are in the system, every barcode I scan was not found. The app on my phone in the online version would not linked together. I tracked everything on my phone app, then had to manually enter on the computer to transfer the PDF of the class. It is not user-friendly at all, I do use my fitness pal for years and like it 100 times better. I also hate this is a government website and they're just tracking what everybody eats. I will absolutely not use this app after my class is over.

title: Easy to Use!!!!
body: I tried several different apps and found this one to be the best for me.  What I really like is the scanner that allows you to log in any food that is bar coded. This allows all the nutritional values and servings to be calculated quickly in your meals.  I updated to the premium package for $45 and it allows you to see your macros and gives you individual workouts with calories burned.  I agree with some of the users that the public page is BS but then I don't do Facebook anyway...

title: Great app
body: I've been using this app for almost half a year and it has kept me on track from day one, although it might get redundant and hard to track every single calorie you ate that specific day it's a great app to use to help you gain/lose weight or just stay healthy. Also for the review about calorie burned "bug", the only reason your calories burned fluctuates is because it gets the information from the fitness app on how much you ran/walked that day, so on some days it might be low and others it could be high.

title: I'm a believer
body: I was really hesitant to invest money into a calorie tracker, so I downloaded this version because it was free. I never thought I would end up liking it this much. I can track my food, weight and exercise easily and so far I've lost 10 pounds in seven weeks.

title: Best App Ever (Previous Version)
body: It still is my most used app, other than safari,‚Ä¶ but the new skin for it leaves something to be desired. I don't like how you have to do an extra step to change the number of servings and I don't like how you can't see the calories and macronutrients right up front when you make the changes‚Ä¶ Just tell me how many grams of protein, fat, and carbohydrates with numbers instead of the little circle pie-chart!! (I do still like that feature, but only for the total daily consumption -- not the individual 200 cal food items I'm eating.) MyPlate, you lose a star!

title: Useful app
body: This app has provided accountability, support, and a bit of fun in my mindful weight loss attempt. I appreciate it more and more every day. I show off the month and three month view to my friends who can only see a week's worth of info on the apps they use. I also appreciate the makers' constant attempts at improvement. The app does keep getting better and better.

title: Everyone needs this app!
body: I never felt compelled to write a review. This app, however, is wonderful. I can track all my calories, fat, fiber... And see everything in one glance. I can track exercise and calories burned. Super simple -- no fiddling around. Graphs show daily and weekly progress. LOVE THIS. I can even type in items off a fast food menu! Only one small issue... I don't like serving sizes limited to 1/4,1/2,3/4... Of a Serving. Serving sizes are given, and you can figure out how much 2tbs of the product is, but that would require a little effort and I'm lazy.

title: Missing basic function
body: I was very disappointed when I found there was no way to cite partial servings (e.g. One half) in the diary.  Sorry, I finally figured out how to do this!  A very big flaw in my opinion.  Also, the database stinks--I can never find anything no matter how much of the product name and company I input.  Still trying the app, I like it, but

title: The Only Caloric App I'll Use
body: I've been using this app for a couple years. When *I* use it consistently and use it to make healthy choices, I consistently lose weight. The app is always improving - not like other apps that update and become unusable. I really believe in this app. At one point, with the help of this app, I went from weighing 389lbs to 296lbs. I've put back on some lbs, but that's been my issue and always when I'd stop using the app. I'm back at it and losing again. Use the app. Use your head. Use some discipline. You can do anything, but take all the help you can get. This app helps!

title: Very close to accurate info
body: I really like this app, its very easy to use, very close to being accurate with its information. Only reason i didnt give it 5 stars were because 2 reasons. 1st the exercise chart isnt very friendly.. It needs some work and it needs to be updated to all the new exercises thats being done today. Meaning it needs to keep up.. Secondly, i dont think with all these calorie counting apps out here to chose from, dont think this app should be charging you a monthly fee to join its community and other things. Other than that, its really worth the download.

title: Won't sync and keeps logging off
body: I have really loved the live strong tracker on my computer so I knew if I could sync that with this app my life would be easier to lose weight. However, even after attempting to sync the two it won't register what I've put on my computer version AND it constantly logs me off even in the middle of trying to input stuff which is annoying.  I wish it would have a 'remember me' or keep me logged in button.  But really I can't use it if it won't see what I've been inputting into the computer version of my plate.  It doesn't seem to recognize as many foods also so I'm just using the computer and writing things down to input later if I'm out.  That at least is working for me and I've lost 4 lbs this first week.

title: MyPlate Review
body: This is a great app. I just wish that i could move or copy my recently tracked foods from one meal to another.  For example if I have something for a snack and I decide to have it for breakfast on another day, I have to hunt in the search box for it, or rescan it, instead of searching a general "recent foods list" that can be accessed for any meal or snack. Having to reload a snack or food for different meals on different days is annoying. On my busy days I would like to scroll and click and add wherever I want and keep things moving. I started using the app 9 days ago and have lost 4 pounds. :-)
response: Hi! Thank you for the review and feedback! We will definitely pass your suggestion on to our development team. :)

title: Great calorie tracking app
body: Pros: extremely easy to use, and the app is very quick/responsive.  I've lost nearly 10 lbs in 3 weeks tracking my calories in this app.

title: Awesome
body: This program not only runs pretty well on my phone, it has also been incredibly useful in helping me take off weight and stay on track. I don't know how I could live without it now! The only annoying thing is that the search option for food is extremely particular about how you type things in (for example, it won't find "cheese" if you forget a letter and put "chees"). However, this is a pretty small complaint when you think about how this app has helped to change my lifestyle :)

title: Good basic app to keep track of calorie intake
body: It has been a very motivating tool for me to keep track of how much I eat. Only wish it has a better system of filing my regular foods so I don't have to scroll down a long list of frequently eaten food to record the calories.

title: I've lost two pounds in a week!
body: This tracker is awesome. There are tons of specific food/exercise types and I really enjoy being able to enter my own cal. count for meals not there... The water tracker has been a huge help, too, because I'm almost always dehydrated (until now)! It's really nice to be able to track my weight over time as well...

title: My Plate Application
body: I use this app daily. Tracking  caloric intake is the only scientific way to lose weight. Intake and output; basic math. Low calorie eating is a life style and an effective way to take control of how you feel. I'm a carbohydrate addict and have a form of reactive hypoglycemia. I've had it since I was very young. As a result of low calorie meal planning I can control that lousy post-prandial crash and burn, which in the past, required more food to overcome. I have my goals in sight and plan to use this app as long as I have a smart phone in my pocket. Cheers.

title: Needs a diary feature
body: This app is good for calorie and exercise tracking. It's very basic (which I like) and easy to use. I like that I can scan UPCs for many of the foods I eat. I used the MyPlate website a few years ago to maintain a 50-lb weight loss and am now trying to lose baby weight. Having it on my phone is awesome... so much more convenient. I miss the diary feature that the website had, though. It was a great tool to make note of any events or situations that made healthy eating and exercise more difficult that day. I would love to see a diary feature added on to this app.

title: You are what you eat.
body: I can say that this app is really good at making me accountable. The reminders to add anything that I eat or drink are great. I like how it keeps track of what I have ate. It allows me to look back to see if I am making healthier choices. Also if I cheat and eat fast food it tells me how I'm destroying my efforts at a healthier lifestyle. Sometimes the scan option doesn't work but not that often. Overall  I would rate it a 4. Because I'm not purchasing the gold package. I'm quite sure there's more but I'm loosing weight and being more conscious of what I eat with the basic package  .

title: Easy to Navigate, Helped me become healthier
body: This app makes the journey to becoming a healthier, more fit person a whole lot easier. By calculating how many calories you intake, you're able to be more careful with what you decide to put into your body. The app also deducts the amount of exercise you've done for the day. So far, I've had an awesome experience & it is now a part of my daily routine.

title: Been using for 10 months solid
body: I have been tracking my calories on MyPlate for 10 months solid now. When I eat around my resting metabolic rate plus calories burned (tracked via Apple Watch), I maintain my weight and when I eat less, I tend to lose weight, which is expected. I‚Äôm very pleased with the stability of the app and the clean workflow.  It is handy for the app to automatically import my Apple Watch activity data and also synchronize my calorie data to the Apple Health app, for tracking and sharing amongst other apps.

title: Doesn't automatically sync at all; zero customer support
body: Count me in as yet another reviewer whose app simply won't sync to Livestrong's servers. No matter what I do, whenever I enter in new data, it won't sync on its own unless I dig down into my profile settings and hit "force sync," which is a huge pain in the neck and completely unnecessary. I contacted customer support whose response to me was to simply parrot a canned response stating that the app syncs on its own (um, no - I just told you it doesn't, so telling me that it does without acknowledging my problem is pretty obnoxious), and that if it doesn't for me I should just manually sync it every time I use the app.

title: Great way to stay on track!
body: Great app to assist in staying motivated and consistent with workouts and meals.

title: Not much
body: I am using the free version, so perhaps the upgraded version is better. I've used myfitnesspal, and it has many more ways to track your progress and allows you to update/edit an entry. Overall, this is far too simplistic, and, should you need to adjust an entry, I've not found a way to do so (for example, I wanted to change my water intake from 8 to 48, I clicked 48, no change, I tried again, no change, and then suddenly, it updated and now I have 250+ ounces and there is no way to correct this!!!, imagine if I made this mistake with a food entry???) There is only a daily tracker for calories consumed and percentages, and let's face it, we all have a bad day, so a weekly total/percentage would be nice. Heading back to MFP until things change.

title: Almost at Goal
body: Have been using 6 months and app really helps me with the visual weight loss (& the occ. gain!) graph, as well as with PORTION CONTROL! I am in control of my own fork, but the DB has both salad and peanut butter by the cup or Tablespoon (which may explain the gain!).  LOVE the new "scan"-ability; wish it had a somewhat larger DB (flavored coffee creamer: "I don't think you want to eat that!"). Wish there were on-line instructions to adding customized items.  (Don't like entering and then not being able to access/re-name my custom food or  exercise later, nor being able to increase/decrease the amounts.) Thanks!!

title: Good & Bad
body: Good for tracking calories and having a pretty deep bench when it comes to the food I eat. I'm a pretty simply guy though so it may not have everything everyone eats but so far I've found everything from protein powders to protein bars, bison burgers, etc.

title: Just the motivation I needed!
body: My wife and I needed a little motivation to kickstart our healthy eating goals and this app makes it a no-brainer!  I can log in from work, the house, and my phone to track what I am putting in my body.

title: So easy!
body: I have never been one to stay disciplined in tracking anything!! I have 4 jobs and work a ton. This makes it so easy because I can just scan the barcode or lookup the food im eating at a fast food place. It has helped me keep an accurate diary and also to stay motivated! If I have a bad day and eat things I'm not supposed to, I track it anyway and then look at the progress graph to remind myself that for that one day I messed up, there were 15 days before that where I didn't go over at all! Love it!

title: Useful but needs improvements please!!
body: I use this app every day to track my weight my intake in my nutrients and my water intake. I love that you can scan food labels and I use this quite a bit, and I have found about 80% of what I need is in their database.  However, couple of drawbacks: you can't see your nutrients after midnight for the day previous or, ever again! You can see what food you ate and what calorie intake you had but not specifically how much of each. That is a bummer!

title: An app you will love
body: I love and use this app every day. I am able to track my calorie intake, exercise, and water. I've been able to keep track of weight loss and because I hold myself accountable, I've lost 8lbs! The app also has workout routines you can do from home if you don't go to or have a gym near by. They have almost all foods in their scanner and if you can't find it, you can easily enter it yourself. The app is what you make of it, but if you're serious about weight loss, this is a great tool to utilize.

title: Good, with one bug
body: This app is great because it shows your calories and your macronutrients on the same screen, whereas similar apps just focus on calories. It also has a wide database of verified foods with nutritional information. I just wish it tracked fiber also!

title: Pretty good overall
body: This app is very useful for keeping track of what I eat. I also appreciate the few exercise routines they have for free.

title: I LOVE THIS APP!!!!!
body: This app makes it very easy to keep up with everything I eat and drink and when I'm in a rush I can scan and go!  It also keeps track of carbs fat and protein which are all important with dieting.  I can actually track my weight loss as well.  I have gold so I could unlock everything and I'm glad that I did purchase the extras.  I am very happy with this app!  It also has workouts just in case you need to burn calories as well.  I couldn't ask for a better app For what I am trying to do!

title: Okay
body: This app has some good features and a good interface, but it could be better. It should e easier to enter in your custom foods and not having to say you ate it right then. Have a general custom food database that i can save seperate from the what I am eating menus. Also the fact that I can't see how many grams of protein and carbs I've eaten is absurd. You are going beyond that to tell me what percentage I've eaten, but why not the exact grams? You have the info so just show it. And finally, the "rewards/achievements". Just get rid of them. It's annoying to have that pop up over and over. I'm not gonna use it, so why force it on me? Overall 3/5.

title: Great App- Wish it had a scanner
body: I gave this app only 3 stars because it unfortunately does not have all foods in its database. I'm pretty sure what ever is in it, is what others have added. I say that based on the number of duplicates and why things are named. Simple solution, a scanner! If you can't find what you just ate, I would rate this app 5 stars if it had a scanner to pull up the name and nutritional facts! I know it's possible, because I've used other apps that have the function and its awesome! I really like the charts that this app uses to how you visually what you're consuming.

title: Love this app!
body: Decided to skip the weight watcher points, my usual plan, as I've grown quite callous toward the system after so many years.  I liked the idea of pre-packaged plans -- until I saw the price.  Decided the best way was the simplest -- just count calories.  Saw this app had high marks.  Love it!  the graphics are great, it's intuitive, has a lovely list of indexed foods (haven't tried the scanner), allows for custom foods (mmm. Moroccan stew... and low cal!) -- and it includes water intake, which is actually quite important for me.  Highly recommend this app.

title: Great App to Help Change Habits
body: This app has been instrumental in helping me lose 45 pounds over the last nine months. Using the calorie tracker enabled me to make informed eating decisions, make healthier choices, track what/how I've eaten plus how many calories I have remaining for the day.  Besides losing weight, my blood work has dramatically improved.

title: Good enough for food, nice layout, needs better fitness choices
body: I like the layout and visual appeal of the app. I like that you track each meal as a "plate," and can see the breakdown of carbs, protein and fat. I don't like the limited fitness choices. If I type in something as simple as "abs" or "biking," nothing comes up. The only activities I have found already programmed into the app are running, walking, swimming and UFC strength (not general strength training or weights). The app seriously needs to expand the list of exercise activities to include things like biking, rollerblading, isolated body groups (abs, upper body, lower body), cardio, etc. Not everyone is a runner!

title: One of the best apps I have seen on Apple Store
body: This is most amazing app I have seen. Interface is very easy to use and very intuitive. The food database is jaw dropping. I am an Indian and many times I eat ethnic Indian food. The Indian dishes we make at home here is not what you typically find in Indian Restaurants here in USA and yet I was able to find all obscure Indian dishes cooked only in certain local regions in India. I was not expecting to find it at all but so far I have found every single item I have searched for in the database. It really is jaw dropping.

title: Clever "Rate me" link
body: I like the "Rate this app" link it's unique haha. But as for the app, this is the real deal! I like the circle graph to display your macro's and the bar towards your calorie goal. It's likely not to happen because it's a rare situation, but I would like to set when my day starts and ends because I work overnights and I'd like to track my calories for the day as 2pm to 10am kind of thing. Other than that I have no complaints. The paid-for feature are very fair and definitely not necessary to get the full experience ‚úîÔ∏è

title: It does the job
body: I've been using the app for about three weeks now. There are a few things that I don't like for instance when it comes to putting in your food for the day it really doesn't give you a lots of options when it comes to serving size so you have to do a lot of compromising. Second, I don't like the way you input your weight for the week. It does not show a progress chart for that very easily. I went ahead and bought the living strong membership hoping that it would track my weight better but it doesn't. The free ones just as good as the paid one don't waste your money.

title: The May update is much better!
body: I recently started using this and have enjoyed the ease of use and the positive result I have achieved. But yesterday an update came through and totally changed the look and I don't like the new look. The previous version was so easy at a glance to enter info. This version just doesn't have the "at a glance" ease of use. I really dislike it a lot.

title: This App Has Changed the Game
body: This app has enabled me to track and improve my health. I've lost weight and shaped up. Food, exercise, weight, and water can be tracked easily, and it shows protein, fat, and carb percentages. It's very user-friendly! I've used it every single day since December. Sometimes it crashes, but it's worth it due to that the app is so helpful. The barcode scanning on food packaging and net calorie calculations are incredibly useful. I recommend this app as a food tracker, and wouldn't rather download any other!

title: Just what I was looking for
body: I'm a medical student and I figure if I'm going to ask my patients to eat healthy and track their calories I better start doing the same.  I looked for a simple, user friendly app and this one is perfect! Also, it's great that you can still get a lot of functionality out of it without having to upgrade to the one that costs money. Love how big their database is.  They even know how many calories are in a "Kroger sweet and salty bar"!

title: Must Have App
body: I had no idea how many calories I was eating before I had this app. This showed me how much I was actually eating and made me realize I needed to cut back on some foods to lose weight. Right before the new year I was 173 lbs and now it is jan 11th and I'm at 163lbs because this app calculated my BMI and BMR so that I could calculate the right amount of calories I actually needed. Only one downside and that is that this app doesn't show how much sugar you are eating or most nutrients we get from veggies and fruits. Otherwise I think this is great!

title: A good app that could be even better
body: I've found this app really useful. I'm actually counting my calories daily. What would make it better is:

title: Good way to help change habits
body: I was looking for a way to just find out how many calories was in some of my meals when I found this app. I really like it and how customizable it is to what you want to do with it. My purpose changed and I now have found that it helps me keep track of the healthy foods I eat, which motivates me to keep everything I eat healthy.

title: Great app but...
body: I've been using this app for a couple of weeks and it's very handy when it comes to tracking everything except for a couple of things:

title: Really good app
body: Honestly it works great accept when it comes to exercise tracking. But if you are like me you will be checking the actual calories you burn by double checking other sites. I only do specific exercises and list heavy activity so I figure I am ahead anyway. It could use some work on food but just look for "verified" foods and you'll be just fine. I enjoy watching how many calories I consume and being truly honest about it. This app works great for that because when I am close to half my calories consumed I start paying way more attention.

title: Love this app
body: I use this app everyday and it's so easy to use, sometimes I may eat something out of the ordinary and I can't find it on the list but none the less it still does great with normal every day foods. The only problem is that I can't seem to figure out how to edit my exercise! I put in the wrong thing and I can't take it out, so I end up with 1,000 burned calories instead of 100üòÇ and I can't take it out. But I still love the app, just have to be careful when entering your exercise calories.

title: Something went wrong
body: I chose to write this app today. I would have given it five stars before today but all of a sudden everything on my app is wrong it says that yesterday I burn 53,000 calories! Which is clearly wrong everything is totally messed up all of the stuff on the app all of the data that I have tracked over the last two months is gone and it's replaced with all kinds of other things that aren't mine like one of them was Michael's Apple Watch (not me) and playing violin and all of these things that I've never done to burn calories so it's really confusing and very annoying but I've lost everything. Obviously when the update happened something went horribly wrong please fix as soon as possible!!

title: Great start
body: I really like how easy this app makes tracking your different goals. The main dashboard is great and the workouts are a nice feature. However there are a few problems

title: Minor bugs
body: Easy to use interface and love the scanning option. However need to be very careful with serving sizes as the app doesn't always match the package label (ex. the salad I had for lunch was labeled as a 2 cup serving for 110 cals, the app brought up a 1 cup serving for 110 cals when scanned). Also, it appears you can only add exercise not remove it - I mistyped the time I spent walking and was unable to correct it, it just continued adding more time so my "allowed" calories were waaay off for the day. Besides these couple issues I still find this app super easy to use and helpful.

title: Very practical, useful, and helpful!
body: I started using this app today because my moms friend recommended it. I love it! There is so much food storage in this app that I can find everything that I have eaten in a single day! It's very helpful and practical because it tells you the exact calories per serving so I know just about everything about the food I'm eating. I love the calorie tracker and the progress bar :) this is very practical for someone who is trying to lose weight. I can't wait to see my final results!

title: Like it
body: Every year in January I always have 10 or 15 lbs to lose before spring shows up....last year I did weight watchers on line and I did lose but I wasn't crazy about the online program or the cost. This year I just wanted a way to know how many calories I needed to eat per day based on my weight and still lose weight...I love to eat! This app did exactly what I wanted and It has been so easy to keep track of what I have eaten. I have lost 8 lbs in two weeks so I am way ahead of my goal for spring!

title: Current version not up to snuff
body: I love this app in it's previous version, but in its current version with with the custom food section removed there is a serious problem. If you enter food in enter calories manually for something that's not in the db using a base serving amt and then at some point you track less than the base amount, in future searches what comes up for the food is the base serving size with the lesser serving cal count!  This is a pain to manually edit every single time you eat an amt that differs from the base serving. What is the point of having it keep the non-db foods at all?  I think I will just try and app that actually lets you keep your own additional db of custom foods.

title: I keep lowering the stars every few days
body: ...it had a way to track MUFA's.  Anyone who knows anything about nutrition knows there's a big difference in types of fats.  If you want a flat belly and healthy yeart, you NEED MUFA's yet, this ap doesn't track it.   Because of this, it really misses the boat on nutrition.

title: Tracker suggestion
body: I love this app, but I do want to make a suggestion to the developers.  I feel that it would be nice to see which items on your daily menu are putting you into the red, rather then going back and forth trying to figure out which item(s) are putting you there (in the red). And also made when you do that query that it would have suggestions to what you could op'd for instead. It is just time consuming especially for me not knowing all these types of nutritional information right of the top of my head. Thank you.

title: Love the concept but confused!!
body: I love the idea for this app and all but, if I make something like a smoothie at home, how am I supposed to know how many grams of saturated fat are in it!! Haha and I know they can't fix that but a great thing to add would be counting your steps or something because I don't really know how many calories I burned from walking a mile... Another great thing to add would be to have vitamin and mineral consumption count as part of your daily overall health thing because it is in real life!! But I do love this app- and would even more if these few changes were made!!!

title: Helpful but could be better
