body: It has been helpful to track the food I eat but I wish the database was more complete.  Many foods are either missing or have incomplete data.  The exercise tracking is OK too, but would be better if more options and data were provided.  This app works well for motivation purposes. If you are looking for complete and accurate health and diet management tool, you might want to consider other apps, but they may require an annual membership fee.

title: Easy to use but annoying bug
body: This app is definitely just what I was looking for. I love the user interface and connectivity with my health app on my Apple Watch. My only complaint is a bug-when I was doing the initial setup, I would have preferred to use my Facebook login instead of having to think of yet another password and user name. But every time I selected that option on the starting page, the app crashed. After several tries, I finally just gave up and made a login. Maybe the staff could look into the problem. Thanks!

title: Weightloss User
body: I started using my plate about a month ago on my daughters recommendation.  I was getting a bit pudgy in the mid- range and need to lose about 42 lbs based on BMI.  At 65+ I knew it was time to start a diet and exercise plan.  I rate myplate 5 stars because of its ease of use, amount of detail, tracking history, and scanning capability. My weight loss goal is 2 lbs per week and so far myplate is spot on in helping me drop 10 lbs in 32 days.  I think using this app my have just extended my life span. Thanks to Livestrong for helping me Live Long.

title: Just started using
body: I just started using this app but so far it seems very easy to find and scan food that I've eaten. It's also pretty easy to log my exercise, though I wish I could manually input the calories I burned (the app's calories burned was a tiny bit off from what my elliptical said). However, you may be able to do this and I just haven't figured it out yet. Anyway, I have high hopes for this app and should check in later once I've used it for a while.

title: It works
body: I had belonged to weight watchers and I liked tracking on my phone, but it came down to the program or my gym membership... The gym seemed like a better choice. So I was  surching for an ap to track my food. I like this one especially for the price! I can watch my calories, but even better I can see the ratio of carbs, fat, & protein for the day. I also like that I can chart my weight, and read some of the community online chat (some really good tips and motivation). I didn't give 5 stars because the surch for food information is ok ( it has major stuff).

title: EVERY THING BUT, community??
body: this is a great app! I love everything about it. accept for the community. Most of the people on there like to say: "oh OMG why did you set your calorie rate to that? that way to low/high"

title: Awesome
body: My plate is by far the best calorie counting app there is. It is so much easier than My Fitness Pal or Fooducate. The community is great and easy to use, and since there are not too many community users, you get to know people very well. If people don't see each other's comments for a while, they post something asking for them to say hi. The only con I have is that some of the special features don't work perfectly, and there are minor glitches. Overall, My favorite calorie tracking app!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: iPhone 6s
body: So far I haven't had any trouble finding the food I eat in their database when I go to scan and l. That's often what has discourage me from other calorie counting app's. They usually don't last long on my phone. So I'm going to continue to get this want to try. I haven't checked yet but there are a lot of calorie counting apps that work with the Fit Bit app and Fitness Tracker I wear.   Maybe through the "Health" App on my iPhone Fit Bit will be able to pull the info from it. The two are linked

title: All good but one bug (updated: I figured out a way)
body: Update:

title: So much better than the competition
body: I used MFP with a lot of success in the past, but felt compelled to try something new. I'M SO GLAD I DID. MyPlate is so much more intuitive and searching food is eleventy hundred times easier. The old app was helpful in losing the weight, but I see myself having a much easier time sticking to the program with MyPlate. I'm blown away by how quickly I'm able to enter meals, and I love that everything is right there at my fingertips without needing to scroll and switch screens.

title: Time waster
body: I just recently starting tracking again and I was highly impressed that MyPlate had remembered all of my meals and common entries. However, when I went to track Dinner, the interface had completely changed and the ability to add dinner is completely lost on me. Not sure what changed in the last four hours but I don't have the time to try to figure it out. I freelance and my time is money. I can't get bogged down for a long time for something that I used to be able to do easily. I'll look for another app. It shouldn't take this long to do something I was able to do in a simple manner four hours ago. Don't download this if you haven't already. Use something with a better interface.

title: Nice UI. Wonky and questionable data handling.
body: I like the simple interface, but I have some issues with the app.

title: The BEST App EVER
body: For the first time in my life I believe I now have a handle on controlling what I eat and losing the weight. Thanks to this app, I was able to lose 3.8 pounds in one day just by watching my calories and exercising to the point of knowing that I had A deficit in my calorie and take instead of an increase. No more guessing and no more secrets ask you how many calories I've taken in and how many I have burned. I love this app so much that I bought the gold version although the free version is still very good.

title: Great for counting calories, not so helpful for exercise
body: This app has been a tremendous help in allowing me to keep track of the food I eat each day. My complaint is that the exercise portion of the application appears to randomly delete or reduce my exercise in the middle of the day? I will have gone for a walk and down aerobics and my "calories burned" will be at 300 or 400...but then an hour later it will have dropped to 50 or even 0 when I haven't eaten anything in the meantime! It makes the "net calories" section of the app inaccurate. I would love to see this bug fixed so that the application can be perfect!
response: Hi mjbf18, thank you for your feedback! We are aware of this issue and we're working on a fix. We apologize for the inconvenience!

title: Great tracker
body: Great app for tracking, especially when you are on the go. There is a large selection of food to choose from and the tracking tools are easy to use and really visual.  The only slightly negative aspect is that there is no filter on the community tool.  The support and positive feedback is great, but there is a lot of bad/dangerous advice given by people in the community who are NOT experts. Just focus on the positive and make sure to check the advice with a health professional before you make drastic changes.

title: Search function fail
body: The only reason I'm giving this app 2 stars instead of 1 is because I see the potential for it to be great...if it worked. When I first started using a couple weeks ago it was great. Now, for the last week, I get no results when I search for an item to add to my diary. No error, no "no results found", nothing. It just stops working. If its not something I already added to my diary in the first week (in recent foods), I can't add it. Useless now. Plus, I don't like that I can't scroll to a previous day to enter info like I can with MyFitnessPal. I'm about to just delete the app if there isn't a bug fix update soon. It has no value right now.

title: Problems with the app
body: I used to use the app all the time and have been using it for 4 years and never had any problems till recently. Whenever I go to open the app to log my calories eaten, the app stays on the open page for several minutes, then closes itself out.  Every time I try opening the app again, the problem keeps happening, and I even tried deleting the app and re-downloading it again, and the problem is still happening.

title: Great App For Crohn's Patients
body: I really love this app because I can track my calories, weight and keep a food diary for my Crohn's disease. The only thing I wish this app would incorporate is a symptoms tracker or, if that is too specific, a free text field where I could make notes on flare up symptoms. This app is by far the best food/weight tracking app I've tried for Crohn's and I would highly recommend it to anyone with the condition. As a note to developers:  you may wish to add Crohn's as a key word for this app so that it shows up for people who are searching that way.

title: Excellent.
body: This is a great app. It's very easy to use and has a visually appealing interface. It has never crashed for me and syncs beautifully with my Apple Watch.

title: Frustrated
body: Many of the aspects of this app look good.  I am frustrated as I downloaded the app 2 days ago and I have only been able to add 1 food item of my own to the more detailed create a food section.  Every time I try to do so it tells me that it can't be saved.  So I end up having to do the quick add.  I need to track some of the more detailed nutrition info.  The one that finally did go through I see that I made a spelling error on the food name.  I try to edit it and it won't let me . I even purchased the app thinking that was the problem. I will give it through today and if it is not fixed I'm seeking a refund. Really disappointed considering how much success everyone seems to be having with it.

title: Useful, but ...
body: I like the convenience, and the nutritional analysis, and especially the bar-code-scanning capability. But when searching for the food you want to enter, you have to wade past far too many utterly useless, stupid user-provided entries like "Lasagna‚Äî1 serving, 200 calories," "Lasagna‚Äî1/6 of pan, 250 calories," "Barbara's Lasagna‚Äî176 calories." Please eliminate all entries that fail to use standards measurements! At least they have weeded out the user-supplied exercises, which used to include things like "Sitting and smoking 10 minutes‚Äî15 calories," and I'm not making that up. They ought to include a down-voting button to flag suspect entries for review and expungement.

title: Latest update disappointing
body: I've used this app for a number of years and am very disappointed with the most recent update.

title: Very helpful
body: I LOVE this app! I can even enter what I will eat ahead of time if I'm going to a barbecue etc. The couple of negatives I have is the graph tracker is all over the place. It didn't start off at my actual weight, much less. That's the little graph on the left. The larger one in the center makes no sense at all. I do love it other than that and in the three months I've been doing this, I've lost 18 pounds! Nice amount in that time, not too fast or slow. That's important at my age, I'm 67 and have about fifty more to lose so have to be concerned with wrinkles!

title: The app went from hero to zero!
body: A few months ago I would have given this app five stars. Now it barely deserves two. I use to love the user interface to this app. It was quick, intuitive, and informative. Now since it changed in March 2017 the user interface is awkward and slow. I like change, but only for the positive. This change has done the opposite for this product... and for what good?
response: Hi MisterBanks- thank you for your feedback on our latest update. We are working on changes based on user feedback, so we will definitely pass your comments on to our team!

title: Needs a little improving...
body: I love using this app but some popular exercises aren't found when I try to track my workouts (like spinning for example. I search for "spin, bike and even cycle" and the only thing I can find is "unicycle"... Really??!! Is that popular enough that you have to have that in the database?). Also, if a food item isn't found I normally try scanning the barcode to add it. That really only works maybe 1 out of 10 times. And sometimes when it does work, the item shows up with more calories than what's listed on the packaging. Pretty happy with everything else.

title: Great app!
body: I have been using this app for about a week now and have already lost several pounds. Thank you so much to the people who made this available! I have been trying to lose weight for ages, and for me this seems to be the answer. It gives me the flexibility I want, and the information I need. Can't wait to fit back into my smaller clothes again!

title: One Year Review
body: I have officially tracked my calories for a whole year now. This app is by far the most easy to use and best over all. I looked around and done my shopping and could never find one that best this. Has the accessibility I need and everything I want at the touch of a finger, no Internet needed. With my lifestyle and consistent diet it allows me to see what else I need to eat and keep me with my goal. I made so much progress with this app and I sincerely hope the developers stick with it. How do I donate?

title: A few flaws
body: This app is an all-in-one calorie and exercise tracker, which is very nice to have. I noticed that some of the nutrition facts were incorrect, but that is probably not a widespread issue. Also, when entering your own foods manually, it does not allow you to add fiber or sugar values, which are important to me. Also, I wish it would show you the amounts of fiber and sugar you have eaten over the course of a day, instead of just calories, carbs, fat, and protein. But overall, this app has worked quite well for me with no bugs or crashes so far.

title: Very useful but room to improve
body: I'm new to calorie counting, and have found the app very good for tracking calories. Fairly extensive database of foods - good. Some identical food entries have widely divergent calories - confusing. Nice that one can add foods, but would be better if one could also add the details on calories from carbs, protein & fat.

title: Mostly a love
body: I have been using this app for 6 months and pretty much love it! I downloaded several to try and this was easiest for me and I love the tracking tool to watch my progress. My only gripe is with the most recent update. They changed the water tracking. You used to be able to add your water a little at a time and it would auto add to your total. Now you have to go in and manually change your total every time. I know it's simple math but it was just easier the other way! I hope they change it back!

title: Best Diet App Out There
body: I luv this app. It does everything u could possibly want for a diet app. It regulates everything u eat in a way that makes sticking to a diet seem doable. It also has an exercise regulator so u know how many calories ur burning and makes sure ur staying in shape while ur doing ur diet. U also can scan products so u don't have to search the food ur eating. What's great about that feature is u don't have to figure out how many calories u just ate. It tells u already. This app is awesome an I highly suggest it.

title: Love this app!
body: This app is so wonderful, I've been using myplate online off and on for probably 7 years, but it is so much easier to stay on track when I can use my phone and input my food or exercise on the go instead of trying to remember it all when I get home. I would give it 5 stars but I can't find a way to change my exercise on the app once I have input it. So if I put 30 minutes of exercise when I only did 15 minutes, I can't change it on my phone. But I would still recommend this app to anyone!

title: Love it
body: Have used this app and its various upgrades over the last 3 years and it is the perfect tool for weight loss/maintenance. Helps you calculate what your calorie intake should be, allows you to account for calories burned in exercise, allows you to add your own meals (like your own favorite Mac and cheese recipe) and figure calories and nutritional info per serving. Only annoyance is often too many items (like "medium peach") have too many variations in nutritional content that pop up when you search - should do more housekeeping to identify verified calorie counts.

title: The app is great but don't have high expectations for the community
body: The app itself is great. It helps you tracking your food, physical activity and all of your nutritions.

title: Love it
body: It automatically takes your weight loss goal, your height and current weight, gender and calculates your daily caloric goal. It is so easy and fun to use. You can have it remind you every day to remind you to add up your intake.  It remembers what you eat frequently for ease of documenting, and also what you ate last, and what exercises you performed last, or frequently. Easy to correct mistakes on documentation.  It tracks BMI weight loss...so cool, I am actually trying to lose weight now with this by my side!

title: Better but . . .
body: This app is much better than the previous version.  I like being able to track protein, water and calories burned on one page.  As an older person who is relatively inactive, it allows me to track all activities not just working out.  There is one thing that needs to be changed.  The calories remaining bar at the top needs to be programmed to match the net calories number not add the net calories and the allotted amount.  Right now my app tells me I have 3800 calories for the day when I sit most all day.  I wishüòÅ

title: Two years later and still my favorite!
body: I've had this app for about two years and it has not failed to not only integrate with all phone and OS upgrades but can be accessed with just as much ease from my Mac, iPhone or iPad without dropping information. Even calories for products in smaller chains can often be found (not always). It also integrates with my Heath app so it's really one of the great apps made for the health community whether your a hard core gym buff of new to the game.

title: Love this app! Help me control my pregnancy weight gain (so far)!
body: I didn't gain any weight during the first trimester. I don't think I can achieve that wo this app (I was out of control and was eating a lot of junk food between week 5-8 when the pregnancy hunger attacked!)

title: Perfect app for weight loss!
body: My absolute favorite app for weight loss. It's because of this app that I've been able to lose the weight I want to lose by watching the calories I consume as well as tracking how many calories I burn during workouts. This app even tracks my steps! It also keeps track of how much water I drink per day. It has s really sleek design and it's so easy to use. If you're trying to lose weight, this app will definitely help get you to your goal!

title: another app that thinks it knows me better than I do
body: You can't set a calorie goal under 1200. There are many reasons someone could have a goal under 1200. Not allowing a goal under 1200 isn't going to protect someone from a restrictive eating disorder. It will, however, annoy someone who is very petite and eating 1000 per day, or someone who is on a very low calorie diet prescribed by their doctor etc. Seriously, people who've had weight-loss surgery must use this app, and most of those people are on a 500 calorie diet for a few weeks. Please, please change this. <1200 per day can be healthy for many different people, and this app is supposed to be a tool, not my doctor

title: Poor Exercise Tracker
body: The app promotes itself with the capacity to transfer exercise logs from iPhone's health app into the app for calorie reduction. This feature does not work well. If it records anything in the app it isn't accurate or consistent. This is a major setback in the app. It also is without enough verified foods. So many inaccurate submissions exist within the searchable food field that it's ineffective to attempt to use any of the apps current data. You're better off entering in your own nutrition count. The other downfall is it doesn't offer a wide enough variety of entry information. Calorie count and carbs are basically the only two items you can manually enter in. It's a major flaw.

title: Love this app!
body: I started this a week ago thru Livestrong. I love this app!

title: Really helpful app
body: I've been trying to learn more about having a well-balanced diet. This app has been a lifesaver. I'm tracking all of my calories as well as the carbs, fats, and proteins I put into my body. It's really cool to know the nutritional value of everything I consume. It has made me take my health a lot more seriously.

title: Great app just some suggestions...
body: The app makes it super easy to record what you ate. I log all my food intake. I just wish that instead of having water as a category it'd be drinks as a whole so it could record how much water you get from those drinks as well. Also it's not so easy to record your exercise. Like I tried to log push-ups and it was by time duration not by how many I did. People go at different paces so I feel like time duration isn't accurate. Although the overall app is still great for logging everything.

title: Great App
body: This is a wonderful app.  It is easy to use, very user friendly, and is the best app I've found for calorie tracking.  Using it, I've lost nearly 80 pounds!

title: Good tool for watching weight
body: I really like this app. It helps me keep track of what I eat, and if I am honest, it gives me a really good idea of how many calories I am consuming, and using. Also, it lets you customize meals, for example, I always eat the same Lean Cuisines, so I can program those into the app so I don't have to re-enter it every time. On the down side, I can't seem to figure out how to adjust what the app thinks my target calorie I take should be per day...I think it is a bit high based on my height, but I think the target calories per day is based on BMI.

title: Easy and Effective
body: I have used this app for nearly a year. I went from overweight to healthy within five months (lost 10% of body weight), and I have been able to keep it off for about five months. This app has been critical in helping me make conscious food choices, allowing me to still enjoy the foods I love while improving my health. It has also motivated me to exercise regularly so that I can eat the treats I like. It has truly made my life better. Thanks to the developers!

title: Great easy to use app
body: Very easy to use app. I like how the app has the calorie count for a lot of different types of food. You can either do a search or you can scan items. I like how you have a running calculation of the calories you have left to consume for the day for the day. One suggestion would be to have some data on how many calories you burn doing different types of simple exercises such as walking for 20 minutes or running for 20 minutes. Other than that great app I'm definitely going to keep this one.

title: I actually use this app!
body: I use this app all the time to plan meals and keep track of my calorie intake when I'm trying to drop a few pounds. I am impressed with how easy it is to find the foods I eat in the database. The only improvements I wish they'd make are to have the Stronger meal plans show up in the app. Right now I have to sit with my laptop and enter the Stronger meals into my MyPlate app. I also wish I could then click on the Stronger recipe and see the ingredients and directions. Still the best app I've found for meal planning and nutritional tracking.

title: Almost cancelled
body: I've been using the calorie counter for sometime. And I'm a gold member. I feel that I don't really need the counter, but it does help me to see what I'm eating and all the nutritional values. My work is motion intensive so I get well over 10,000 steps a day and more when I do my morning run. I like the 10 minute workouts and how easy they are to add to my daily count. I'm happy about all the health and nutrition info I get in my email everyday. Well worth the cost for me. Mahalo for the great app.. Aloha,

title: It's ok
body: I have MyPlate and MyFitnessPal and I find pros and cons with both. My plate is has a better looking display not any bugs better at showing your macros and it tracks your steps better. However I will be purchasing a Fitbit soon so I no longer have to worry about that too much. With MyFitnessPal your able to get EXACT measurements with your food to get the most accurate results. Fitbit doesn't allot calories when you're doing strength training just cardio. But again that may change once I get my Fitbit and it'll monitor that.

title: Good concept, many glitches
body: I love the concept of this. However, there are frustrating glitches. Sometimes, when I try to "create new food", it will not save and say that it is unable to save at that time. Yes, I had wifi and a stable connection so it was not a connection issue.

title: Much harder to track macros
body: There's no daily pie chart for macros anymore. Now instead of showing you what you have eaten and what percent of your day's diet it was, there are bars based on static macro goals with how much you have left in the day. And if you go over, you can't tell by how much. It just says zero grams left for the day. And if you work out that day your calorie goal adjusts, but the macros don't. The old version would show you the macro ratios no matter how much you ate so you could stay in balance during days with varying calorie burns. Plus they added more clicks to do the same thing and the new design requires scrolling to see the same information (calories per meal, calories burned). I used to like this app.

title: The flaws out weigh the good parts.
body: It's a cool concept with good design but there are just too many flaws. For example, when I would log a food the macronutrients would be super off from the percentages they give. I used this app one day and it did this with most everything I ate. This wouldn't be bad if you payed more attention to calories but I am strictly watching macronutrients. Another thing is they WILL NOT delete my account. I've emailed them because that's apparently the only way to delete your account and they won't respond. I just want my account deleted so I don't have to have my email bombarded with emails of an app I don't like.
response: Hello! We respond to all requests sent directly to support@livestrong.com. Please be sure that you are emailing us at that address to request to have your account deleted. We are aware of the issue with the macronutrients and we apologize for this. Our team is working on a fix and we hope to have this resolved soon.

title: Great app!
body: I didn't get this app to lose weight. I got it to track my nutrition, calories, water, exercise. It would be great too if you needed to track your sodium intake or other specialty diet needs. Overall I really enjoy using it! For a free app this really delivers and helps me stay healthy. Thanks LiveStrong!

title: Overall great!
body: Recently started using this app after taking a personal fitness course & so far I love it! I'm currently using the lite version but considering the upgrade...

title: Love it!
body: I've been using this app for a few weeks now. I originally just wanted to track my exercise and water consumption, but after I started plugging in my food too I realized just how much healthier that could make me. I don't know if I've lost anything because I don't weigh myself, but I feel better than I have in a while and my boyfriend even noticed a change. So I highly recommend this app to anyone just trying to be healthier or get a perspective on your eating habits.

title: App is pretty good but not great.
body: I love bring able to keep track of everything I eat. However it doesn't show in a good way of how many grams of things you eat in a day like protein and fat etc. I also don't like how it doesn't have a larger variety of items in its database. I buy lots if store brand items most are not in the database. Last but not least why do I have to continuously have to keep entering I want to lose 1 1/2 lbs a week. Even when I hit sync it still will go back to maintain weight option which is not what I want to do. If these were fixed it would be great. Thanks

title: Limited scanning and exercise data
body: App works ok, but too many food items that I scan with other apps just fine but aren't found with this app, so a lot of time spent entering manually.

title: Food database is excellent - missing many basic exercises
body: I use this app to calculate macros and make sure I am eating enough.  I have also recently discovered the community is pretty awesome as well - which makes keeping accountability even easier.  I was excited to see they had a section for "exercise" to log daily exercise to check for calories burned, but it doesn't have basic weighted exercises.  I am a lifter and would find it greatly helpful if there could be an update that incorporated basic lifts with barbells and dumbbells.  :) overall, this app is great with much potential in store!

title: 1 day at a time
body: This app is very helpful and I like using it. It does take effort to remember everything you eat and this makes you accountable and keeps track of those calories.

title: Amazing app!
body: This app is the most well put together database I've ever used! It's simple to use, friendly user interface and most of all the food database is second to none. Any food I've entered has shown up and I have the option to input close to an exact quantity. For a free app this a 5 star app. Must buy and the gold makes everything much better. This app is better than any paid calorie counter out there!

title: Overall basically good
body: It's been pretty good but it does get a bit glitchy at times. I've had a few issues with nutrient counts not matching item when I use the scan feature. Other than that I submitted a request to add a vitamin/supplement category to track as well and they responded rather quickly. They're working on adding it with no ETA. I upgraded to the gold version for a month and I still don't see that the extra $9.99 month is worth it...unless I'm missing something.  Overall, the free version is good if you just want to be more conscious of your eating habits.

title: Great Tracking Diversity
body: I have only been using this app for the last 3 days. I like being able to track my workouts with accurate calorie calculations. I have just started rollerblading again and it is easy to search for "Rollerblading" as an exercise and easily set how long I did that for. Then you press another button and it adds it to the exercises you performed that day. Great app. I haven't explored the Subscription service yet but plan on doing that in a few weeks when I return to college.

title: Very well done!
body: This is a great app. My absolutely love the live search for foods you've eaten. Because it's a community-wide library, you can find the nutritional facts for almost anything. I s even able to find my obscure German Christmas cookies in there.

title: You get what you (don't) pay for
body: IMHO, this app is pretty mediocre.

title: Ok for a tracker
body: Works pretty well for what it does, but a few bones to pick:

title: Perfect app for me :)
body: It's everything I'm looking for in a tracking app to track my weight loss and fitness goals. Very user friendly layout and it makes it easy for me to view and compare data and see what worked for me and what didn't :) I love how it shows me the ratios of carbs, proteins, fats on a pie graph   ! Helpful if I decide to follow a diet (keto for example). It has progress graphs for so many things! I can't stress enough how amazing this app is and how much it's helping on my 40 lb weight loss journey!

title: More than I could ask for
body: This is the first time I've tried an app for my dietary goals. I have IBS Type C, and actually have the urgent need to gain weight. App has helped me understand I'm often not eating enough calories, and definitely not enough protein based on my goal of gaining two pounds a week. Haven't tried the exercise tracking in detail, but I like how many different options there have been for walking (pace will affect the amount of calories one burns).

title: Easy, Accurate, and User Friendly
body: I've used it for over 6 months and I've found it easy and accurate.I've used other versions but this is the best. There is no food I haven't been able to find and that includes brand names. The easy portion adjuster is extremely helpful. This APP also tracks progress so you can see over time what items really worked for you in your weight loss goals. I would highly recommend it.

title: Keep yourself accountable
body: This app is great for keeping yourself accountable. I tracked everything I ate and it helped me to lose the 5lbs I wanted to shed. It also helped me eat healthier (foods with more vitamins, minerals & protein) and with more purpose (avoid mindless snacking) because it provides the percentages of fat, protein and carbs you're eating daily. I love it!! A few months ago I deleted this app just to make more room on my phone and now I'm downloading it again because I've gained those pesky pounds back üòÜ

title: Helpful and easy to use app
body: I love this app!! At first, it was confusing to use but after exploring, it was super easy to use.ü§óI love how they have workouts, chat page, calorie tracker and food! It's literally an all in one app that uses so little storage!üòÉ I also liked how when you put the food you ate on your meal list, they have different brands and offer the nutritional value.üòòüòç And it tracks like everything you swallow and how much you walk! I absolutely love this app!!üñ§üòáüòäüíãüíã

title: I love it!
body: i'm so excited to start my healthy lifestyle and look good for next school year, I'm so glad that I found this app because it really helps you to track and be more conscious of what you're eating during the day, and also helps you to know how much you should eat during the day and how exercise affects that. I love this app and I think anyone who's been struggling to lose weight and really has the initiative to try it should definitely try this app

title: App does not track accurately
body: First of all, it does not fully register iPhone steps. It seems to register the first time the app is opened, but does not update the rest of the day. Or possibly it only tracks when the app is open? Either way: it's not pulling the full steps data from the phone.
response: Hi there. Thank you for your feedback. We're so sorry for the inconvenience! Our team is aware of these issues and we're working to resolve them as quickly as possible. We appreciate your patience!

title: Really good app
body: This app allows you to pretty much track everything from your dite, weight progress and exercise. Every this is listed clearly and easy to use. You can also go to the livestrong website and sync your progression there to. If you are having a hard time tracking your run times Nike also has a good app that would pair up quite well to this... Give it a try if you are serious about losing some weight and becoming more healthy.

title: Nothing to lose but pounds!
body: I have several diet tracking apps, but this is the one I find myself gravitating towards most often. Calorie Count would come in at a close second. It has everything I could really ask for: ease-of-use, large food library, prompts aren't too annoying or obtrusive, and most of all it makes me feel accountable to no one but myself, while still allowing sharing/ social options. Give it a try!

title: Good but needs a few adjustments
body: I really enjoy the ease if use with this app. There are only 2 things that I find annoying. First, when I open the app, often the date on top is something from a year or 2 ago so after I enter my info for a meal and return to the main screen, there is nothing there and it has somehow come back to "today" and I ten have to re-enter everything. Second, the water entry needs to have an adjustable serving size like everything else. Otherwise, I really enjoy this app.

title: Great for Alz weight tracking... Must keep weight on in late stages
body: Thanks for making something easy enough for a very busy daughter that is trying to help care for her mother who has Alz. She lost 10# in about 7 months and with this I can show her at a glance how many calories she has eaten. The amount of foods in the data bank is awesome. Very few items could not be found.

title: Great Tracker
body: the one thing I don't like is that is doesn't very much/accurate information on calories in foods from restaurants (chains like panera etc) also some regular food items that you would but at a store are not the most accurate. overall though very helpful to help you track and also see how many you have burned. you can enter calories manually which is good if they don't have it or if it's not accurate and also you can enter calories for your workout. this is a very good app to have

title: Disappointed
body: Loved the app until it crashed and lost all my data. All my stats were messed up with ridiculous numbers...like I had consumed  more of than 40,000 calories in a day. It was all connected to My iPhone Health app, and messed it all up, too. My Plate said they would fix it, and all our original data would not be lost, but although they updated the app, all the crazy numbers remain. I had to disconnect My Health and erase all erroneous data. I have been waiting for it to work, so I tried it today. Entered all my breakfast food, but when I went back to enter lunch, it was all gone! What the heck?! Changing over to the My Fitness Pal app since this one no longer works.

title: Simple and basic
body: I am not a mathematician nor do I want to be. I'm not interested in all the full up complicated trackers I've seen in the past. This is exactly what I was looking for. Stated my goal and tracks my calories that's all I'm interested in and it does a great job. I'm not a runner, I'm not an athlete just a simple woman looking for a simple way to lose weight and track it. This does it easily so that i'm not going through a bunch of machinations to input. Love it thank you

title: Good, but could be improved.
body: Great for tracking calories and macronutrients in general. The ability scan barcodes is great. Can you make the scan button a little bigger? The "scan" button is right next to the "done" and I am constantly hitting the "done" button.

title: Love for many reasons but suggestions to improve.
body: There are many things about the app I love however there are many frustrations I seem to run into consistently.  I use the app as well as the website and they often are not synchronous.  The food and workout I input on one does not update on the other. The suggested daily calorie intake and is also different on the app then online so it's difficult to know which one to follow and where I am and hitting my target for the day.  I would also love if the app could sync with more apps to track workouts like MapMyRun!

title: It works!
body: This is the only weight loss tool that has ever worked for me! This is perfect for people who just need to watch portion sizes. But you will need to make sure you get those calories from healthy foods. I do wish that this app allowed users to enter foods by grams. For example, I would like to be able to write "49g of avocado," and have the app automatically calculate nutritional values for that. Currently I do this with google and manually enter the data in this app.

title: Ok, not great
body: Like the title says, the app does its' job, but it's nothing to write home about. It's practically designed, for the most part, but the food and exercise is very limited, the scanner only works on major brands  (because if the library) and you can only browse by typing in specific exercises or foods. And I couldn't get it to recognize "sit-ups", so that can be frustrating. Also the constant mPoints link is really annoying.

title: Works for us!
body: My wife and I realize we put too many calories into our mouths!  This app has helped us to control that tendency. We have both shed several pounds in the weeks we have used it.  We eat what we want but by keeping track of the calories, we have found that we are not at all feeling starved.

title: Great App!
body: I mainly track my weight, and it is useful to me to be aware of how some things I eat impact my numbers.  I do low carbs, and eating white rice makes a huge impact!  It is interesting to see the daily fluctuations and determine why.   Love the weight tracker!  I just spent some time in the community and think I will post there when I get a good picture.  I am going to also start the calorie tracker.  Didn't before because I mainly am concerned with the carbs.  Can you add a carb tracker please?  Great app!!

title: Just as good as weight watchers
body: I searched for an app that did a calorie countdown, when I found this I was amazed at what it could do ... It reminded me of the weight watchers program I was on a few years ago, keeps me engaged and the community involvement helps me stay focused with the support everyone brings. I don't understand why I'm required to register online just to upload my picture and add my meals when everything else I can do is on my phone. Seems redundant.

title: Love it!
body: I am impressed with the ease of tracking so many real foods and how it drives good behavior. I feel compelled to be honest about portions and it wakes you up about what you are really putting in your body. I have made continued progress (11 pounds lost in annual physical) but now want to get to my real goal of another 20 pounds off.  The integration of the exercise also works great as a motivator to get off your posterior to burn off those Fritoes...then don't eat the junk anymore for a double benefit  ;-)

title: Far beyond imagined
body: This app is absolutely amazing, and it's free! You can literally scan barcodes on what you eat and let the app do everything else. It imports your exercise from the iPhone motion sensors and even gives you 5 min workout ideas/serving size/guilts you into drinking more water and less drink calories! Highly recommend this to everyone, not just those trying to lose weight. It reminds you to pay attention to your body and health.

title: Reverse the last update!!!!
body: * update- I added stars because they updated a few things to incorporate the daily macro goal, daily pie chart and nutrient "label". Still wish they could separate out for NET carbs. For ketosis folks, that's a big deal.
response: Hi- we're so glad that you're happy with our latest update! We will definitely pass your comments regarding tracking NET carbs on to our team. Thanks for reaching out!

title: Potential problem
body: I like this app. I think it has a lot of potential (for me, at least). I might even buy the premium upgrade if I didn't have one substantial problem. I believe that if you enable the app to access fitness data from HealthKit, it will "double dip" from both iPhone steps and Apple Watch steps. Therefore the app things that I've walked twice as far, and effectively doubles the amount of calories that the app tells me that I can eat. This is a problem, and until it is fixed, I'm going to keep using MyFitnessPal. Please give me a reason to switch.

title: Nothing but praise
body: This app has been a great help! Counting calories has definitely been the most sustainable option for me. I love it because on days Iam feeling more motivated I eat as clean as possible, but on days I have cravings I just can't kick, I can still enjoy food and loose weight as long as I stay in calories. I also love being able to see my weight loss progress on the graphs. Definitely helps keep me motivated and wanting to reach my next goal!

title: Love the app, but...
body: This app is fantastic from a food tracking perspective. There is a huge food database, I love how you track and the breakdown of nutrients. The water tracker is great too. What really differentiates this for me is the integration with the Apple Health app and tracking my steps, and converting that to calories burned, thus contributing to my daily caloric intake. However, this feature is a bit buggy, and the steps are constantly changing, or incorrect both for the current day and days past. I would love for this to be fixed.

title: Pro Ana
body: I feel like this app sets the goal WAY to low for some people. I weight 121.6 now and would like to be around 115 and this app allows me 930 calories or so if set to lose 2 lbs a week. Other things about this app bothered me as well (not many serving size choices, no prediction of how much ill weigh in a few weeks, etc). I'm currently using myfitnesspal and am SO happy with it. I'm allowed 1,200 a day to lose weight and if I'm under that by more that 10 it gives a warning saying I'm eating too little to have healthy weight loss without putting my body into starvation mode and that I need to be at the goal. I feel this app I'm reviewing is unhealthy.

title: Good for me
body: A helpful calorie tracker with numerous trade name items listed; it is a large database. I particularly like the ability to add only partial portions (1/4,1/3,1/2...) since I often do more snacking than eating a proper meal. The exercise side does not seem to be as flexible.

title: The Best App for Tracking Food
body: This app is so fantastic. I've tried every app out there to track my food intake and it ends up being too difficult to do so I just don't do it. This app is so easy, especially with the scanning option, it literally takes like 15 seconds per meal to enter it and then I don't have to count calories & carbs because I can just look at my phone to do it! I've already lost over 20 lbs. and a great deal had to do with this app.

title: Good but current version buggy
body: In general I love this app and it has just gotten better and better. The latest release seems to be a bit buggy though.

title: Where's the 6 meals ?
body: Live strong has much better labeling of the snacks in the online version than mobile app. Rather than allowing you to label different snacks , like mid morning or even better (meal 1,2,, etc like body for life ) they lump them ALL under a generic category of snacks .  That stinks when your trying to figure out and track all of your meals not just the antiquated breakfast lunch dinner model.  At the end of the day you see one massive list for all your snacks and is very hard to use as a tracking tool.

title: Good diet aid
body: I've discovered it is about calories, well, and ridding yourself of addicting foods, and eating clean, organic, nonGMO, etc. but this app is a good, easy, relatively user-friendly tool to track my calories. I love the way you enter a restaurant name and it brings up items on their menu and their calories. The only thing I don't like is they don't keep your list of eaten and tracked items comprehensively. Items drop off. I tend to re-eat the same things repeatedly. It's a pain to have to start over. But otherwise, I like it.

title: Loving this app
body: I have been looking for an easy way to track my food for a while. I have been looking do a fully functioning app that is easy to use, tracks macros, uses the health app on my iPhone, and has a large library of real and restaurant food! This has all that and more

title: Best App For Weight Loss!
body: I used the online version several years ago to lose weight and decided to start easing the app in an effort to lose 20 pounds. I like it so much better than the online version and it is so easy to track calories, etc.  When you track what you eat, you feel much more accountable for what you decide to put in your mouth!  This is the absolute best app anyone could use to lose weight, in my opinion.

title: Pretty good! Would and have recommended!
body: This app helps me a ton! I've been using this app for about 2 or 3 months and I have lost five pounds! The only complaint is the weight tracker, the accuracy is a bit off. I have it on the loose two pounds a week setting and I usually only loose around one or one and a half. Personally speaking, I'm not trying to loose weight big time though, just a few pounds here and there. So I keep using it for fun and discipline reasons. I am a young adult female of 5'3 with a current weight of 120!

title: Lost 90 pounds in 18 months
body: I lost 90 pounds in 18 months.  At first, 2 pounds a week then 1.5 and later 1.  I started at 366 and am at 275 headed to 210 at 6' 5" and 70 years old.  The trick is to measure everything, eat above BMR and less than TDEE.  A 3500 calorie deficit is equal to 1 pound of fat.  If you go below BMR, you will go into starvation mode and gain weight while losing muscle.  As you get closer to your target weight, you have to reduce your calorie deficit. Weight loss is 70-80% calorie reduction and 20-30% exercise.

title: Mom
body: I really like this app for giving me a free place to journal what I eat and a visual of my progress towards my health goals. The list of foods in the database is extensive. I've noticed that sometimes the app closes unexpectedly, sometimes I can't exit mpoints, weight entered for the current day doesn't show up on the graph until tomorrow, I can't go back to see previous day's nutrients, no definition links for BMI or nutrient graph. It could be that I'm having some of these issues because I'm using the Lite version.  All-in-all, it's a good basic food journal with some nice added value features.

title: A very useful application if trying to manage weight loss.
body: This application has been extremely useful to me in a friendly contest I've entered at work.  It allowed me to ser the number of daily calories I could take in to meet a certain weekly weight liss goal.  It then allows me to track meals , exercise and water each day to meet these goals.  If I want a snack near the end of the day, I know exactly where I stand and whether or not I need to earn my snack on the treadmill:-)

title: Impressed
body: The MyPlate app is amazing. It's so easy to use, and it helps me lose weight! Another thing i really like is that it reminds me if I didn't track my days intake so it sends me a message. I'm really impressed with this app and I don't think i'll ever delete it because its opened my eyes to how high some snacks are in calorie and thats what has kept me from losing weight, but immediately I began to lose weight, and keep track of myself. I recommend an app like this to anyone.

title: Easy to use!!
body: So easy to use. Quick tracking logs and tons of food options. I love how you can log your exercise as well as water consumption. Other apps similar to this were so complicated to use and took to long to log all the food I had eaten, this one is quick and to the point but is also fun to use. I love the rewards...I have yet to actually cash in any of the points I have earned but its still fun to earn the points and "level up."

title: Awesome!
body: This app makes tracking calories and macros ridiculously easy. The search database already has almost every food I'm looking for, and it's pretty easy to manually enter my own foods as well. The scan function only works about 50% of the time, but I can find most things through search. One improvement would be the ability to take a picture of a nutrition label and have it import the calories macros. Otherwise, this gets the job done quickly and effectively.

title: I've had this app for 7 years
body: I have to say as a nurse I think it's the best app out there!  I love it because you can go back and look at your nutrition like a usda food label and see where you are lacking nutrition and/ or what you need to improve in your diet.   It's an awesome app to say least!  The charts are amazing to look at your progress and since the tracking system on the iPhone the activity tracking is really cool.  Highly highly recommend!

title: It's good for the most part
body: I would say the app is good. It's easy to plug in your information and track your intake and activity. The one problem I have run into is that I set it so it couldn't access my phone info thinking I'd change it later to add photos, etc., but now that I am wanting to do that I have torn the app up looking everywhere for privacy settings and cannot find it. It shouldn't be that difficult!! So I feel a UX designer should maybe fix a few things in terms of navigation.

title: Great app with great features!
body: Lots of great qualities! I love that you can have it automatically figure your calorie intake based on the info you put in, or you can enter your own. It has so many options, that you will find pretty much everything that you want to enter!! I paid for the gold membership, because you can track your progress with water intake, calories, carbs, etc!! Worth it for sure. Everyone should have this app!

title: Change the payment plan!
body: I HIGHLY suggest they change the pricing of the app. They should offer a one time purchase for the gold upgrade rather than paying monthly. This would set it aside from the competition and I would gladly pay for gold. Until that day I will continue to use the free version. If they are concerned this may be unfair to those who have already paid, they should simply reduce the cost of upgrading by however much a current gold member has already paid in monthly fees.

title: Review
body: App is one of the best around,but you still need an alphabet on the right side of people's food list so they can go to their foods without having to scroll their whole list to find a food. Also you need to have each meal breakdown of calories and carbs so those of us who are diabetics can keep track of them instead of a cumulative total. The app is to help us keep track instead of having to write everything down. It is sometimes difficult to do when eating out.
response: Hi! Thank you so much for your review and suggestions! Viewing a macro breakdown of each meal is available as part of our paid Gold membership! Please email us at support@livestrong.com if you have any questions.

title: Straightforward App
body: I love using this app.  Very easy to use, let's me track my food without complication.  I can see not only how many calories but approximate nutritional breakdown for fat, protein and carbohydrates.  I love the little chart that let's you see your weight progress while tracking your food, it's a little reminder of your goals and where you are.  I use the website so for a free and very basic version this app is definitely 5 stars for me.

title: Good tool
body: For the most part I like this app, there are a few things I'd change about it. First, if you mess up and don't enter your day it's really difficult to go back the next day and add it in. You also can't see your food ratio from past days-hard to see if you're improving in that.

title: No complaints!
body: I love this app! It has a pretty good archive of foods and it is easier to use than other apps because it usually lists serving sizes by cups and tablespoons, whereas some others only have food in grams. I also like the reminder to track food. Even though I work out in the morning, my favorite thing to do is add in my exercise regime at the end of the day because I love how it just erases the calories burned. I know it's just an estimate but it's pretty motivating!

title: Great way to keep track
body: I just love this app! I am able to type in a food and a bunch of results show up. I choose the ones that are Livestrong verified because those are the calories that are most likely to be correct. Not only can you keep track of calories, but you can also keep track of how much water you have consumed. All in all this is a pretty well thought out app. I have had no issues with it at all.

title: Best I've found
body: This is the first review I've ever written for an app, which is a testament for how much I like it. Best on the market. First calorie counter app I've found that actually has any food you can think of, and if not you can enter the info yourself! Love that it keeps progress, provides suggestions for intake based on goals, and you can track water. Extremely easy. Makes it fun, and addicting. I've lost 10 lbs in a little over a month!

title: Flexible. Easy!
body: I can leave the app and not log anything for a weekend and it doesn't mess with anything. Also is bonus with the scanner! Loove it. Makes me feel better knowing I stay under calories and ontop of working out. Big motivation booster with the weight option and it saves your foods so I don't have to go back and decide what of the few specific foods I've had. Even go on my desktop and it's still the same layout!

title: Love the app, it is very motivational!
body: Great application for keeping on track!  The calorie tracker is smart about frequently eaten food with just a letter or two typed.  All my favorite store brands from Wegmans and Trader Joe can be entered by scanning the UPC.  The community is great support for clean eating.  The reminders pop up to prompt you to input (and eat) have lost 35 lbs in four months with its help. If it integrated with Microsoft Health it would be perfect but cross tracking between the two is no big deal.

title: Good ap, couple flaws
body: Overall this is a great tool for tracking calories consumed and burned through exercise.

title: Buggy
body: Why can't I eat a portion of a meal I created? I created a meal, but my only option is to log that I've eaten the whole thing. The app is pretty great, but there can be lots of bugs (often shows no results when searching for a common food). My husband and I have the same app, and it worked differently for us- I could look some foods up but he couldn't, which is very frustrating when we eat the same meals. He has moved on to another app, but I'm hoping for many more improvements in future updates since I've used it for so long.

title: Loving it!
body: I have used myfitness pal before and never followed through. I can't really use that against them though. With this app I have been tracking for almost a week and have lost 7 lbs ( probably All water weight)

title: awkward serving calculations + no barcode scanner
body: Unlike other, better calorie counting apps, this one has no barcode scanner. As a result you have to manually look up every item you input.

title: Great App
body: This app is very useful, user friendly, and easy-to-use. There is only one complaint that I have, and that is the fact that you can't go back to past days and edit what you ate. I find this a tad annoying because I often find myself at midnight, trying to track my intake for the day, and finding that everything has been reset by 12:00, leaving me unhappy with an inaccurate reading for that day. If that could be fixed, I would have no problem at all.

title: Amazing Tracking and Use for Supportive Accountability
body: i've tried a few apps before but this one makes tracking calories exercise activities so much easier I can see the results and meet my goals with no problem. the support emails are also super. I have dietary restrictions and there something for everyone provided. Its also a relief the app does not bug you more than makes you accountable to stay on target!

title: Love it!
body: This app is intuitively designed which makes it simple to start your journey to weight management! Equipped with a huge database of very specific nutritional information (from Olive Garden's Lasagna Primavera to Special K's Cracker Chips), you can easily keep track of your calories. You can set goals; track your weight, exercise, bmi, diet diary; and even get encouragement from others who are managing their weight on the "community" feature. I highly recommend it.

title: Better than fitness pal
body: I just downloaded and I already love it!! I normally don't even write reviews but I had to for this app. I downloaded my fitness pal and it never really helped me, the format for my plate is so much better! it makes more sense and is easier to navigate. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because sometimes my calories that burned turn to 0 even though they were at a higher number before, but it normally changes back to the actual amount.

title: Perfect
body: Love this app! It helps me monitor my food intake and track my calories and weight. I can compare daily, weekly, monthly, and more. It has almost every item in it and offers the option to add items if they aren't located in the system already. You can add in calories burned by just adding the number of calories or by entering a certain activity and it calculates by time spent doing the activity or by number of exercises.

title: Love
body: I never write reviews EVER. That says something. Less than a week using this app, but I can already say that I love it! It's so nice being mindful of what I am eating. I love that it syncs with my phone and tracks the calories I have lost throughout the day. I've had zero issues. I love being able to see what I have eaten, what more nutrients I need more/less of, how many calories I have burned through exercise and daily things..lovely. Recommend highly.

title: Better Than Ever
body: I've been using Livestrong since July 2012, I can't imagine not using it to track my food consumption. However, it is not without its glitches, the one that keeps reoccurring is it loses your daily tracking from the current day and moves it to the day before and since this happens regularly even with the new layout/look I'm hoping this glitch will go away. That being said I like the new layout/look. Fix the glitches and I'll gladly rate 5 stars!
response: Hi Evansilly- thank you for the review! We'd love to help you with the glitch you're experiencing. Please email us at support@livestrong.com so we can investigate for you!

title: Sync up with Apple Watch please!
body: I love the home screen for the app on your phone. It is easy to use and looks great. My one complaint is that it does not sync up with my Apple Watch, meaning it does not know the calories I burned that day or how many steps I walked. I really wish this app did this. The app for the Apple Watch is also easy to use and add what you ate, but once again does not account for workouts or calories burned even though it is on my Watch. I would probably pay for this app yearly if it automatically took data from my Apple Watch.

title: Add weight tracker
body: Feature request use case

title: Love the app!
body: So easy to use, the easiest I've ever come across.  I can totally integrate it into my daily life, both the eating part and the exercise part.  So very user friendly.  I think I will be using this long term and feel I will achieve my goals with this app.

title: Limited food information
body: I tried this today and was displeased to find how little inventory it has regarding different foods and their nutritional profile. It makes using it very time-consuming. Additionally, the only way I could get it to save a Custom Food entry (I drink smoothies, so had figured out the nutritional profile to enter) was to say "I ate this" which wasn't true- I was just trying to set up my frequent common foods for future use.

title: Very Convenient
body: I was using the website off and on over the last few years whenever I needed to track my diet. The app is even more convenient. The list of foods already in the system is pretty good and adding an item is easy. Of course the list is not as exhaustive as what you mind be used to if you started out using the website, but it's still better than many of the apps out there.

title: Best Tracker I've Used
body: I used to use another tracker for many years, a popular one. This is so much better. It is faster at finding foods. It doesn't segregate your past foods into specific meal times so that you don't have to go searching for them for every meal. It allows you to look at graphs for everything besides weight. It doesn't force you to make an online profile. So much better and much easier to use. Thank you!

title: Update NOT an improvement
body: The latest update seems to have added nothing to the app in any way I can perceive while it certainly subtracted much: the visual pie chart for macros is gone; once over your daily amount you now no longer see total grams, just that you have none left; loss of "nutrition label" views for total daily. After over a year and a half of using My Plate I was finally considering purchasing the Gold upgrade but that will not be happening unless the great FUNCTIONAL parts of the app return. I have really loved this app and do hope it's made as useful to me again as it was before.

title: VERY POOR SUPPORT
body: I used the demo version of this app for several days.

title: My favorite food tracker
body: I've tried a number of calorie tracking apps over time and this is definitely my favorite. I've been using it for years. I really like that your daily protein, carb & fat intake is shown in percentages along with an overall easy to view summary of breakfast, lunch, dinner & snack calories eaten/remaining.  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 only because like any other food app I wish all my food/calorie searches were in the database. Having said that, most are or can be created.

title: Amazing
body: I love it's new look. I haven't been on this app for too long (about two months) and I love it. It is easy to input meals and snacks, it is easy to check how much weight you lost or gained, and I love the fact that it has a community bar that lets you talk to people who are in the same boat. I love the new input buttons and overall it has a clean but still fun appearance. It has helped me reach milestones and I hope it helps me reach my goal.

title: Great design, but lots of bugs
body: I just downloaded this app today and I thought I found a better app than MyFitnessPal because the interface is waaay superior. But then I went for a 2 mile run using my Nike+ app. When I open up MyPlate again and it says I've burned over 4000 calories! This is way off. Outside of this little jog I've just sat at a computer all day, and now I don't know how many calories I actually have left today. MyFitnessPal never had this issue. Great design so have a few stars, but lacking in the engineering and data departments. :-(
response: Hi ajpalmer! Thank you for your review and feedback. We're working on this bug and hope to have it resolved soon. Apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Never wrote a bad review, but...
body: This is one of the worst apps I've ever used (and I fell for the acne app) it is extremely confusing to use and feels the need to remind me to upgrade to their premium package.
response: Hello. Thank you for your review and feedback! We have passed this on to our development team. We'd love to answer any questions you may have. Please feel free toe email us at support@livestrong.com.

title: Seems great to me
body: I haven't looked into many diet/calorie counters but this one is simple enough, fun, and gives nice stats.  I have enjoyed it very much.  An improvement would be to be able to go back a day or more and add additional foods to the diary.  Sometimes you eat late or are out and cannot get it into the diary b4 midnight and then you cannot add foods as far as I can tell.  You can guesstimate the calories and adjust foods you did eat to reflect the numbers, but the other way would be better I think.

title: I love it !!
body: I mite be 11 but this is amazing it helps me eat how I'm suppose to so I don't grow up to be a pig. I recommend this app to everyone‚Ä¶ well not really you have to be smart some say they hate it because its hard to use but it's not first of all if you people know how to read then just look at the nutrient facts one the box then manually enter what it said if not just enter the name and brand of what your eating and it will tell the calorie to you !!

title: Love it!
body: This is one of the few apps it's actually all about you. If you don't do the work it shows you haven't. If you do the work it really keeps you motivated. The one thing I would add, for all the women dieters including myself that I know. I would make the way in the system on a decimal basis. A lot of women look at 142.3 and 137.8 as True measurement and it shows even the most incremental progress. With this app it only rounds off or up. Would love to see this change but love the app either way.

title: GET THIS APP.
body: Great App!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. It is very user friendly. Easy to track food and monitor all food intake. I use it in combination with my Fit Bit. Between the two, it makes keeping track of food and calories burned very easy. I would recommend this to anyone who needs to monitor everything from calories to sodium intake. I was recently diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. This app makes it SO EASY to keep track of my sugar intake. You gotta get this APP !!!!!!!!!!!!üòçüòçüòçüòçüòçüòç.

title: From 1 Star to 2
body: Updated- new update gives you access to goals at the macro nutrient level

title: Excellent
body: Helps to to stay on track. Extremely user friendly. I use it all day every day. Using it I can tweak my macros and calories and change my body weight on a dime. They had a glitch in the app and I couldn't use it for a couple of hours. I downloaded a couple of the popular trackers seeking a substitute. None compared. I deleted the others. So happy to have My Plate back!! This thing is like a toothbrush for me -- a must have!!

title: It actually works
body: I like the layout of the app, it is easy to use and it helps me track my calorie intake per day. I like that it keeps track of my weight loss/ gain and that it also keeps track of the calories I have burned from walking for the day based on my weight-height-age. I can also add calories burned through work outs. I will continue to use this app as long as it continues to be free and offer all of these app benefits.

title: Not a fan
body: I have both MyPlate and myfitness pal app. I prefer myfitness pal much more. With Myplate they have limited food varieties and when I try to input my meal it says error. I also don't like that I can't input the suggested workouts. I do like that they have workout plans available however,  you can't document it like you can on the Myfitness pal.

title: Thankful for the recent update
body: Thanks to the update for showing how many macros I have consumed instead of just how many I have left to consume, I am very happy with this app and will continue to use it to help reach my goals. I gave the app 4 stars because the rewards program with the app has never worked for me since the day I downloaded it, about a month ago. I don't know how much I'd actually take advantage of it, but it would be nice to at least check it out.

title: Fantastic
body: This is now my favorite app. I had it a couple of years ago when it was not as good as it is today, but with all the updates they have made, it makes it so much easier to scan the barcode and have my data instantly appear. with this app I was able to lose 30 pounds, but when I stopped using it I gained a lot more‚Ä¶ Now I am on track to lose 50! This really is a great app to help!

title: So far awesome
body: So far I love it...I have to say I have used other ones for my nutritionist classes and this one is so much better than the teacher recommended ones...easy to use, great variety in the search for food items...not sure if this one has a scanning option, for I pad use (Just started using it) but if it doesn't that's the only recommendation I would make, well keep up the current food items also

title: Nice
body: Been using a week,I like this app.

title: Very Good
body: Overall I really like this app. One thing that I do wish you could do is to be able to edit frequently eaten food and recently eat food. On my list of frequently eaten foods are items that I have had one time. Missing will be something that I may have eaten as recently as the previous day's meal. I have learned over time that frequently and recently eaten foods are linked up to the Meal that you have selected.

title: Decent but some improvements
body: This is a very decent app. Two things I would like to see improved upon:

title: Exercise calorie counter has gone haywire
body: I've always disliked the fact that MyPlate doesn't accurately track calories burned when I run or bicycle -- it greatly undercounts them -- yet I've gotten used to adjusting the total after every workout. But for the past two or three months the exercise counter has been running amok; I go for a 30-minute jog and it adds 1,100 calories! Or I do an ordinary, 20-minute walk and the calorie count is either unchanged or 1,200 calories higher! I have other, minor complaints about this app, but obviously it's useless if it doesn't correctly track or retain my exercise calories. I'm going to have to find an app that does.

title: Love it
body: I love this app. The interface is nice and clean and user-friendly, and there are so many features about this app that I love! I have used MyFitnessPal in the past, and I prefer this app because of the design and ease of entering in my calories. The adds aren't intrusive, and there are only a few features that need payment to access, and they are not necessary for basic food tracking purposes. This app is 10/10!

title: Maintain weight
body: I was excited about this app and I really wanted to like it. However, one of the first questions it asks is if you want to lose or gain weight. There is no option for maintaining weight. I'm a healthy weight and have no interest in changing it--I just wanted to be able to track my nutrition. I was forced to say that I wanted to lose/gain weight when that is not true. I feel like I'm being told that I should be unhappy with my body and aim to change it. After registering an account you are able to go in to settings and choose "maintain weight". There's no reason why this can't be an option while registering your account.

title: Great app
body: Love the way it tracks and counts macros, however I am having difficulty putting my recipes in? I have to put each ingredient in as a portion of each recipe. I cannot seem to enter the whole recipe because it tells me that I have to "share" it even if it just a personal recipe and makes me put in how to make it, (200 words or more!) even though I know how to make it. Low carb taco salad for example, even if I were to share it I would hope that most people know low to make a taco. So I have to enter it separately each time I make it. ‚òπÔ∏è
response: Hi Tristonomore - It sounds like you might be using our desktop site or another app entirely! Please email us at support@livestrong.com so we can help you get this sorted out!

title: Love the app! Just a few suggestions...
body: Love the app, just have a few suggestions. It would be great to be able to add pictures to your meal log. I would love to keep record of my meals (in pictures on the app) throughout the week. Also, to increase the amount of local restaurant meals with nutritional info. I know it's a lot to ask and I also add my own stuff to the app, but sometimes what you find is very generic and doesn't necessarily apply to you. Other than that, amazing! ‚ù§Ô∏è
response: Hi ACAC1806, thank you for the review and suggestions! We will happily pass these on to our team!

title: Great app. Love it.
body: I've been using the app now for just over a year. I went ahead and purchased the yearly gold subscription and I can't be happier. It tracks everything. It has great database of different foods and drinks within the app. I also love the fact that it reminds me to track my meals when I forget. It also links up with my iPhone. If you are working out and watching what you eat I highly recommend.

title: Makes Being Healthy Fun and Measurable
body: I have been trying to find a convenient method to track my poor eating habits. I tried another with food tracker, but the interface had too many features. I couldn't easily input info. A few suggestions: 1. When I input food, just because it enter the name in a different order I shouldn't produce a new food name. 2. According to the app, running doesn't burn any calories. I am not a health expert, but my gut says this is wrong. Can this be standardized and calculated since the app has my weight, height and age?

title: Good management system
body: This app allows you to count calories and exercise to lose or maintain weight.   It is easy to set up and use.  It sends reminders to track.  I especially like the new feature that computes the percentages of protein, fat, and carbs in a day.  I wish it would split out good carbs from junk food.    I have used this program for a while now both to lose weight and maintain.  I am very satisfied with it.

title: Great App! 5/5
body: this app is so great and very organized.. not many adds & no pop ups! when you actually make an account where you can post a blog, the people on the app are very nice and they have great advice! everything about this app is great! it has reminders for you to log your meals! you actually can keep track of what you eat! actual restaurant food is available to chose from. I love this app, it's an everyday use for me.

title: Crashed and lost all my data!
body: Update: it crashed again, 3 weeks after the last crash. Once again losing all my data. I'm changing to a different app now, which is sad because I liked this one and I have lost weight while using it.

title: Pretty good tracking app
body: The app is pretty easy to use and has a pretty large data base which is a great time saver (no entering all my foods in!!). Love the scan option (most apps have that though), but I would like it if I cld repeat a meal on the free version from the night before w out having to make it a permanent meal. So many ppl use left-overs for consecutive meals - this should be an option! I find myself going back and forth between days and then searching again for foods I just had yesterday so it can be annoying and time consuming.

title: LOVE!
body: for those of you who don't have the app, and are thinking about getting it, I suggest 100% that you get it! It is a great app for dieting and watching your every day calories. It sends you a notification every day to log in your foods and it also tracks your movement every day, which then subjects calories from your total. It's such an awesome app and I 100% suggest that everyone should get this app who is wanting to wash their calorie income.

title: Outstanding App
body: Most apps don't really contribute anything tangible to your life.  This one helped me lose fifteen pounds.  Look, if you're serious about losing weight and keeping it off, you'll be serious about your calories.  Don't count them "in your head" unless you want to stay fat.  Use this app and account for what you put in your body.  It's a handy, well-made tool that will have a very real and positive effect on your life.

title: I tell everyone about this app!
body: I recently lost close to 20 lbs using this app and when people ask how, I have to walk them through all the features that this app has to offer. Obviously dedication is the #1 component, but this app helps you hold yourself accountable.
