Remember a healthy lifestyle is 80% food and 20% exercise - so track what you eat and manage your macros accordingly through the visibility that this app provides.

title: Terrible new update!!
body: I was confused as to why when I went to log my lunch all of this other data was already in my account. Random info populated over 2000 calories of added food & at a glance I'm seeing exercise & everything else for FUTURE dates. I see other people have mentioned the same problem so I really hope this gets fixed. The first thug that popped up when I opened the app after the update was an ad for the paid gold membership-HA! So glad I didn't sign up for that mess & PAY to have my data messed up. How annoying. I might be integrating my true data into Fitbit from now on & keep my information accurate, safe, & streamlined...

title: Generally okay but... No Net Carbs!
body: I like this app overall, but it does not track your net carbs. You can click on an info button to do get your fiber and do the math yourself, but for your full day summaries they are always off, graphs wrong because they are looking at total carbs vs net. Not helpful if you are Keto, Paleo, etc.

title: Annoying app
body: This might be the most annoying app in the entire App Store. Every single time you enter a piece of food that you eat, it pops up with some Achievement that you've earned... and it blocks your entire screen so you can't do anything until you dismiss the achievement. There is no way to turn this off, either! We even emailed their tech support about this, and they said, "We can't find what you're talking about on our website", and we said, "No, not your website, the app!", and they said, "Sorry, we don't provide tech support for our apps." Terrible app from a terrible company. We wish we could give this app ZERO stars if we could.

title: Forced account & popups
body: Update: now forces you to make an acct, even if you had been using it previously. If we already had to have an acct, the forced update logged me out, and I don't want to go digging through my email to find it since an acct shouldn't be necessary, and  also because:

title: Working good so far
body: I like this app, it makes me think more about what I eat. I've only been using this app for 2 weeks but I've lost 5 pounds so far. The only thing I struggle with is that I've entered enough "recent meals" that they are hard to find now, I wish they were in alphabetical order or some other way to find the recent meals. Also, if there were some way to delete old meals that do not have the correct nutritional values. Other than that this is a great app, thanks.

title: New version - love the UI improvements
body: This is still my favorite calorie tracker app because it is so much easier to use than the others out there.

title: Perfect for my needs
body: This app is awesome. I've been trying to lose weight for years now and this app makes it very easy to track what I eat and exercise. Everything is free to use except a few unnecessary trackers. It has a database of every food I have eaten so far, and I like some strange stuff. It has made it very easy, for the first time, to stick to a healthy diet. Been using for a month now and lost 7 pounds, so I give it 5 stars.

title: This app is fantastic.
body: This app is so convenient. Anything that you consume is pretty much on their list so you can keep accurate count on your consumed calories. It also has a scanner to scan your product and I have yet to find something that it does not recognize. This really keeps you accountable from food intake to excersise to keeping track of the water you've drank. It has so many features.

title: Intuitive Food Tracking App
body: This app is one of best tracking systems I have found -very intuitive and easy to use -love the scanning feature that pulls in the nutrition info of foods. The front page of the app provides a great mapping visual for %  of calories consumed by protein, carb, and fat. As it is compatible with the Apple Watch and phone apps for tracking activity, it pulls in number of calories 'burned' through activities. HIGHLY recommend!

title: great app!
body: I love this app!! but one problem that occurs with calorie trackers like these is that they're often used by teens struggling with eating disorders and it can lead to an even worse relationship with food and stress over calories/macros. The support section is amazing in this app and offers kind advice and suggestions but it would definitely be helpful to find a way to make sure the app is being used in a healthy way :)

title: VERY GOOD APP
body: i just got this app yesterday and i like it so much, it has a calorie tracker, and when you put in foods that you eat you can either search the food or put in the barcode which is very helpful, and also it has exercises that you can do and i counts the calories that you burn, and i also like the design of the app and it is easy to use. Even though it does not gave a step tracker i think it is a very good app.

title: Info on main page
body: I chose this app over MFP for a change and I liked that my info is on the homepage of the app.

title: Perfect calorie tracking app
body: I absolutely love this app. It has an extremely wide food database, and even if (rarely) a food I want to track is not in the database, it only takes me a few seconds to create it manually. It is so easy to use, allowing me to track both weight and exercise. And I even get to win rewards!! I will be using this app for a long time, even after I (hopefully) meet my weight loss goal!!

title: Very good, just be aware.
body: I like this app. It is easy to use and is seeming to really help with my weight loss. It is a little annoying that when you  search for foods you get a lot of results for the same food with very differing nutritional info. You also build points by using the app, that you can cash in for gift cards etc. Some of the surveys you can fill in to earn points ask for information that seems to be oriented towards obtaining marketing info about you.

title: Just what I wanted
body: Great app. Intuitive. Has all the desired features, yet is easy to use. Yet there is one tiny (but annoying) bug. As expected the daily calorie allotment decreases as my weight decreases (which is good). The problem is that the calendar does not permanently retain my calorie needs for that day but instead compares my current daily needs against all dates. This has the demoralizing effect of turning all the past days red, implying that I failed to hit my goals in every previous day.

title: Simple to use
body: I have been using the lite version for just over a week. It is easy to track what you are eating since many of the food items or something close are listed in the extensive database. I use a heart rate monitor and like the exercise calorie tracker and the water tracker. Using this app has helped me make better food choices so far. Wish we could have a way to add items to the database.

title: Missing one key thing
body: I love Livestrong and use MyPlate every day. It's the most amazing health tool since, we'll, maybe wiiFit. I've always used the Web version and just downloaded the app. It's great, but missing one of their most valuable tools: the complete nutrient breakdown. On the Web, I can see how much fat, sodium, sugar, etc., I'm getting in a day and adjust my diet accordingly. On the app I only get a general radio of fats, proteins and carbs.  If Livestrong would just add that function, they would have a perfect nutrition app.

title: This app is AMAZING!
body: I am not giving this app a 5 star out 5, I have been overweight for majority of my life then having my daughter made me gain some more weight I've been trying to lose weight for almost a year and nothing worked until I came across this app it really makes you think of what you are eating  and doing throughout the day, the app has motivated me and I'm actually shedding pounds! Just try it, you won't be sorry!

title: Better than lose it!
body: This is a lot better than lose it! The only down side is(for me) is that it doesn't do offline tracking. I work I'm a kitchen and a lot of times you don't have service in the kitchens on NYC so I have to wait til I'm out of work to track what I have eaten. But all in all not too bad. I've dropped about 7 pounds and I've been using this app for 10 days now. Great way to keep track of snacks, breakfast, dinner, water , etc. all in it's own category. Just need offline tracking and I'll be happy to give it five stars

title: Great for body builders and vegetarians
body: I've been a lacto-ovo-vegetarian for three years.  I'm also a strength trainer.  I've had a tremendous time managing enough calories and protein to maintain, gain, or cut weight.  This app makes it a snap.  I love that I can set my own calorie goals each day manually.  The barcode scan is also a great feature. And all you have to deal with are some minor advertisements at the bottom of the screen.  Well worth it.

title: Lost 95lbs w/MyPlate
body: MyPlate has been a great help this past year. It's my digital accountability partner!

title: Overall Ok. Works Mostly if you wish to gain weight
body: Nice Layout. Pretty workable and easy to get.

title: Good tool
body: I've used the inline version of this tool for years. I wish it had all the components of the online tool that you can get for free in the app. Like the water tracker. You can keep track of how many glasses of water you've had for the day. Also, I would like to see them implement a scanning function on here. I also have the fitness pal and it's very convenient TI have that function. Overall a great tool, but there's a few things that can be done to make it better.

title: An educational tool
body: I like this apps a lot. It's not a new diet apps, it is just a nice tool to accompany you if you are on a diet. It allows you to realize what you are really eating in terms of calories and how healthy you eat and also how healthy you are with the exercice tracking too.

title: A few glitches but great app!
body: My wife and I have been using this app for two weeks.  We love the carb/protein/fat ratio tab and the automatic import of our weight from our Withings scale!  Interface is very easy to use.  The few glitches we have noticed include a null value if you preview the nutritional information from a scanned food before you tell the app you ate it.  Also, website version seems to miss a lot when viewed online but the app is pretty solid.

title: Very helpful
body: I actually give this app most of the credit for my recent weight loss.  Easy enough to use, with very few problems.  I have found that the app and the website do not sync consistently, and the search function can be glitchy when my phone has less than ideal reception, but other than that the app has been incredibly useful.  Highly recommend.

title: Calorie Tracker
body: I really like this app especially with the update. It is easy to use. I like that I can scan some of the food I eat.  It does keep me accountable and shows me what foods/meals affect my weight. It also tracks my activity and I can put in exercises I've done. The only thing I find somewhat difficult is portion sizes. Short of weighing or measuring I sometimes just have to guess. But I think overall it works out.

title: Needs a recipe option
body: I've used various apps for calorie counting, and this is by far the best one. The interface is the best and it's the easiest to use. My only complaint is that there is no option for creating a recipe and getting (or even entering manually) the nutrition information. I have had to use a separate website to calculate the nutritional information of my recipes and may even switch apps altogether if this becomes more of a problem for me.

title: Better than the rest
body: Easy to find foods. Displays three main macros in circle graphs. Historical data can be viewed in bar chart form including calories consumed. Viewing historical calories burned is a premium subscription feature. Some unique foods require manual input and other users inputs are returned in searches. Bar codes can be scanned for quick itemizing, however sometimes data is stale. Overall a better app than the competition due to its wide range of free features.

title: Really helpful app
body: This is a great app, and I use the scanning capability very often to help determine calorie count. It helps keep me accountable, and I have shared it with several friends. The one complaint I have, is that when you use two different devices to input your information, they do not always sync up. Also, it seems as though when I exercise more than once per day that the previous information from the same day gets deleted.

title: Love it
body: It's been only 3 days since I have started using this app but I'm in absolute love with this. In past two years I have tried using so many food tracking apps but get frustrated soon as most of Indian cuisine cannot be found or added. So, I always wondered when?

title: Annoying ads
body: I like the app & being able to go back to a previous day & add something that I forgot. However, I had an "email alert" at the bottom of my screen & I checked it & closed out of it, yet it keeps flashing on the bottom of my screen. I can't get it to stop flashing. It's very annoying! I had the switch "on" for alerts, but consequently shut it off hoping that would shut off the alert & flashing. It didn't. How do I get the flashing to stop??? I shouldn't be forced to participate in an advertisement.  ‚òπÔ∏è
response: Hi TJ! If you are using the free version of the app, you will see advertisements. To enjoy an ad free experience, you can upgrade to a Gold membership or pay a one time $0.99 fee to remove ads.

title: Simplest App to keep track of your intake
body: This is the best because it has every food I search for, down to the brand and store, down to the grams of carbs and protein a food has. It is also very simple to find an exercise or manually put in your own. I've had no hassles making sure I'm getting enough protein vs carbs and fat because it has a pie chart that shows you how your calories are distributed every day.

title: Happy consumer
body: This is a great app for counting calories and tracking how much water you drink and the amount of exercise you do which is extremely important for weight loss. I give it four stars instead of five because sometimes I have trouble finding certain food calories. So to make the app efficient as possible, try and manually put in the calories for more obscure foods. I'm overall satisfied and super happy that this app has really helped me lose weight!

title: It's ok
body: I just downloaded it to start with weight managing. I was going to scan the barcode on a food item and the camera would not focus, it does not look directly at the barcode where the camera actually is. So, I have to spend forever trying to shift the camera back and forth trying to get right over the barcode. Finally got tired of it so I am just putting food items in manually. Overall, the app seems like it will keep up with everything and I shall wait to see if it truly works.

title: I find it helpful
body: I enjoy using it and have made a lot of progress with improving my diet. I wish I could set a preference for foods by weight when searching the database. (I hate to dirty up a bunch of measuring cups, and I'm not an accurate estimator.) Also, it keeps describing my custom foods as "one serving"--a completely arbitrary and useless phrase. I have it linked to the MyWater app, it would be nice if it recorded my fluid intake, not just the calories. STILL, I'm willing and able to use this app, so I'm calling it a WIN.

title: Easy to use, miss the diary
body: I love that I can track most of my noshables with just a click or two, but creating a meal is still a bit of a pain. The database has obviously grown in the last 5 years, but still has a ways to go to catch up with everyday life.

title: Goal accomplished! Still some flaws.
body: Using this app, I was able to learn more about what I eat and lose the twenty pounds I wanted to to get back to a healthy body.

title: Great app, a few fixes please!
body: I very much like this app and have appreciated the improvements in updated versions.  I do wish there were an easier way to see the calorie totals historically (both gross calories consumed, burned and net).  I can find it now on a bar graph but it's hard to see it easily for each day.  Perhaps a monthly calendar-view with that quick-hit information?  Also my phone app keeps crashing so I can't enter info remotely which is a bummer.

title: Love the community support on this app!
body: I love the new gold features! Being able to see where my calories are coming from is very helpful when it comes to tweaking my diet. Gold premium workouts rock! Very effective!

title: Interface DOWNGRADE
body: So this app used to be great. Now the interface is awful. You have to make multiple clicks to enter daily information for food (one used to be able to just click lunch, dinner, weight, etc., now you you have to click an initial "track" button. Why? This is a wasted of a button and time. It also doesn't track macros the same. It used to tell you how much you've consumed. Now it tells you what you still have yet to consume. There are days I have to change my macros and so it's important I know how many I've consumed. This change doesn't help. Don't buy this app. I'm probably moving to a new one myself.

title: Not compatible with Fitbit!!
body: MyPlate is not compatible with the Fitbit app.  If you track your daily activities and calories burned with a Fitbit, this app will not pick up the activities.  For me this was a huge disappointment as I use my Fitbit to track my activities. Fitbit is the most popular activity tracker so it just really doesn't make sense at all that the app isn't compatible with it. Very disappointed because I actually liked the app but had to go back to using the Lose it app so I can have my activity tracked from Fitbit to know exactly how many calories I burned during the day.
response: Hi Siunn! While we don't currently sync directly with Fitbit, the MyPlate app syncs with the Apple Health app and will import data from devices you've synced to that app already. So if you have your Fitbit linked to Apple Health, MyPlate will read that data from the Health app. Please email us at support@livestrong.com with any questions!

title: Helping Me Change My Life
body: I've always had a very difficult time losing weight, and have always struggled. I started using this app and it's easy, practical, and helping me make changes to my lifestyle to become healthier. I log everything, even on vacation, at a fair, etc. It shows me exactly what I'm eating, and making me conscious of it. I've lost weight. I feel so much better. And, I recommend this app to anyone.

title: Best fitness app!
body: You can look up calories for whatever you're eating.. Scan it even! I cross checked the calorie count and it's pretty accurate. I already cut out certain foods and drinks because of the ridiculous calorie count. You can also put in what you did for a workout that day and it allows you more calories. Honestly this is the most helpful app I have for starting a more healthy lifestyle :)

title: Couldn't live without it!
body: I recommend this app to anyone who is wanting to lose weight, or at least be mindful of their diet. Personally, this app has revolutionized the way I think of my diet, and I have even lose pounds already merely from being mindful of my calorie consumption.

title: Good not Great
body: I have been using the app go 60 days, my 2 complaints are that it doesn't track meals very well, many of the major restaurants aren't included in the food searches. Same thing with exercises, very limited options for "pre-defined " exercises, even common things like multiple speeds inclination for treadmills, various levels of running or outdoor cycling.  I have to create  most of my exercises.  So I have to constantly wear a heart rate monitor to track calories burned.

title: Pretty good
body: There's a lot I like about this app. I like that it links to the iPhone health app and converts my steps into calories burned, there is also a good selection when logging food.  I just really wish there was a way to reset data. I use the app for a few days, then went on vacation and didn't use it for a couple weeks. Now that I'm back and I want to use it again I wish I could just reset everything and start from the beginning...

title: Great app to track diet progress!
body: I love how this app syncs with my online account. It is a great app for calorie counting, and finds foods that I eat easily in the search bar...

title: Can update everything but exercise
body: I've had a mostly positive experience with this app, except for one issue. I have been unable to correct an incorrect exercise entry. After realizing I'd miscounted, I went back in to change the exercise. What I changed was added to what was already there, making it way off base, rather than just slightly so. Please fix this. As a human, I do make mistakes, and would like to be able to fix them when I do!

title: Good for tracking food but not exercise
body: My best advice is to be careful when inputting data. Very careful. Making changes for food is ok but DO NOT make a mistake when inputting exercise. I inadvertently added an exercise to the wrong date (next day). You cannot delete it  like you can for food. The "0" option is grayed out. Best you can hope for is reducing the exercise to one minute. But, that data still gets logged. Using the Community Board is useless and if there is a link to get technical support I wish you better luck than I had. I used to like this app but it has become more trouble than it us worth. Look elsewhere.
response: Hi DPinch1 - we're sorry you've had this experience. You actually can delete exercises that you've added by mistake. Scrolling down past your Food Diary will bring you to where exercise is logged. Tap on the exercise you've added, then select "Delete This Exercise" at the bottom of the screen. Please email us at support@livestrong.com if you have any questions!

title: Just amazing!!
body: This app is just amazing!! It changed the way I live and the way I eat.  My level of awareness of the food I eat went to the roof, all of this like playing a game. By counting calories I continuously lost weight, everything without having hunger! I am truly happy of starting to use this app and that is it helped me understand something so essential and of our day to day life as food.

title: So far, so good
body: In the past, I used "Lose It," but I couldn't go back to that app b/c I refuse to pay a monthly fee.  I remembered LiveStong b/c I would often look up calories on this site when the other app didn't have the data for my food.  So it was great when I saw that LiveStong had an app b/c I was already familiar with the brand.  Anyways, the app is really user friendly & I love that I can scan my Trader Joe's items with ease.  So far, so good.

title: Almost worthless
body: With 7 million options to choose from the database of foods is almost worthless. You can pick from 26 entries for any McDonalds burger but you can't find 6oz hamburger anywhere. Mindless inclusion of every calorie database makes this one poor to use. And if their redundant entries all have different caloric values. I need to know which to choose to use this well. But the reason I'm using it is to have help determining the caloric value of what I'm eating. It fails at that task. I'd love to find something truly helpful. And to end in a good note, the interface is simple and easy. They did that well.

title: Other app is better
body: I give this three stars because I love the layout of the home page, the colors and the pictures. It is really fun to look at and easy to use.

title: Great Calorie Tracker
body: I like this app because it's fast. I think it's better than my fitness pal. But that's because I care more for speed than accuracy.

title: User Friendly
body: Over the years I have tried several similar apps and a couple of them are excellent.  This app is as good as any of others I have tried BUT what help this standout - it is user friendly.  Also by keeping my cell phone on me all day I can also get a sense of my level of activity which is recorded and calculated into my diary.  A great motivational tool that is helping me to keeping going.

title: G
body: I use this app for weight gain, not loss. I think it may be better for weight gain and a way to track macronutrients then weight loss.

title: Good, but has slipped
body: Previous version was excellent; newest version not quite as good. Runs generally slower, takes longer to look up data,  claims to be able to edit "My Meals" via gadget (but won't). Still good for logging food and water, but would be nice to set default screen on "Progress" to weight rather than Calories.

title: Water issue
body: Good app overall, but there is no ability to edit or correct your water intake if you make an error.   PLEASE fix this--we need to track water intake.

title: Great!
body: I love this app! It's exactly what I was looking for; to get a realistic idea of the calories I take in, in relation to the calories I expel. I love that it grabs my calorie burn straight from my Apple Watch as well leaving no need for me to do anything but enter my food. And it has just about every food! I don't see the purpose of the community action as it seems to be over saturated with trolls. I never use it. Everything else is great!

title: This app is useful and addicting!!
body: I WANT to use this app! Lost 8pounds so far and didn't even noticed!  Great scanning of items would like to add scans. The list of exercises is great. Can't believe some of the listings even exist!!

title: Amazing!!
body: This app (and website) has been the best thing I could have done when I started on my weight loss journey back in November 2016!  I couldn't have made my goal without this app!  So easy to use that I've gone strictly with the app rather than getting on my laptop to log in my calories. If you are doing calorie counting as a weight loss option, you cannot go wrong with this app!

title: Success!!!
body: This app is keeping me going, keeping me honest, keeping me on track!! I lost 5 pounds in the first week just by staying within the reco's, and in making my food choices wiser when the days calories are nearing the maximum allowed. I love if I want something more, I can exercise to have it as it reduces the calories burned from my totals!  Want that special treat? Exercise and fit it in while still losing weight. This is great!!

title: Fantastic app!
body: This app is fantastic. I couldn't believe that it actually works. I've been trying to lose a few pounds and that's where it's getting me. It makes me realize what I'm eating throughout the day and how many calories are in each food. It's helping me eat a little bit better and partnered with my exercise, I'm losing weight. I've lost 4 lbs and I haven't even had it for 2  weeks. This app is great.

title: Cspeltz
body: I lost 30 pounds using the Slimgenics program but do not desire to continue that program forever. I needed to ability to monitor my daily caloric intake as well as seeing my weight variation on a day to day basis. Sometimes I am confronted by a difficult decision to determine exactly how many calories a certain item contains but I can almost always find a reasonable approximation using Livestrong.  Over all, I am very pleased with the program and will continue to use it.

title: Good App
body: this app is great in helping you track everything for the day and has so much variety in things to add. however, there are some improvements. 1. on the exercise part, all the exercises i enter are set at burning 0 calories per hour! the only way to enter the calories ive burned by exercising is to manually calculate and enter it!! 2. entering nutrition info is wrong! please add a mg setting because some food dont even have a gram of things like cholesterol and sodium. please fix!!

title: Servings, ounces, grams, We all need to talk a common language
body: Not accurate but better than anything else I've come across. Needs enhancements to make everything common. Also in reporting graphics. Need to start now, a small step at a time will make great progress. You already  have the suggestions to build the enhancement foundation for excellence. Easy to use with using all the main technology tool available on the mark. I'm a male and because I started using MyPlate I've stuck with it just to watch my weight.

title: This really works!!!
body: I've never been able to stick with a weight loss program before, but this app is like a miracle. It's easy to use and I especially loved the emails every day for the first month, those were a little something each morning I loved to get. I wish I still got them while I'm still on this journey. Thanks a million Livestrong you've really made a difference.

title: Great App
body: I use this app to track my daily calories and exercise. So easy to use. Love that you can just scan barcodes to enter calories. I also love that you can manually enter your own meals, so you don't have to do each ingredient for meals you eat often. I credit this app for keeping me on track with the lifestyle changes I have made that have resulted in significant weight loss (120 pounds so far).

title: Starting to get "Spam" notifications
body: The app works well and has been very helpful. However there has been a bad trend of the app sending notifications at odd hours outside of the meal logging reminders. The latest one came at 5:20 in the morning and when I contacted support they said "turn your notifications off." It seems that a quality app maker would not have their apps sending random notifications at bad times. Normally I would rate this app 5 stars but this notification problem and resulting customer service work against it.

title: Great app
body: Have used this app in the past and always loved it. The one downside is it doesn't recognize supplements when scanning and/or searching. I take mass gainer to aid in gaining weight, building muscle, and getting stronger; and when I scanned the barcode on my mass gainer bucket, it didn't recognize it, so I had to manually input the nutrition information. Would be nice if diet supplements like mass gainer, whey protein, and such were in the database.

title: Most have app to maintain a daily food Diary
body: Great app Easy to use and has large database to find the food you are eating and your daily activities. I have used this app for about four years. They are constantly making improvements. My dietitian loves the reports you can get from this app. She has been able to find the dietary issues I need to improve on.  But you have to. be honest.

title: Helpful app, but not as good as old version
body: I recently upgraded to this version and I have to say, I am unimpressed with the exercise tracking. The previous one included house cleaning, mowing, laundry, and all the day to day things that I do. It was nice to keep track of exactly everything I was doing. The updates version does not include any of that, or even simple, basic exercise tasks. I hope that everyday tasks like that can be added to the exercise options. It was wonderful to know exactly how many calories I had burned.

title: MyPlate Works
body: This app guides my daily food choices, helps me plan meals ahead, tracks my exercise, and is available wherever I take my iPad with 3G. I have lost about a pound a week for four months. I learned the hard way to keep track of my basal metabolism, and keep my daily calorie count higher than my basal. The app doesn't track that for you. Valuable app, even if you don't cash in your reward points (I do.)

title: Great app!
body: I use this app as my food diary and to track water and exercise. I mostly use the elliptical and the app calories don't seem to be correct. I just choose manual and put in the amount from the machine. I use all recipes (paid version) to plan meals and have a grocery list. I can get the calories for each serving from my allrecipes app and enter it into the food app that way. Love the combo of the two!!

title: Only one small complaint
body: Overall the app is great. It really allows you to track what you need to achieve your weight goals. Not only does it allow you to track calories but also allows you to track your macronutrients in the process. The only complaint I have is the percentages of fat protein and carbohydrates are incorrect. Most of the time it is reading off a much greater or lower percentage then what the numbers calculate out to.

title: Great app until they ruined it
body: The latest update has ruined this app. I need to track total protein and fluid ounces as a bariatric patient and the update instead tries to tell me what it thinks I still need for the day. That's not what I needed, which is why I picked this app AND paid for gold status in the first place. The tracking is more convoluted and the pie chart which showed your daily percentages for fat, protein and carbs on your home page is gone. AWFUL update. You might have asked for user input before changing it. If I could get a refund on what I paid I would ask for it. Now I have to find another tracking app.

title: Ease of Use
body: The app is easy to use for me. It has just about everything I need to keep track of my caloric intake for building muscle mass. The only reason why I'm giving it four stars is because the workout feature only gives a select few workouts to do and they don't really isolate any particular section of your muscles without having to pay for an upgrade to get the more isolated muscle building workouts.

title: Can I go back to the old version?
body: I preferred MyPlate over MyFitnessPal because it was much easier to view all the information in a pleasing layout on one screen, and it was simple to use. Now I have to click extra buttons to add food and see the graph, etc. So disappointed. I'm going to hope I get used to it, but I'm also going to look elsewhere.

title: Update: Interesting tactic, they took down all the negative reviews
body: May 3 Update: New update is much, much better. Thank you for listening to your users! Great app again.
response: Hello! We're so glad that you're pleased with our latest update. We'd love to hear what we could do to make this a 5 star app for you! Feel free to let us know here, or email us at support@livestrong.com.

title: An eye opener
body: Excellent way to loose weight and still eat foods you like to eat. It will open your eyes to portion control and high caloric foods. Easy to use and really works well. An easy 5 stars. Love that it scans UPC bar codes and you can also enter custom food and meals. Been using it a while and I am losing weight and have not seen any bugs in the app either. Thanks. Good work and it's helping a lot of people too.

title: Excellent calorie tracker
body: I have been using this for a month and have dropped about 2 lbs per week on average. At first I was using the activity tracker but it wasn't accurate enough for me. So I just calculated my own calories burned with a formula from runners world. (Weight in lbs x .57 for walking and x .72 for running.) I also like that as your weight goes down, the daily calories allowed goes down with it. Great tool!

title: Love it.... And it's working
body: Wife and I have been using for a couple of weeks, tracking our progress and adding in exercise at home.  Since then, we've lst 15 lbs combined, feel better and have some support with the community.  Best move I ever made with this app.  Keeps us both on track and provides a ton of support from other online members.  Don't believe me ?  Download the free version a give it a whirl!

title: awesome App
body: This app is amazing! If you are having trouble in finding what you want eat and if it is healthy at all this app is great! For example my brother and I have this app on different device. I found out that I don't consume enough calories every day. My brother found out that his breakfast lunch and dinner calories combined is only half of how many calories he consumes for snacks. As I have demonstrated it is a very helpful app

title: Glitches
body: It's an okay app but has a few problems. Sometimes I forget to log my exercises until after midnight but it will only allow you to look at the previous day but not enter information. Another problem it saves everything so if you enter something wrong on a food item you're stuck with the mistake sine the software won't allow you to delete anything you've entered once it's submitted. All that said it is better than most of the other apps.

title: Strong work
body: This app helped me get from 125 to 115 (doesn't seem like a lot, but when you are short every 5lbs is a different dress size).

title: Really like this
body: It has made keeping track of calories even better even, easier.

title: Since 2005
body: I have used this program since 2005 and have always liked it. I have used the app in the last two years and it's actually better than the program online. I like keeping my calories separate from my calories burned in fit bit, so that I can be the judge of how much I eat; instead of them making adjustments for how many calories burned.

title: Glitch with macronutrients and calorie totals
body: I set myself to a 1,200 calorie diet to loose weight, with 40% of my calories coming from carbs. That equals 120g of carbs a day. I entered in a banana and Chobani yogurt for breakfast, which the app correctly lists as 30g in total.... but it is telling me I'm already at 40% of my daily carbs?? That's not right... it should say 25%... basic math is not strong with this app, and basic carb counting is clearly glitched. I tried erasing and re-downloading... Same thing. I like everything else but if something as basic as carb counting is off by that much this all is useless. I hope others are over-doing or undergoing their carbs and trusting this app.

title: Super functional!
body: This app does a great job helping me keep track of what I eat. I love how it helps me set and keep track of my goals. The food catalogue is extensive and it allows you to make your own entries if what you are looking for is not on it. You can also integrate your work out routine which is an amazing function. All in all, this app gives me exactly what I am looking for from a calorie tracker.

title: Great tracking app
body: This is less cluttered than the Lose It app. It's to the point and easy to use. If using the free version, you get to track calories and weight. This will take into consideration how much you have walked to give you calories burned. There are other feature with the free version I'm not using so you may even find more uses out of the free version than I did.

title: My plate app
body: Wow, I tried count my calories and a few others but this one is easy to work with Great reminders and even stays with you when you exercise and count for you! Wow, I really like this app. You can scan in any product you have and it works great. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è love this app. I also want to add that I made a spelling mistake in my exercise and it won't let me delete it!  Please fix that issue.

title: Great!
body: I really enjoy the features of this app and love that it is free!!

title: Amazing!
body: This app is amazing!!!! I've been using it for only a couple of weeks and already I can see a difference in my body. I prefer this app over the Danskin food tracker app because the food options are much more detailed, there is a broader range of foods options to chose from, and if you need to enter a new food it's much more compatible for those who don't do too well with specific food measurements (like myself). I highly recommend this app!

title: Decent
body: I just downloaded and have used this app for today. So far, the selection of foods that have come up for what I type in are good. When manually entering your food there is no spot for sugars, dietary fiber, potassium, or sodium. I think those should be included. Also when manually entering a food, say I'm looking up the nutrition info on the Internet, when I bring up myplate after minimizing it i have to start the whole thing over. not too bad of a hassle since i can only enter calories fat carbs an protein.....

title: Nice and easy tracker
body: I really like this calorie tracker. It is very simple and it looks really good. You have all the basic information you may want right when you open the app. The one thing I would change is being able to edit the foods I put in there a little more easily. Sometimes I accidentally put in the wrong one and its a little bit hard to change. But other than that, this app is great! Will keep using.

title: Great app. Except...
body: Huge selection of foods to choose from! Activities selection can be improved though. Also, I can't seem to delete and remove the activities/foods I accidentally tracked down. I also can't see my other days at all. Very frustrating and disappointing because everytime I add something by accident I have to erase EVERYTHING again, go to Settings and change the date and do it one by one all over again! >:(

title: Love it, but...
body: Although I am very happy with this app, there is one thing I would change (or it is already there, and I just don't know how to access it?). There are times when I've not been able to note my foods eaten right away, and have to enter that info later in the day. Sometimes I forget something, and then remember the next day. But, I am not able to "go back in time" and enter that info. I'd like to be able to do that...

title: Love this app
body: Works super well with my eating program, shoot for 1200 calories and 85-95 carbs, and I lose 1 lb or more per week.  My only question, is the exercise portion seems to be off. I use MapMyRide and I bike ride 20 miles per day in 1 hour 10 min and My plate says much more calories burned than MapMyRide so I go with MapMyRide numbers.  My Plate likely needs to revisit their calorie counts for exercise.  This works so well for my needs, I do love it!

title: Love!
body: This app has been so much help! It has had all of the food and drink that I've needed to input. What I've really loved is the amount of carbs, protein, and fat you've ate in the day right there in a pie chart when you open the app.

title: Perfect for me
body: Update:  The interface is now perfect for how I want to use the app.  Minimal clicks to track food and summary of % calories by carb/fat/protein is always visible.  Thanks!

title: Awesome!!!
body: I got this app on a whim-- just as something to try. It's been about a week and a half and I am hooked. I've already lost three pounds, and MyPlate has become integral to my weight loss. My favorite thing is that it sets specific calorie and nutrient goals for the user that lead to awesome results. I also am really pleased that it allows you to factor in calories burned. If you commit to MyPlate, the results are amazing!!!

title: So Useful!
body: I use this app every day, & used to use the site online. I have only been tracking for 10 days, & have lost 10 lbs bc of the convenience it gives me to keep track of my calories. The o my thing I wish it had, was a bigger breakdown of what you eat. Instead of just showing you carbs, fat & protein, I'd love to see the breakdown of food groups I ate from each day. Either way, I'm going to continue to use this until I reach my goal.

title: Can't link to website?!
body: I have been using the livestrong site for about two months but more frequently over the last few weeks, I have actually lost over 50 pounds already and am working to lose another 30. I am very disappointed that all my progress from the website doesn't carry over to the ap. if there is a way I haven't found it yet! Other than that the ap and the site are great tools and make you more aware of what you put in your body!

title: Best app for nutrition tracking
body: I absolutely love this app! It's the best nutrition tracker I have yet to experience. It definitely has way more food in its database than many others which makes it much easier to use. I also like the point aspect and the social networking aspect. It makes being healthy easy and fun. I would definitely recommend it to anyone thinking about purchasing!

title: livetrong Calorie Tracker
body: Great for watching my diet-I remember to drink water & eat the correct of I did to lose wait!

title: Helpful App with just a few problems
body: Been using this app for a couple months and I find it very helpful. However, I just updated and today when I was entering in my dinner calories the app unexpectedly closed and when I opened it back up all my past entries had been deleted, which was pretty annoying since I was enjoying seeing my progress. Also, I wish there were more items recognized by the scanner.

title: Perfect if you count your own calories
body: I love this app because I can scan items I eat or input calories for items I cook. I can also manually enter the calories burned at the gym, since they're recorded for me on the machines. However, I doubt the accuracy of some of their calorie calculations (for example, lifting). As long as you are tracking your calories some other way though, it's great. Love the water and weight tracking functions too!

title: Good App. to track your food and approximate activities
body: I use this app. all day long to monitor food and water intake. Some quirky things to get used to, and since the update, it seems to keep adding repeat items to My Food list. Wish I could delete those extra items, since it takes longer to find what I want now. I have been using this for years, and it helps keep me in line with my food plans for the day.

title: Nice tool
body: Very nice tool. Gives me a good idea of my input and output. I get frustrated sometimes with finding foods. If you do the work and input things you consume and input the calories, it would make it easier because the entries stay. I think this is how the database is populated hence the "verified" information on food products. Probably how they build their database.

title: Best App for Counting Calories
body: This app does everything for you - all you do is log the food that you eat. It has a large data base, so most food is easy to find. If the exact food isn't listed, the app makes it super simple to add what you need (I eat a lot of Trader Joe's food - so simple to add to the database.) As you add each meal throughout the day, you can easily see if you need to slow down your intake.

title: Needs work
body: I like the app a lot, however it could use a few helpful options. First it would be nice if the foods in My Foods were completely editable, such as title of food and calories and if you were able to delete them completely as well. Second it needs a serving size entry space. I will say it is easier to use than others I have found.

title: Great addition to new routine
body: I downloaded this app as well as another food/exercise tracker (both free) to help keep me on track with a new, healthier routine. It's easy to use, very complete when listing food options, and even has more specialized exercises listed (P90x, for example). Granted, all of these apps are estimates when it comes to actual calories burned, but even that keeps me focused! Plus, the mPoints don't hurt. Very good app!

title: Fantastic, just one suggestion.
body: It's truly a wonderful app. Its food database is expansive, and more accurate than its competitors. It has a beautiful, modernized layout that is easy to navigate. Best of all, it gives an abundance of helpful tips and exercises to aid in your weight loss, for free! I could not ask for a better app to help me reach my goals.

title: Good layout, lacks food data
body: Unlike myfitnesspal, this app doesn't yell at me for eating too many nuts (and appears to know the difference between saturated and unsaturated fat. But it doesn't have as much data on food as myfitnesspal, be used it for 4 days now and most of the food I've eaten isn't registered when I scan it in and doesn't come up upon searching. Most is from trader joes but googling the food pulls up lots of myfitnesspal data I have to transfer. If this was improved it would be great!

title: Very user friendly
body: When my dietician suggested that I get an app to track my calories I was a little worried. But I found this one and it's great it is so easy to add the food you eat and to customize your meals. I now have three other members of my family using this app and I showed it to the dietitian and she agrees that it is one of the most user friendly calorie counting app she has seen

title: M Points not working
body: Since the latest update, M points no longer works. Unable to open achievements. Just loaded your latest update 12/15. M points still is not fixed. Your app does not link to m-points. I have almost 200 m-points that I can not redeem due to your program issue. Please fix this connection. March 9,2017- just updated My Plate with your latest version. The connection with "M Points" still does not work. I have 200+ points that I am unable to redeem

title: My Weight Loss Partner
body: Using this app in conjunction with daily exercise has helped me realize percentages of macros I need to consume on a daily basis in order to reach my weight loss goals. I have been adjusting daily to maintain my carb/fat/protein ratios for weight loss and I'm losing the pounds. Diet AND exercise is the only way for me to lose the weight and this app is extremely helpful with the diet portion. Just stick with it and be religious!

title: Like it
body: I have the free version, and I just use it to track my daily food and exercise; I haven't used the Community page or used the workouts. Anyway I really like it. It's super easy to use, I like the graphics, and it has a food data base that seems large to me. I've never had it crash or encountered a weird glitch. It's definitely helping me with my quest to live healthier.

title: One of the easiest weight control apps
body: This app will not make you lose weight by itself, but it makes entering in your calories  eaten/burned feel like a game and helps you set reasonable daily goals. I've never been great with portion control, but this app has made me so aware of what it is I eat throughout the day and tracking macros.

title: Free and saves so much time!!!
body: It's quite good and would highly recommend. Saves a lot of time doing tons of calculations for you and gives you everything you need. Gives you some workouts. Tells you how many calories you should eat based on the information you gave it. And even has a community to chat with about workout and diets. Awesome highly recommen.

title: Works nicely
body: I like that you can track the food that you eat. Almost everything is on the list of foods. Even if you don't know what it is exactly. Or you can add a special meal that your family eats a lot. The app tracks how many calories you have left after lunch. So you can tell what to eat for dinner. If you wanted to get the gold package it is not too much per month.

title: Nice searches, weak on details
body: The search function for different foods is great, but this app lacks a lot of useful detail. For instance, it tracks total carbs in the daily diary graph, but it doesn't differentiate between regular carbs and fiber. It also doesn't give total grams consumed of the macros, such as total carbs, protein, and fat for the day (just the aforementioned pie graph).

title: Keeping me on track!
body: Love this app- it's helping me stay on track with my goals and keeping me accountable for the calories that I intake. Only think that would be great is if there was a way to fix what day you were on if you tracked your whole day on the wrong date... But that's a user problem (me)! Love bring able to learn about what exercises burn the most calories and the encouragement of the community is great! Definitely recommend it!

title: Good app, but annoying at times
body: I wish there was more quality control on the food database; it's sometimes difficult to find a valid food item. I love the capability to scan UPC codes! If there is going to be crowd sourced data, an option to submit a new food item to an admin for validation would be great.

title: Better than Under Armer Calorie Tracker App
body: I have been on this app for about 20 minutes and can tell within minutes this app is way better than the highly talked under Armer app.  This app allows you to search for foods, even shows picture, has all the food info to plug into your report and the app is very user friendly.  Telling friends about this app.  Great one!!

title: Loving this app
body: I've been using this app for a month now and I love it. It's easy to track my food and record my workouts to get an accurate evaluation on my calories in and out. Plus it tracks my steps.

title: Part of my lifestyle now. Helps diabetic.
body: This is a very valuable part of my effort to lose weight and get my diabetes better controlled. What it does, it does well. I do wish it had blood sugar tracking and correlation with what I ate. Also wish it recorded the time that I ate to assist blood sugar control.

title: Easiest to use and nicest looking
body: I tested just about every calorie tracking app on the App Store. This one was the nicest looking and easiest to use. If I could change one thing about it, it would be to improve The foods database, in many locations it cannot find the barcode of certain foods.

title: It's good but
body: For people like me who do not eat out and do not eat out of boxes it is harder to track your meals. I have no idea how many calories or fat is in a vegan tuna sandwich. So it's hard for me to say I had a vegan tuna sandwich. These kinds of apps are great for people who are eating out of boxes or restaurants. And what I really like about this app is that I can repeat stuff that I have every single day. That is wonderful but it is hard for me to say everything that I eat!
response: Hello and thank you for your review! You can create your own custom Meals and search for the specific items in the vegan sandwich. Please email us at support@livestrong.com if you have any questions or need assistance!

title: Only one thing that could make it better!
body: I have to say out of all the calories tracking apps that allow teens, this is my favorite one. However, there isn't an independent section for restaurants so when I go out it is more difficult to find the food that I ate out for example when I search Chili's as in the restaurant I get a bunch of actual chilis. So please add something in one of your future updates please.

title: 5 star app but the syncing is killing any progress tracking
body: Love the food options and general functionality. Been using it for years. Lately it hasn't been syncing between my phone and iPad though which makes it pretty useless. If I can't look back a few days to see totals (right now it shows a total of 800 cal on my phone and 400 on my iPad bc they aren't synced) or use the graphing I paid for, it doesn't do me much good. Really hope that gets fixed soon. Love it otherwise.

title: Good stuff
body: I've been using this app now for a few weeks and I really love it.  It's easy to use and has totally helped me to stay on track with my calorie intake.  I wanted something quick and simple and portable, and this app on my iPhone fit the bill!  Esp. like being able to see graphs of progress over time.  I didn't get that when I was just writing it down on a notepad!

title: Calorie tracker is nice but confusing sometimes.
body: I really like the calorie tracker, but merging mobile app and website calorie tracking seems to be lacking in continuity, and the vast number of calorie differences for the same food are trying sometimes. I usually end up taking the average of several entries if there are more than 5 choices for the same food. For example, an egg has anywhere from 70 to 90 calories. I usually just record 80 calories for one egg, the average of the two.

title: Buggy...
body: I previously gave a good review if this app, but now am starting to notice problems with it.  It allows you to create your own foods to track calories but will not remember them after a few days. I cannot get the My Foods or Custom Foods selections to show anything; maybe it's because I have the free version, but there isn't a way to make them work.  Contacting the developers gets you nowhere...I do like how you can track water intake, but I found Lose It to be more comprehensive with fewer bugs.

title: Live strong
body: Just wanted an easy and organized way to reduce my calorie intake. Love the way it is set up and automated search finds most foods. I have never counted calories until I got this app. Now my wife, daughter & several co-workers are using it also. Simply seeing the total calories as the day goes on makes it easy to meet your goals. I'm down 5 pounds in the first week by choosing more wisely.

title: Crashes all the time
body: Great for calorie tracking (internet lookup, barcode scanning for US items, or manual entering) but this program crashes all the time.  Seems to happen most often when you change a serving size from anything but 1.00, but all crashes are related to calculation of calories.  Bit silly when that's the entire purpose of the program.  Also I can't figure out how to change your calorie goal once it is set, but that's probably user error.   If they can fix the crashing, then I would gladly rate it 5 Stars.

title: Very User Friendly
body: I've been using this app for two years to stay aware of my fitness goals. Used correctly, this app is an easy place to track and measure your dietary and weight habits and goals. Easy to use, with lots of info set up already, this app will give you a leg up on a lot of other workout or fitness apps with a more limited scope. Highly recommended.

title: No longer works
body: I really enjoyed the large list of foods that this app has. I could put just about any food in the app and it would know all of the nutritional information for me. All I really had to pay attention to was the serving size. It was really handy since I am on a Ketogenic diet that needs to maintain certain percentages of carbs, protein, and fat.

title: Love!! Easy to use and great if you're trying to lose weight!
body: I've been using this app for about a year now and I even got it for my computer so I could still log my meals and workouts when I don't have my phone.  It's definitely helped me maintain a healthier lifestyle and lose weight! I went through many apps before I found this one but I'm glad I found it!

title: Nice app
body: I've not used the app long but pleased that I have a way to track what I eat and weight exercise etc without having to manually keep a log.  I wish I could use it to track my blood glucose levels as well.  I may upgrade as soon as I get the hang of this app and see how faithful I can be in using it daily.  Would also be nice if I could sync my lab results from the doctor here too.  One stop shopping for me that way.

title: Easy Fun Way to Track Keto Diet
body: This application is great and easy to use.  Totally intuitive and easy to figure out!  This makes keeping track of the grams of fat, protein and carbohydrate simple and fun.  The application is beautifully designed and is accurate enough for the needs of most!  I would recommend this to anyone who feels the  tracking for ketosis is too difficult.

title: Use everyday!
body: Great app to keep track of calorie intake. Mostly everything that I eat is listed. Some items will even say how much of a quantity it is and you can adjust how much of that you ate. Wish that it had some other activities for exercise listed. For example mowing the lawn in 97 degrees weather am I suppose to use gardening for that?? Then walking while pushing a stroller showed less cal burned than just the walking one. Otherwise great app for free!! :)

title: Constant Crashing
body: I have to delete and re-install this app several times each week because after a certain point, it won't record anything.  when it's working, it seems to record meals, calories and activities just fine and port them over to the Apple Health App (which is why I got this app in the first place).  I am a long time user of the Livestrong Daily Plate website and it has been a big factor in my weight loss and general health.  I was expecting the a similar experience with this app and am so far disappointed.

title: Easy to use
body: The tracking functions make it very easy to know where you are in attaining my goals. I use to use another tracker similar to this one but over time they added so many features and shuffled what I needed to use it became worthless to me.

title: SO MUCH BETTER THAN MYFITNESS PAL
body: Such an amazing app! My husband who's a personal trainer recommended I try this over my other tracking apps and I fell in love! It gives you a huge database and tracking is easy and fun! All micros calories, water intake, exercise on one page so no skipping around trying to look at stats! I have used MYFITNESS pal for years and even with their improvements this app is so much better! Love love love it!

title: Love it.
body: I'm really enjoying using the app. So far everything I've searched for or similar enough has been found. I would love there to be a way to change an entry from one meal type to another (eg change a bagel from bfast to lunch) without having to delete and re-enter. Also would love to see a graph on each category tracking page that shows the breakdown of, say, my daily total carbs per food tracked that day. Thx.

title: Love it.
body: I'm really enjoying using the app. So far everything I've searched for or similar enough has been found. I would love there to be a way to change an entry from one meal type to another (eg change a bagel from bfast to lunch) without having to delete and re-enter. Also would love to see a graph on each category tracking page that shows the breakdown of, say, my daily total carbs per food tracked that day. Thx.

title: Best
body: Over the years I have used a number calorie tracking websites and apps. For me personally I find this one to be the easiest to keep up with and most accurate. The layout is very users friendly allowing you to track not just your food, but also water and exercise etc... Without being complicated. Perfect for a busy mom of four.

title: not enough calorie info
body: it doesn't recognize or find tons of store bought foods or restaurant foods and a lot of times when it does, the nutrition facts don't match up to the packaging or menus. Sometimes there are tons of different options for one food that all have different calorie amounts so the app doesn't seem very consistent or accurate and I can't trust it. It also tracks my steps but half way through the day it will just reset my burned calories back to zero which is really frustrating when I want an accurate reading.

title: Bring back macro totals!
body: Edit: Macro totals have been corrected and show total/goal. Thanks for listening to your customers!

title: I love this app!
body: This has been the best fitness app I have ever used. It's made tracking my daily calorie intake so easy. Yes, sometimes you have to log it yourself because it won't come up when you search it, but personally that hasn't bothered me much, I will continue to use this app and I recommend it to anyone trying to lose/gain a few pounds, or just get in shape.

title: Excellent!!!
body: This app rocks! I used the weight watchers app for three months and was frustrated by the amount of time it took me to find my food, plus it crashed A LOT. I am able to find the foods I eat everyday and adding them to my plate is simple. The breakdown of carbs, fats, and proteins for each day shows how much of each you are consuming. The community is very supportive and provides realistic advice.

title: Good but could be better
body: Great for keeping a close watch on intake. Wish some of the features like "Recently Eaten" and "Frequently  Eaten" foods accurately showed those items. Would be nice, also if there were a way to see your exercise tracking on a long range graph to note consistency. But, it's pretty good for a free app--down almost 10 lbs. since I started tracking. Plus, the free gift cards are a nice bonus although they are getting harder to get.

title: Would recommend to my friends
body: Love this app! Very easy to use! have recommended this app to lots of friends! There is a few things I would change however. The exercise input area needs more of the newer workout programs and the food input area would be better with a barcode scan feature but other than that this app is awesome!

title: Great App
body: I downloaded this app on my iPad. It isn't hard to figure out. You can set your goal, track your weight loss so adjusts your goal according to your weight, and it has a fantastic food database that stores all the nutrition information, and if that food isn't in there, you can enter it manually and it stores it. So far, this app has helped me stay focus and lose five lbs. love it.

title: Not as good as I expected
body: The overall concepts are great and fairly easy to navigate. One problem I had was having all the info show up on my iPhone from my iPad; only some of it. Also, when I manually put in the nutritional info, the pie chart showed different numbers than what I entered. Would be nice if it included sodium and sugars. It would also be good if it showed the ingredients in say, a salad that was in the database so I would know accuracy when comparing my version with same or similar name.

title: Simple is good
body: The simplicity of this app is the best part of it. If you're looking for something simple and easy to track calories and weight this is for you. The only problem I've had is scanning bar codes. It rarely works so I have to search manually. And watch out for the sync problems that others have mentioned. Because of that I don't sync between devices in fear of losing all my historical data.

title: It works for me!
body: I have not tried any other app to compare with this one. That being said, this one works for me and I'm happy not to change. I've lost 3 pounds in the last 10 days and I cheated two of those days.

title: Looping
body: I love the app myself, but my boyfriend is unable to log in. It keeps saying his email is incorrect. We tried changing his password but that didn't work either. I really wish he could download and log into the app because I love it and it is so helpful to me to track my protein after Bariatric surgery. A suggestion related to that is to allow a person to set a lower goal of calories. We are to get at least 60 grams of protein a day but the app requires more due to the calorie level.
response: Hi- thanks for the review! Please have your boyfriend email us at support@livestrong.com so we can help him with registration.

title: Huge flaw that keeps happening
body: It's annoying enough (and has been happening for so long) that I finally just downloaded MyFitnessPal, after years of loyalty here.
response: Hi ash- thank you for your review and feedback. When you initially emailed us about this, we were not aware of the bug that was causing this issue. We have since identified the issue and are working on a fix. We apologize for the inconvenience and hope to have this resolved soon.

title: Either lose weight or gain...no maintain weight?
body: Didn't get very far into the app. First question when setting up is "what is your primary goal?  - lose weight -gain weight"
response: Hello! Thank you for your review and feedback. Please note that once you have registered for an account, you can change your goal to maintain your weight by going to Account > Edit Profile > Weekly Target.

title: Love it!!!
body: This app is my favorite! I told it my weight, my activity level and weight loss goal.  It told me how many calories I should eat each day and it counts down as I enter in the foods I eat.  It's helping me make good choices and motivating me to exercise (you get to eat more calories!) I've lost five pounds in ten days.  Thank you!!!!  (I gave it four stars because it won't load videos on the mpoints --- love getting points and rewards for healthy choices!)

title: Awesome app
body: This app is awesome. Very easy to use and helps track your progress and daily calorie counts. I do find they are a bit generous in how many calories you burn in some exercises. Also, since the latest update, it doesn't split out your recent foods by category( breakfast, lunch, dinner), so it is a bit cumbersome  when you want to just look up recently eaten foods. Still a great app. I have lost 22 lbs in the last 8 weeks with the help of this app.

title: Very effective, but too many pop-ups
body: This app is perfect for what it is meant to do. It really effectively helps me track what I eat, and I've lost weight using it so far! However, there are pop ups for achievements literally every time you enter in that you ate something. Every. Time. I disabled M points and paid the dollar to hide the ads, but the amount of time-wasting distractions in this app even after that is so excessive.

title: Wow- I've lost 4lbs already!
body: Studies show that tracking what you eat makes you more aware of what you consume, and it works! This app made it possible, and I've only had it for 2 weeks or so. It's so incredibly easy to use, and I love it! Only one minor complaint is that the exercise that you track doesn't show how many calories you've burned anymore like it used to...

title: Good enough
body: I was using my fitness pal for about 3 years and I needed a change of scenery so I tried this. The most frustrating thing is not being able to see my vitamin intake for each day. Also because of the way the menu is set up, sometimes when trying to scroll down it'll click on one of the items instead of letting me scroll.

title: Very Helpful
body: While I'm sure I don't use this app to its full potential, for what I need it for (counting calories and giving me macro nutrient percentages from the total food I've eaten in a day) it serves it's purpose well. This app has a lot of foods already I putted into its system so usually when I look for the food I've eaten, they have it. Definitely would recommend to anyone looking to count his or her daily calories and keep an eye on their macros.

title: Love App but has two annoying issues!
body: I really enjoy making use of this app however there are two issues that need fixing. The first is where I set the app to Kilograms and NOT Pounds. Every so often it reverts back to Pounds and I have to reset it. Secondly, lately I have noticed that a lot of the manually entered items has '(manual)' adde to end of the name when I did not save it as such AND the calorie amount randomly doubles (per single serving) on some of my manually entered items. Please fix.

title: Fast, Easy, Helpful
body: This app is very easy to use. It's easy to navigate and you can clearly see your goals and progress. It's definitely helped me keep track of my fitness goals. Thanks! One issue is that when my calorie goal changes, my progress chart changes to that goal so it says that I've been over my goal for months, when I was under the goal I had at that time. Please fix that issue. Thank you!

title: Good app, terrible ad implementation
body: I was really excited to start using this app but after 5 days, a pop up ad came up and wouldn't go away no matter how many times I tried to force quit the program. It made the app unusable because it just kept coming up. That shouldn't happen in an app of this caliber. It felt like they were really pushing you to upgrade from the free app and I don't like being pushed, especially when I'm trying out an app to decide if I want to keep it.

title: i love this app!
body: i love tracking my proteins and carbohydrates and things through this app. I'm trying to build a lot of muscle so its helpful to be able to just scan in a barcode from whatever food im making then knowing how much protein ive had. i wish it tracked food groups too so i could make sure im eating a balanced amount every week but i know thatd be hard to track.

title: Superb
body: This app should be downloaded on every iPad as a matter of course.  I was just looking for a simple calorie counter, which this is, but it's so much more.  If you input a few not-too-invasive stats it will guide you as to how many calories you can eat each day depending on your activity level and how many pounds per week you wish to lose. I recommend this wholeheartedly.

title: Helped me lose the remaining 5 lbs!
body: I use this thing almost everyday! It has all the basics of bmi, weight tracker, calorie counters, and weight goal calculator. The calculator takes exercise into account as well!  I love that it saves a record of my eaten foods, lets me search for a food's nv, or fill in my own! It's perfect for when you don't have time to exercise but still

title: See food differently
body: Tracking my food is so much harder tha n I expected, so it helps that I can place it all in this app. I never realized how much I'm eating üò• so this is putting me on the right track. I like the idea that if you input exercise it "decreases" your cals so it's a great way to motivate you to work out if you are overeating to keep your goal. Would like to see more accurate cal reading for some meals so maybe on the next update? But so far so good üòÅ

title: Improving with every upgrade
body: MyPlate continues to improve with every upgrade. I've been using it for over a year and it is excellent product which meets my needs perfectly.  If you want to lose weight and stay fit, the first step is understanding what food you eat and than making the food changes to improve your health.

title: Pretty Good but.....
body: This is a pretty good app but it could be so much more.  I wish the daily summary was more extensive - fruit and veg servings, grains, fiber, sodium etc. Lumping carbs into one category is pretty obscure. I also wish the exercise options were better. It seems pretty limited.  For example - there is water aerobics, water Zumba, water yoga, water circuit training and this is true for land classes too. You should add Cize, Barre, circuit training, PiYo and more. It's not all about lifting weights.

title: Fast, accurate, huge database
body: Works great to track calories in.  Enormous database of foods are searchable with really great search capability. All key data attached to each food item.  Other solid features with free version like weight tracking and reminders.

title: Love this app!
body: I love this app!  I've tried a few of the others, and this one is the first I found that tracks protein, fat and calories (and your ratio of each) in the free version. It's easy to add foods, and saves recently used choices. I do wish it had common exercises and the calorie burn with each, but that's something that's easy to calculate on your own. Overall a great app.

title: Almost perfect!
body: This is the most useful app I've found for me to track exercise and calories. To me, what would make it perfect is for me to be able to track calcium. I need to keep up with this to prevent osteoporosis and would love to be able to keep up with my daily intake here. I suggest having the option to track certain nutrients and electrolytes, for those who need to keep up with sodium for blood pressure, etc.

title: Thank you for the change!
body: Thank you so much for going back to the main screen found on earlier versions of the app. I love having one less screen to go to in order to track food intake and it looks really clean still. Thanks for listening to our comments and making the change. Fantastic, easy to use app!

title: Wonderful
body: I've been trying to find a tracker that lets me set my own intake and macro goals (I have a dangerously low metabolism) so it's nice to finally have accurate numbers for calorie intake. The sole downside is that it doesn't have an option to log independent workouts (when I'm on machines at the gym my phone stays on it so it doesn't get clunked). Other than that, I love it, very easy to use and a little tinkering finds about everything.
response: Hello! We are so glad that you're enjoying the MyPlate app. You can log your independent workouts by creating a custom exercise! Custom exercises are super easy to create and will save you time tracking:

title: Great for OCD tracking
body: If you are anything like me you will love the ease of tracking each bite of food with the search tool and each ounce of water. I love watching my calories vs my exercise calories. I'm visual and enjoy the simple things in life an this is simple and keeps me on track.

title: Good start, needs a few additions
body: I really like this app. It allows me to enter in foods automatically, or manually if the system does not have my meal recorded.

title: Lifesaver!!!
body: My Plate has been a lifesaver for me! I realize that the key to losing weight & staying healthy is 70% diet & 30% exercise. My Plate gives me the opportunity to track both. I love all of the different features of the app & how it will remind me if I don't track my food one day. It's my accountability partner & has definitely helped me to lose weight & make better food choices. Thanks!

title: Must have this app!!
body: If you are trying to loose weight and need a little help THIS APP IS FOR YOU!! I'm 13 and if I can use it I think you can too! It really breaks everything down. It gives you a amount of calories after typing in your weight and height and it gives you more calories when you work out their is also a lot more cool features DEFIANTLY my favorite app!

title: Needs more exercises in search and calories left
body: Fairly good. I like the concept and most features but wish it would do two things that it does NOT do. 1.) Show calories eaten in a total number, not just what's been used of  the bar. 2.) Show more exercises in search. I can't find CrossFit, cardio, HIT, high intensity. medium intensity, or intervals. I do NOT do static cardio and you burn WAY more calories than this thing shows when you try to track HIT training. The same will go for a mix of weights and cardio.

title: Overall great app
body: There've been a few technical glitches with the most recent update (food search showing no results) but overall I've really enjoyed this app and have been using it a long time. The foods I want are almost always in there which is great, and it's super easy to add new ones. It's also very intuitive and user friendly.

title: Awesome
body: Best diet tracker ever. Highly recommend !!!!   If you are serious about tracking your food and nutrition this is the app you want.  I was able to see that I was not getting enough protein and then easily made adjustments.  I love the ability to track my workouts and see it taken off the total calories.  Get this app. You won't be disappointed!

title: Can't be beat
body: I've used this website since before it was with Livestrong - It was The Daily Plate (2006). It keeps getting better!  The app has gone through a LOT of changes and I'm finally happy with it.

title: BEST THING EVER
body: Many many workout apps kick me off once it knows I'm only 17 and thinks I'm to young to be participating.
